eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: When attempting to start a needed miki-rebuild of [parentName], it is found that [childName] is currently not I/O-able. The miki-rebuild cannot proceed, and the Amf will remain suspended.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: child \"%s\" of \"%s\" is not I
details.internalDescription: The firwmare could not allocate buffer space in order to perform a needed miki-rebuild of Distributed RAID-1.
details.formatString: child \"%s\" of \"%s\" is not I

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The tower has abandoned a miki-rebuild of distributed RAID-1 [parentName]. This has happened because a change in the set of directors in the Plex has occurred. The miki-rebuild will be restarted as soon as the new set of directors has stabilized (should be within a second or two).

details.customerDescription: abandoned miki-rebuild based on slot %u of \"%s\" after %u blocks
details.formatString: abandoned miki-rebuild based on slot %u of \"%s\" after %u blocks

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: As a result of a miki-rebuild failing (e.g. storage volumes not reachable), the miki-rebuild code is marking the local child of the distributed RAID-1 as out of date. This sounds strange, since the local child is the data source for the miki-rebuild, but it makes sense. A miki rebuild is designed to make a set of "winning" clusters consistent. The data from the detached cluster does not have to be saved, since the admin has declared that cluster as detached. So, if this director wanted to do a miki-rebuild to bring other clusters in sync with its cluster, and can't, it is OK to simply mark this cluster as out-of-date, even though it might have a few of the blocks from the detached writer that other clusters don't.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Take corrective action, if necessary, to reconnect any disconnected devices. Contact EMC Technical Support for assistance.

details.customerDescription: Marking child \"%s\" of \"%s\" out-of-date
details.internalDescription: A miki-rebuild has failed. (The reason will already have been identified in a separate event.) In order to restore access while minimizing data inconsistency, the local child of the distributed RAID-1 has been marked as out of date and weill be completely rebuilt when possible.
details.formatString: Marking child \"%s\" of \"%s\" out-of-date

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [This event is now obsolete - it is no longer produced.] The request to abandon the clone [cloneName] (i.e., command "amf abandonclone [cloneName]") has been abandoned because a group change has occurred before the request could complete. A group change is when a director joins or leaves the group of running directors.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Once the Plex has stabilized, so that directors are neither departing nor arriving, re-issue the request to abandon the clone.

details.customerDescription: Attempt to abandon clone \"%s\" cancelled
details.internalDescription: While the Plex was processing an abandon clone command, a director either booted up or shut down. To preserve Plex integrity, all in-process requests to abandon clones are cancelled when this happens.
details.formatString: Attempt to abandon clone \"%s\" cancelled

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The request to detach the clone [cloneName] (i.e., command "amf removeclone [cloneName]") has been abandoned because a group change has occurred before the request could complete. A group change is when a director joins or leaves the group of running directors. This event is issued on the master amg director only.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Once the Plex has stabilized, so that directors are neither departing nor arriving, re-issue the request to detach the mirror.

details.customerDescription: Attempt to detach mirror \"%s\" cancelled
details.internalDescription: While the Plex was processing a detach mirror command, a director either booted up or shut down. To preserve Plex integrity, all in-process requests to detach mirrors are cancelled when this happens.
details.formatString: Attempt to detach mirror \"%s\" cancelled

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The mirror number [mirrorNum] of device set [parentName] could not be removed because a group change has occurred before the request could complete. A group change is when a director joins or leaves the group of running directors. This event is issued on the master amg director only.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Once the Plex has stabilized, so that directors are neither departing nor arriving, re-issue the request to remove the mirror.

details.customerDescription: Attempt to remove mirror %u of device \"%s\" cancelled
details.internalDescription: While the Plex was attempting to remove a mirror, a director either booted up or shut down. To preserve Plex integrity, all in-process requests to remove mirrors are cancelled when this happens.
details.formatString: Attempt to remove mirror %u of device \"%s\" cancelled

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The cluster [hidingClusterId] is able to see storage volume [storageVolumeId], even though that storage volume logically belongs to another cluster ([owningClusterId]). [hidingClusterId] cluster is enforcing the logical ownership by hiding the visibility of the storage volume. This message likely indicates a zoning problem, because remote storage volumes should not be directly visible.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Reconfigure cabling or switches (zoning) so that each cluster can only see its local storage volumes. Use 'array re-discover' command to remove the remote storage volumes.

details.customerDescription: Hiding a pseudo-remote storage volume from another cluster.
details.internalDescription: The ability to see a remote storage volume indicates a configuration error. The Plex is working around this problem by hiding the visibility of the storage volume.
details.formatString: cluster %u hiding pseudo-remote storage volume %s from cluster %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A log volume is not available (e.g. it might be suspended because of a failure recovery) when we need to write to the log because of a write to the indicated distributed RAID-1 that is coming from a mini-rebuild of that device. To avoid a deadlock in this rare case, we fail the log update, which will cause the local RAID-1 child to be marked as fully out of date.

details.customerDescription: failing dist RAID-1 logging during mini-rebuild of \"%s\"
details.formatString: failing dist RAID-1 logging during mini-rebuild of \"%s\"

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: If seen after startup, the metadata amf specified will have the amfs created from the headers that are stored on it. If seen after transferring metadata, metadata amf [amfName] now has all the amf headers stored on it.

details.customerDescription: Metadata amf \"%s\" successfully activated
details.internalDescription: If seen shortly after startup, this amf has been chosen as the active metadata volume. If seen shortly after transferring metadata to a new volume, then the metadata info has been written to the specified volume. This may have been done in response to a failure on the previously- used metadata volume, or a planned move of the metadata to a new volume.
details.formatString: Metadata amf \"%s\" successfully activated

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: For the specified metadata amf, a timer could not be started that waits for other metadata amfs to arrive before creating the amfs stored on the most up-to-date metadata amf. The headers stored on this metadata amf will be created.

details.customerDescription: metaAmf \"%s\": could not start timer
details.formatString: metaAmf \"%s\": could not start timer

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The currently active metadata amf has become unhealthy and it has one or more of the AMF_DEADNESS_FLAGS set.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The active meta-volume has become unhealthy.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Either resurrect or fix the failed metadata amf, or transfer the metadata to another healthy metadata amf using the command "amf movemeta".
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Create another meta-volume as soon as possible, and use "meta-volume move" command to save the cache data to the newly created meta-volume.

details.customerDescription: Active metadata device or storage volume is not healthy.
details.internalDescription: The metadata info is at risk. It is in cache only, and needs to be written to storage volume.
details.formatString: Active metadata device or storage volume %s is not healthy

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A thread could not be created to restore the metadata contained on this metadata amf.

details.customerDescription: meta device or storage volume \"%s\": could not restore metadata config
details.formatString: meta device or storage volume \"%s\": could not restore metadata config

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This is an escape hole for mikis. A cluster that is detached still has elements on its miki queues. We don't have undo miki rebuilds at the moment, so we're forced to mark that cluster's mirror as fully out of date.

details.customerDescription: Stale miki info on detached cluster %u forcing child \"%s\" of dr1 \"%s\" to be marked out of date
details.internalDescription: The mirror of the specified device has been marked as fully out of date in order to resolve some internal block differences. This can happen in an unstable network, in combination with cluster detaches.
details.formatString: Stale miki info on detached cluster %u forcing child \"%s\" of dr1 \"%s\" to be marked out of date

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Another escape hole. A mirror is being switched from a loser to a winner, without fixing up the differences that arose when it became a loser. In order to save our sanity, we're marking the mirror out of date.

details.customerDescription: Mirror \"%s\" of dr1 \"%s\" is being marked fully out of date upon detaching cluster %u, due to undo logs for child \"%s\"
details.internalDescription: The mirror of the specified device was previously detached, but had not resolved that detachment. Now another mirror is being detached. To preserve data consistency, the first mirror is being marked as fully out of date.
details.formatString: Mirror \"%s\" of dr1 \"%s\" is being marked fully out of date upon detaching cluster %u, due to undo logs for child \"%s\"

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: All distributed rebuilds are killed and restarted during cluster group changes. This event simply matches the rebuild-started message in that case.

details.customerDescription: raid 1 rebuild: %s: child node %u (%s) rebuild killed (%s rebuild)
details.internalDescription: The rebuild has stopped because of the arrival or departure of a cluster. If it can be restarted after the handling of the cluster event, it will be.
details.formatString: raid 1 rebuild: %s: child node %u (%s) rebuild killed (%s rebuild)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: We're likely running out of memory, and failed a timer alloc. We'll probably see other bad symptoms shortly after this one.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Failed to allocate timer for %s setting on device or storage volume \"%s\", doing the detach now (instead of waiting %u seconds).
details.internalDescription: The Plex attempted to allocate a timer to wait for a configured number of seconds before taking action on a detach setting for the specified device. This allocation failed, however, so the action was taken immediately.
details.formatString: Failed to allocate timer for %s setting on device or storage volume \"%s\", doing the detach now (instead of waiting %u seconds).

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Occurs after an "amf setloser" or "amf setmajority" setting fires. Cached data will be discarded - this is I/O from the host, which YY previously acknowledged, but which was never written to storage volume. Or, if it made it to storage volume temporarily, until the link came back and we realized this cluster is a loser, and then the data gets overwritten by data from the winning cluster(s).
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Restore communication link or remote cluster.

details.customerDescription: %s setting marked cluster %u detached wrt device or storage volume \"%s\".
details.internalDescription: A detach setting has expired, leading to the detaching of the specified cluster from the specified device. If all missing clusters have been detached, then I/O can resume at the remaining clusters.
details.formatString: %s setting marked cluster %u detached wrt device or storage volume \"%s\".

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Memory and buffer space to do a sparse rebuild could not be allocated, so we've had to mark a child of a DR1 as fully out-of-date instead.

details.customerDescription: failed mini-rebuild of [amfName] - no memory
details.internalDescription: A memory shortage has prevented the Plex from performing a log- based rebuild to correct a small set of child differences. Because of that, the Plex will have to mark a child as being completely out-of-date so that it can be rebuilt later, while allowing I/O to continue at present.
details.formatString: failed mini-rebuild of %s - no memory

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The amf node [parentName] of type [parentType] (allowed values: raid0, raid1, raidc) could not be inserted above the amf node [childName], because some controller was unable to flush its cache. This is almost certainly due to one or more storage volumes being dead or unreachable.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check for unreachable or dead storage volumes in the device. Contact EMC Technical Support to manually replace any failed storage volumes.

details.customerDescription: Attempt to insert amf \"%s\" type %s above amf \"%s\" failed
details.internalDescription: One or more directors was not able to flush cached data to one or more storage volumes in the device. A device cannot be inserted into a device tree that is in this state.
details.formatString: Attempt to insert amf \"%s\" type %s above amf \"%s\" failed

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The amf node [parentName] has been successfully inserted above [childName] in the containing amf tree. This event is issued on the master amg director only.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is needed.

details.customerDescription: inserted amf \"%s\" type %s above amf \"%s\"
details.internalDescription: A new device has been inserted into a device tree in response to a user request to do so.
details.formatString: inserted amf \"%s\" type %s above amf \"%s\"

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The amf node [parentName], which is the parent of [childName], could not be removed. This is because some controller was unable to flush its cache, which is almost certainly due to one or more storage volumes being dead or unreachable.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check for unreachable or dead storage volumes in the device. Contact EMC Technical Support to manually replace any failed storage volumes.

details.customerDescription: Attempt to remove amf \"%s\" above amf \"%s\" failed
details.internalDescription: One or more directors was not able to flush cached data to one or more storage volumes in the device tree. A device cannot be removed from a device tree that is in this state.
details.formatString: Attempt to remove amf \"%s\" above amf \"%s\" failed

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The amf node [parentName] has been successfully removed from an amf tree, from the position above amf node [childName]. This event is issued on the master amg director only.

details.customerDescription: removed amf \"%s\" above amf \"%s\"
details.internalDescription: A new device has been removed from a device tree in response to a user request to do so.
details.formatString: removed amf \"%s\" above amf \"%s\"

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The attempt to insert amf node [parentName] above [childName] in the amf tree has been cancelled because a group change occurred before the request could complete. A group change is when a director joins or leaves the group of running directors. This event is issued on the master amg director only.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Once the Plex has stabilized, so that directors are neither departing nor arriving, re-issue the request to insert the device.

details.customerDescription: Attempt to insert device \"%s\" above device or storage volume \"%s\" cancelled
details.internalDescription: While the Plex was attempting to insert a device into a device tree, a director either booted up or shut down. To preserve Plex integrity, all in-process requests to insert a device into a tree are cancelled when this happens.
details.formatString: Attempt to insert device \"%s\" above device or storage volume \"%s\" cancelled

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The attempt to remove amf node [parentName] from its place above [childName] in the amf tree has been cancelled because a group change occurred before the request could complete. A group change is when a director joins or leaves the group of running directors. This event is issued on the master amg director only.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Once the Plex has stabilized, so that directors are neither departing nor arriving, re-issue the request to insert the device.

details.customerDescription: Attempt to remove device \"%s\" above device or storage volume \"%s\" cancelled
details.internalDescription: While the Plex was attempting to remove a device from a device tree, a director either booted up or shut down. To preserve Plex integrity, all in-process requests to remove a device from a tree are cancelled when this happens.
details.formatString: Attempt to remove device \"%s\" above device or storage volume \"%s\" cancelled

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Cached data will be discarded - this is I/O from the host, which YY previously acknowledged, but which was never written to storage volume. Or, if it made it to storage volume temporarily, until the link came back and we realized this cluster is a loser, and then the data gets overwritten by data from the winning cluster(s).
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Restore communication link or remote cluster.

details.customerDescription: Cluster %u detached wrt device or storage volume \"%s\" from command.
details.internalDescription: The administrator issued a command to detach the specified cluster from the specified device. If all missing clusters have been detached, then I/O can resume at the remaining clusters.
details.formatString: Cluster %u detached wrt device or storage volume \"%s\" from command.

details.customerDescription: Local cluster (%u) previously detached from device or storage volume \"%s\" by administrator at another cluster.
details.internalDescription: At some time in the past, an administrator at another cluster had declared this cluster as detached from the given device. This cluster has now come in contact with a cluster that knows that, and is learning about the detachment.
details.formatString: Local cluster (%u) previously detached from device or storage volume \"%s\" by administrator at another cluster.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No action, or attempt to restore communication to the specified cluster.

details.customerDescription: Cluster %u previously detached from device or storage volume \"%s\" by administrator at another cluster.
details.internalDescription: At some time in the past, an administrator at another cluster had declared the specified cluster as detached from the specified device. This cluster has now come in contact with a cluster that knows that, and is learning about that detachment.
details.formatString: Cluster %u previously detached from device or storage volume \"%s\" by administrator at another cluster.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If the performance implications of this value are important, correct the configuration and restart the tower. Contact EMC Technical Support if you are not aware of setting this parameter.

details.customerDescription: ramfagg kw expected unsigned int, got %s
details.internalDescription: When the director is started up, it can be passed a series of parameters to alter its default behaviour. The value for one of those, "ramfagg", was not in the expected numeric format.
details.formatString: ramfagg kw expected unsigned int, got %s

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If the performance implications of this value are important, correct the configuration and restart the tower. Contact EMC Technical Support if you are not aware of setting this parameter.

details.customerDescription: ramfagg kw too big: %s
details.internalDescription: When the director is started up, it can be passed a series of parameters to alter its default behaviour. The value for one of those, "ramfagg", was larger than is supported.
details.formatString: ramfagg kw too big: %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Amf component detected that two different virtual volume objects have the same name, [volumeName]. The first of these virtual volumes has id [vId] and is attached to the amf named [amfName]. The second virtual volume has id [vId2] and is attached to the amf name [amfName2]. The Amf component renamed the second virtual volume to [volumeName2] to prevent a conflict. This occurs because of either (1) a conflict in configuration information that cannot be resolved without manual intervention, or (2) a conflict that occurred because one virtual volume is cluster-local while the other is visible to all clusters. The renaming does not resolve the conflict, but it makes it possible for EMC Technical Support to manually resolve the conflict. (The resolving should be done with the use of the "amf rename" command.)
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Manual intervention is required. Contact EMC Technical Support to resolve the conflict.

details.arguments: virtualVolumeName vId amfName vId2 amfName2 virtualVolumeName2
details.customerDescription: Name conflict detected, renaming 2nd occurrence.
details.internalDescription: Two discovered virtual volumes reported the same name. This can occur if configuration changes are made when one or more storage volumes are unreachable, if storage devices from separate plexs with existing device sets are merged into one Plex or if a device becomes visible to all clusters and happens to have the same name as a cluster-local device on one cluster.
details.formatString: name conflict: virtual volume \"%s\" id/device-or-storageVolumename 0x%llx/%s vs 0x%llx/%s - renaming 2nd occurrence to \"%s\"

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Amf component has detected that a child amf has a virtual volume, and it has corrected this by persistently moving the virtual volume to the parent amf. This invariably happens when directors boot up and read on-disk headers written by an old version of the tower, built when we had the concept of a temporary device one used for cloning. The tower has converted the temporary device one to a normal device one, with the virtual volume being on it rather than its zeroth child. If the tower is downgraded back to an older version of the software, the virtual volume will remain on the (now non-temporary) raid 1. I.e., this change happened because of an upgrade, and the change will not be unmade if a corresponding downgrade is done.

details.customerDescription: moved virtual volume from amf \"%s\" to \"%s\"
details.formatString: moved virtual volume from amf \"%s\" to \"%s\"

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Amf component has created an amf node (named [amfName]) in memory from on-disk config info. The amf was created by an older version of the tower that didn't have virtual volumes. The Amf component has upgraded the amf node by persistently creating a virtual volume for it, named [virtualVolumeName]. The user can override the Amf's choice of name with the "amf rename" command.

details.customerDescription: upgraded amf \"%s\": added virtual volume \"%s\"
details.formatString: upgraded amf \"%s\": added virtual volume \"%s\"

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Events cch/3, cch/4 and amf/21 occur if any user data is actually discarded. Note that writes made on losing clusters just as the link is going down may be discarded. This is based on whether or not the data made it to any of the clusters that end up being winners.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is required, other than to beware of the consequences.

details.customerDescription: Created a setting for \"%s\" which may discard data at a losing cluster
details.internalDescription: The loser or majority setting which has just been made is one which may trigger the discarding of acknowledged user data. That will happen if, after an intercluster link outage, the setting fires and further host writes are performed. This means that data writes that the plex acknowledges to the host may be discarded in some circumstances.
details.formatString: Created a setting for \"%s\" which may discard data at a losing cluster

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is required, other than to beware of the consequences.

details.customerDescription: May have discarded written data for distributed raid 1 \"%s\" at clusters in conflict with cluster %u
details.internalDescription: This warning event is emitted when the user explicitly tells the plex that one subset of a set of conflicting clusters is to be the winner. Data that has been accepted by the plex at the now losing clusters will be discarded. This data is data written at the losing clusters during (and possibly just before) the link outage.
details.formatString: May have discarded written data for distributed raid 1 \"%s\" at clusters in conflict with cluster %u

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: When applications on the side chosen to be the loser are ready, issue the "amf datawin" command to pick a winner to start the process of undoing changes done on the resulting loser.

details.customerDescription: Conflicting detaches on distributed raid 1 \"%s\", \"amf datawin\" needed to pick a winner
details.internalDescription: During an intercluster link outage, conflicting detaches were issued. The link has now been restored, and a manual "amf datawin" command is needed to decide which side is the winner. When the command is issued, changes made on the losing side during (and possibly just before) the link outage will be undone. Typically, applications running on that losing side should be quiesed while this is done. A host-level backup at the losing side can be done, before declaring the other side the winner and accepting it's data.
details.formatString: Conflicting detaches on distributed raid 1 \"%s\", \"amf datawin\" needed to pick a winner

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: If we are currently rebuilding the mirror, we will roll back the write only as far as the block in question. This is similar to the amf/141 event, except that this occurs when the write was directed to only the local mirror [mirrorName] of the distributed raid 1 [amfName].

details.customerDescription: Mirror \"%s\" of raid 1 \"%s\" has been marked fully out of date based on failed local-leg write to block %llu.
details.internalDescription: A write failed on the specified mirror of the given device, causing the mirror to be marked out of date.
details.formatString: Mirror \"%s\" of raid 1 \"%s\" has been marked fully out of date based on failed local-leg write to block %llu.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A director at a losing cluster has learned of its loser status, and the "auto-resume" flag is not set for this virtual volume. The virtual volume is suspended, thus preventing resumption of I/O when mini-rebuilds, etc. are complete. - replacement for almost obsolete event nmg/55 - this event occurs only on the the director exporting the virtual volume, not at all directors at a cluster - on a non-WOF device, there is no limit as to how old data has to be, before it might get deleted on the loser side. On a WOF device, there is a limit (depends on settings, typically about 20 seconds). - this event is easy to miss, because it appears WAY earlier than vdp/15, which happens for a virtual volume that resumes (no loser) - user cannot do a host-level backup of the image at the loser side, because the virtual volume is suspended and can't be seen from the host.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: When host applications are ready (e.g. restarted), issue the "amf losersresume" command to resume the virtual volume (and possibly all such suspended virtual volumes). Note that host reboots may hang until the "amf losersresume" command is issued (SPR 6912).

details.customerDescription: Volume \"%s\" ready to be resumed
details.internalDescription: The virtual volume became suspended because of a link outage. This cluster was declared a loser for the device, and now the clusters are back in touch. When host applications are ready for the new virtual volume data, and all clusters are back in touch, the virtual volume should be resumed using the "amf losersresume" command.
details.formatString: Volume \"%s\" ready to be resumed

details.customerDescription: raid 1 rebuild: %s: child node %u (%s) rebuild killed (%s rebuild)
details.internalDescription: The rebuild has stopped because the user has issued a command to disallow rebuilds on the device in question. The user can issue another command to allow rebuilds on the device, which will cause the rebuild to restart.
details.formatString: raid 1 rebuild: %s: child node %u (%s) rebuild killed (%s rebuild)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The only current reason for this event is that the given loser setting would create a contradictory detach, which is disallowed in our Plex at the moment.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If I/O needs to resume, then all required links should be brought up.

details.customerDescription: Loser setting on a device failed to detach a cluster.
details.internalDescription: The Plex disallowed the automatic detach of the given cluster from the given device, in order to preserve consistency on the device and avoid losing data. Cluster detach is disallowed when the sytem hasn't finished dealing with a previous detach, and the direction of the detach is changing.
details.formatString: Loser setting on device %s failed to detach cluster %u.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The only current reason for this event is that the given loser setting would create a contradictory detach, which is disallowed in our Plex at the moment.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If I/O needs to resume, then all required links should be brought up.

details.customerDescription: Detach on device [amfName] based on majority setting failed.
details.internalDescription: The Plex disallowed the automatic detach of missing clusters from the given device based on majority rules, in order to preserve consistency on the device and avoid losing data. Cluster detach is disallowed when the sytem hasn't finished dealing with a previous detach, and the direction of the detach is changing.
details.formatString: Detach on device %s based on majority setting failed.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This error check added in internal version 2.1base. The earliest form of these settings allowed for 12 bitmap log settings - enough for a 4-way distributed Raid-1 with no protection for loss of local storage.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Verify the correct version of firmware is running on the Plex Re-run or re-install if necessary. If the firmware was intentionally changed and will remain at this version, the log settings must be re-created. Contact EMC Technical Support or your installer for assistance.

details.customerDescription: Device \"%s\": too many log settings found - log settings cleared
details.internalDescription: More bitmap log settings than this version of the firmware can support were found in the device configuration. This may be a result of downgrading to an older version of the firmware. Bitmap logging during link outages cannot be performed for this device. Any I/O during a link outage will result in a full rebuild across clusters.
details.formatString: Device \"%s\": too many log settings found - log settings cleared

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A 1/10 second poll is used, in the director "shdn" thread, to wait for log I/O's to drain. If this is suspected, look for routine "detachAllLogs" associated with the "shdn" thread.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is necessary. This situation should not result in more than a second of delay, unless the Plex is large and has very busy or slow logging storage volumes.

details.customerDescription: waiting for log I
details.internalDescription: As part of shutting down this director, the firmware must drain all active I/O's. This includes I/O's that are related to maintaining the bitmap logs used to avoid full rebuilds. Such an I/O is pending when the shutdown has started. There will be a slight delay while any such I/O's flush out.
details.formatString: waiting for log I

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: For now, the choice of cluster is automatic (we choose the lowest numbered cluster that's in conflict). In the future, we will likely make this configurable.

details.customerDescription: Cluster %u has been logically joined to cluster %u on device %s in the" "presence of conflicting detaches."
details.internalDescription: Conflicting detaches have been detected on a distributed RAID-1. Clusters that are not part of that conflict cannot resume I/O without joining one of the conflicting sets of clusters. The Plex has automatically chosen one of the conflicting clusters for this purpose. Note that if required, the 'amf losersresume' command must still be issued in order for I/O to resume on the previously non-conflicting cluster.
details.formatString: Cluster %u has been logically joined to cluster %u on device %s in the" "presence of conflicting detaches."

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Issued on the master amg director only.

details.customerDescription: Successfully discarded mirror %lu of amf \"%s\"
details.internalDescription: One redundant copy of the data has been discarded.
details.formatString: Successfully discarded mirror %lu of amf \"%s\"

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The mirror number [mirrorNum] of device set [parentName] could not be discarded because a group change has occurred before the request could complete. A group change is when a director joins or leaves the group of running directors. This event is issued on the master amg director only.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Once the Plex has stabilized, so that directors are neither departing nor arriving, re-issue the request to discard the mirror.

details.customerDescription: Attempt to discard mirror %u of device \"%s\" cancelled
details.internalDescription: While the Plex was attempting to discard a mirror, a director either booted up or shut down. To preserve Plex integrity, all in-process requests to discard mirrors are cancelled when this happens.
details.formatString: Attempt to discard mirror %u of device \"%s\" cancelled

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Fix the failed meta-volume by checking cables and connections. If meta-volume cannot be reached, create a new meta-volume as soon as possible and use "meta-volume copy" command to save the cache data to the newly created meta-volume

details.customerDescription: Metadata write failed on device or storage volume.
details.internalDescription: A write to the specified metadata device has failed. The changes are preserved in memory, but if the Plex fails or is shut down before the metadata device is restored and the changes can be written successfully, the changes will be lost. Plex configuration information may be lost.
details.formatString: Metadata write (%s) failed on device or storage volume \"%s\". Check metadata device \"%s\"."

details.customerDescription: raid 1 rebuild: %s: child node %u (%s) rebuild killed (%s rebuild)
details.internalDescription: The rebuild has stopped because an external request (e.g a non-disruptive upgrade) has requested that all rebuilds stop. Rebuilds will restart when the external condition is removed (e.g. the non-disruptive upgrade succeeds or is cancelled).
details.formatString: raid 1 rebuild: %s: child node %u (%s) rebuild killed (%s rebuild)

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical support.

details.customerDescription: This version of firmware cannot handle [numPartitions] virtual volumes. Any virtual volumes past number [maxPartitionCount] of device or storage volume [amfName] will be forgotten.
details.internalDescription: The Plex has detected in the persisted headers of the specified device a number of virtual volumes greater than what the current firmware can support. Any virtual volumes higher in index than the maximum supported by this firmware will not be used.
details.formatString: This version of firmware cannot handle %u virtual volumes. Any virtual volumes past number %u of device or storage volume %s will be forgotten.

details.customerDescription: Rebuild of %s stopped before it could start.
details.internalDescription: The Plex tried to start a rebuild on the specified device, but before the rebuild could start, an external request such as shutdown or non-disruptive upgrade forced all rebuilds to be stopped. Thus the rebuild was not started.
details.formatString: Rebuild of %s stopped before it could start.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Copy the metadata after all steps of the upgrade have been completed.

details.customerDescription: Could not copy metadata to metadata device \"%s\" - metadata writes are disallowed\n
details.internalDescription: The user issued a command to copy the metadata to a backup metadata device, but that attempt has failed. The reason for the failure is that configuration changes are currently disallowed because an upgrade is being performed.
details.formatString: Could not copy metadata to metadata device \"%s\" - metadata writes are disallowed\n

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Move the metadata after all steps of the upgrade have been completed.

details.customerDescription: Could not move metadata to metadata device \"%s\" - metadata writes are disallowed\n
details.internalDescription: The user issued a command to move the metadata to a backup metadata device, but that attempt has failed. The Plex has fallen back to using the metadata device that was active prior to the failed attempt to switch to a new metadata device. The reason for the failure is that configuration changes are currently disallowed because an upgrade is being performed.
details.formatString: Could not move metadata to metadata device \"%s\" - metadata writes are disallowed\n

details.customerDescription: Successfully copied metadata to metadata device \"%s\"\n
details.internalDescription: The user issued a command to copy the metadata to a backup metadata device, and that attempt has completed successfully.
details.formatString: Successfully copied metadata to metadata device \"%s\"\n

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Investigate the cause of the failure of the source metadata amf to ensure that it will not result in other storage volume failures. Consider moving to a redundant metadata device for greater reliability.

details.customerDescription: Could not copy metadata back to metadata device \"%s\" - write failure(s); \"%s\" is now the active metadata device\n
details.internalDescription: The user issued a command to copy the metadata to a new metadata device. The Plex managed to copy the data, but a fatal error occurred while writing back to the source metadata device, so the Plex has now made the destination metadata device the active one. (Ordinarily, a copy would result in the destination being an inactive metadata device.)
details.formatString: Could not copy metadata back to metadata device \"%s\" - write failure(s); \"%s\" is now the active metadata device\n

details.customerDescription: Successfully moved metadata to metadata device \"%s\"\n
details.internalDescription: The user issued a command to move the metadata to a new metadata device, and that attempt has completed successfully.
details.formatString: Successfully moved metadata to metadata device \"%s\"\n

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Copy the metadata to a different metadata device.

details.customerDescription: Could not copy metadata to metadata device \"%s\" - write failure(s)\n
details.internalDescription: The user issued a command to copy the metadata to a new metadata device. That command completed with a failure, because the new metadata device had one or more write errors.
details.formatString: Could not copy metadata to metadata device \"%s\" - write failure(s)\n

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Move the metadata to a different metadata device.

details.customerDescription: Could not move metadata to metadata device \"%s\" - write failure(s)\n
details.internalDescription: The user issued a command to move the metadata to a new metadata device. That command completed with a failure, because the new metadata device had one or more write errors. The Plex has fallen back to using the metadata device that was active prior to the failed attempt to switch to a new metadata device.
details.formatString: Could not move metadata to metadata device \"%s\" - write failure(s)\n

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Cached data will be discarded - this is I/O from the host, which YY previously acknowledged, but which was never written to storage volume. Or, if it made it to storage volume temporarily, until the link came back and we realized this cluster is a loser, and then the data gets overwritten by data from the winning cluster(s).
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Restore communication link or remote cluster.

details.customerDescription: Cluster %u detached wrt device or storage volume \"%s\" by active detach.
details.internalDescription: The "active detach" mechanism has detached the specified cluster from the specified device. If all missing clusters have been detached, then I/O can resume at the remaining clusters.
details.formatString: Cluster %u detached wrt device or storage volume \"%s\" by active detach.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The flash files corresponding to the active metadata amf on all directors at the local cluster will have to be made consistent, and then the cluster should be rebooted. Alternatively, the flash files can be removed, and then the correct metadata amf activated when the cluster is rebooted.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If the wrong metadata device has been used to build up devices at the local cluster, steps need to be taken to ensure that the right metadata device is used at the cluster. Contact EMC Customer Support for assistance with this procedure.

details.customerDescription: Metadata device version supersedes active metadata device.
details.internalDescription: A conflict has been detected between the views of two or more directors as to which metadata amf should be marked active at a cluster.
details.formatString: Metadata device \"%s\" version %llu is more recent than currently active metadata device \"%s\" version %llu.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: If directors can't be booted at a cluster, it should be possible to simply copy the flash file "activeMetadataInfo" from a director that did receive the update to the ones that didn't.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Boot any missing directors at the relevant cluster, so that their flashes can be updated. If this is not possible, contact EMC Customer Support.

details.customerDescription: Not all directors at cluster %u present for change of active metadata device.
details.internalDescription: A new metadata device has been activated. In order to avoid incorrect decisions as to which metadata device should be active, identification of the new active metadata device is stored in the flash of the directors at the same cluster. In this case, not all directors are present, and thus there is the possibility of conflict if the cluster were to be rebooted before this inconsistency is fixed.
details.formatString: Not all directors at cluster %u present for change of active metadata device.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: When the disk header is read to see if it is a spare disk, it was found that the disk header size is not a multiple of the disk block size.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: System ignored a disk because it has an invalid block size.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: If possible, change the block size of the disk. Otherwise, remove it from the system.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Please contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: A disk has been ignored by the system as the disk has an invalid block size.
details.internalDescription: The system has decided to ignore the specified disk, because it has an invalid block size (i.e. the metadata header size is not a multiple of the block size).
details.formatString: Ignoring disk %s with block size %u.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The firmware believes that the size of a disk or raid has shrunk below the size with which it was created.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Examine the backend arrays to determine why the storage has shrunk.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Examine the health and capacity of the backend devices. If they are OK, there may be a software bug. If they appear to have legitimately shrunk, then help the customer resize as required.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Resize the required backend device to its original size.

details.customerDescription: Capacity of device shrank below its configured capacity
details.internalDescription: The capacity of the given raid or disk has shrunk below its configured size, which puts user data at risk. We treat this condition the same way we treat a failed disk.
details.formatString: Capacity of device \"%s\" has shrunk to %llu blocks, below configured capacity of %llu blocks.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Examine the backend arrays to determine why the storage has increased in capacity.

details.customerDescription: Capacity of a device has increased to at least its original configured value.
details.internalDescription: The capacity of the given raid or disk has increased to at least the size at which the raid or disk was originally configured. We clear the failed-disk-like status in this case.
details.formatString: Capacity of device \"%s\" has increased to at least the configured value of %llu blocks.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The user issued a command to copy the metadata to a new metadata device. That command completed with a failure, because the new metadata device had one or more write errors.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Retry the command once nvol is ready.

details.customerDescription: Could not copy metadata to metadata device [device] - nvol not ready
details.internalDescription: Could not copy metadata to metadata device [device] - nvol not ready
details.formatString: Could not copy metadata to metadata device "%s" - nvol not ready

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The user issued a command to move the metadata to a new metadata device. That command completed with a failure, because nvol was not ready. The Plex has fallen back to using the metadata device that was active prior to the failed attempt to switch to a new metadata device.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Retry the command once nvol is ready. If nvol is not created yet, then the force option can be used to override this error.

details.customerDescription: Could not move metadata to metadata device [device] - nvol not ready
details.internalDescription: Could not move metadata to metadata device [device] - nvol not ready
details.formatString: Could not move metadata to metadata device "%s" - nvol not ready

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The same disk has been not only presented to multiple clusters, but claimed at those clusters as well. If more than one cluster is doing I/O to the disk, data corruption is extremely likely.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The same disk has been not only presented to multiple clusters, but claimed at those clusters as well. If more than one cluster is doing I/O to the disk, data corruption is extremely likely.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Choose one cluster at which the disk should be used, tear down all configuration involving the disk at the other cluster(s), and remove visibility to the disk from the other cluster(s).
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Choose one cluster at which the disk should be used, tear down all configuration involving the disk at the other cluster(s), and remove visibility to the disk from the other cluster(s).

details.customerDescription: A disk has been claimed at more than one cluster.
details.internalDescription: Disk [diskName] is claimed at local cluster ([localClusterID]) and at cluster [remoteClusterID].
details.formatString: Disk %s is claimed at local cluster (%u) and at cluster %u.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A disk in a metadata volume has become unreachable or unhealthy, thereby reducing the redundancy of the metadata volume.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A disk in a metadata volume has become unreachable or unhealthy, thereby reducing the redundancy of the metadata volume.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Identify the problem disk, and either fix the problem, or replace the disk.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Identify the problem disk, and either fix the problem, or replace the disk.

details.customerDescription: A metadata volume has experienced a disk problem.
details.internalDescription: A disk problem has reduced the redundancy of metadata volume "[metaVolumeName]".
details.formatString: A disk problem has reduced the redundancy of metadata volume "%s".

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The administrator has removed a mirror from a metadata volume, thereby reducing the redundancy of the metadata volume.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The administrator has removed a mirror from a metadata volume, thereby reducing the redundancy of the metadata volume.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: If the redundancy of the metadata volume is too low, add another mirror to the metadata volume.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: If the redundancy of the metadata volume is too low, add another mirror to the metadata volume.

details.customerDescription: The administrator has issued a command to reduce the redundancy of a metadata volume.
details.internalDescription: An administrative command has reduced the redundancy of metadata volume "[metaVolumeName]".
details.formatString: An administrative command has reduced the redundancy of metadata volume "%s".

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: There is no setting in flash about which metadata volume should be active.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: There is no setting in flash about which metadata volume should be active.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Activate a new or a backup metadata volume.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Activate a new or a backup metadata volume.

details.customerDescription: The local cluster will not activate a metadata volume automatically - a new or backup metadata volume must be activated manually.
details.internalDescription: No active metadata setting in flash - a new or backup metadata volume must be activated.
details.formatString: No active metadata setting in flash - a new or backup metadata volume must be activated.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A fixed time has passed after the local cluster last booted, and the active metadata volume has not yet been detected.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A fixed time has passed after the local cluster last booted, and the active metadata volume has not yet been detected.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Fix the problem with the active metadata volume, or activate a backup.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Fix the problem with the active metadata volume, or activate a backup.

details.customerDescription: The local cluster has timed out after booting waiting for the active metadata volume to arrive.
details.internalDescription: Timed out waiting for metadata volume "[activeMetadataVolumeName]" - fix it or restore from backup.
details.formatString: Timed out waiting for metadata volume "%s" - fix it or restore from backup.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: This setting governs whether extra steps are taken during VPLEX's utilization of backend storage devices to account for their being thinly provisioned. If this setting is misconfigured as false for a particular device, it can lead to the waste of thin pool resources on the backend array. If it is misconfigured as true for a particular device, it can lead to degraded performance during some operations.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: If set incorrectly, the setting can be checked and updated via the UI or tower console at any time.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: If set incorrectly, the setting can be checked and updated via the UI at any time.

details.customerDescription: The backend storage volume is, or is not, set as a thinly provisioned device.
details.internalDescription: The backend storage volume is, or is not, set as a thinly provisioned device.
details.formatString: Updates thinProvisioned property of amf \"%s\" to be '%s'.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [This event is now obsolete - notifications come from the Nmg now.] The Amg has noticed, via the Nmg, that controller (director, SNAC, director) [controllerName] has gone away. [controllerName] will either be the 64 bit ComUuid of the director, or the user-specified name of the director. [Note: in the future this event should be replaced by one or more Nmg events.]

details.customerDescription: AMG: Controller %s has gone away.
details.formatString: AMG: Controller %s has gone away.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Amg prints this message when it first comes up on any director. It indicates that the Amg does not know any official state yet, and so will not be involved in sending such state to any other directors, and is more likely to receive state from elsewhere. NOTE: currently the Rmg and then the Ag components will follow the Amg in this startup activity.

details.customerDescription: AMG: I am a new controller.
details.formatString: AMG: I am a new controller.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: When an new Amg decides that there are no other directors out there that can send it the initial state, it creates an empty initial state. This event accompanies that creation. NOTE: currently the Rmg and then the Ag components will follow the Amg in this startup activity.

details.customerDescription: AMG: Doing first-controller initialization.
details.formatString: AMG: Doing first-controller initialization.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: When an Amg is not new, i.e. has either created or received initial state, it is a candidate for sending that state to a subsequent new director. This event indicates that this Amg has been chosen to send out the current state as the initial state for one or more new directors. NOTE: currently the Rmg and then the Ag components make the same decision about who will send state.

details.customerDescription: AMG: I will now send the current state.
details.formatString: AMG: I will now send the current state.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Amg has noticed that the set of active directors has changed. However, the mechanism by which the Amg software determines which is the "master" director has resulted in this director, which was previously the "master", is still the "master". NOTE: currently the Rmg and then the Ag components make the same decision about mastership.

details.customerDescription: AMG: Nmg re-discovery, but I am still the master.
details.formatString: AMG: Nmg re-discovery, but I am still the master.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: When the set of active directors changed, the director that used to be the "master" has gone away, and this director is now the "master". NOTE: currently the Rmg and then the Ag components make the same decision about mastership.

details.customerDescription: AMG: Controller group change, I am now the master.
details.formatString: AMG: Controller group change, I am now the master.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: When the set of active directors changed, at least one new director appeared, and the Amg's mechanism for chosing the "master" has decided that one of those new directors should now be the "master". This director, which used to be the "master", is reporting that it is no longer the "master". NOTE: currently the Rmg and then the Ag components make the same decision about mastership.

details.customerDescription: AMG: Controller group change, I am no longer the master.
details.formatString: AMG: Controller group change, I am no longer the master.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Amg logs this event when it is starting normal processing. This happens only when the director has not yet been in a state where it can do normal processing. The switch occurs when all of the directors (including this new one) have reported that they have received all of an initial state send. NOTE: currently the Rmg and then the Ag components will follow the Amg in this startup activity.

details.customerDescription: AMG: Commencing normal operation.
details.formatString: AMG: Commencing normal operation.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A new Amg director will log this event after it has received all of an initial state send. This director is now ready for normal operation, but will not commence such operation until all new directors have similarly received their initial state from some other director. NOTE: currently the Rmg and then the Ag components will follow the Amg in this startup activity.

details.customerDescription: AMG: Received all of initial state.
details.formatString: AMG: Received all of initial state.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: One of the jobs of the Amg, as it was initially conceived, is to filter out redundant notifications (originating with the back end Fibre Channel software) of the appearance and disappearance of storage volumes. This is because all directors find out about those happenings, and having all directors broadcast each to all other directors is too many messages. So, each sends a notification to the "master" Amg director, and that director filters them. This event will be produced whenever a director sees the appearance of a storage volume that it already knows about. Typically, this will be because it has found out about the storage volume because of the initial state given to it by some other Amg director. This is should not be a problem - just a small timing window. [storageVolumeId] is the logical unit identifier of the storage volume.

details.customerDescription: AMG: duplicate storage volume %s ignored
details.formatString: AMG: duplicate storage volume %s ignored

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: When the Amg is informed of storage volumes by the Amf, the Amf will have read the header of the storage volume, and so knows the id of the spare pool associated with that storage volume. If that spare pool no longer exists, the Amg will attempt to re-create it. If it cannot do so, because its space for spare pools is exhausted, it will instead simply put the storage volume into the default spare pool. This event indicates that that has happened. [oldPoolId] is the id of the spare pool as indicated by the storage volume, [storageVolumeId] is the logical unit id of the storage volume, [newPoolName] is the name of the spare pool that the storage volume was actually put into, and [newPoolId] is the new pool's 64-bit unique id.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Ensure the spare pools required to support automatic storage volume replacement exist and contain storage volumes.

details.customerDescription: AMG: No room for pool with id 0x%016llx, storage volume %s moved to pool %s
details.internalDescription: The reported storage volume belonged to a spare pool that no longer exists. The Plex was unable to recreate the spare pool because the maximum number of spare pools already exists.
details.formatString: AMG: No room for pool with id 0x%016llx, storage volume %s moved to pool %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [This event is obsolete.]

details.customerDescription: AMG: Duplicate spare pool \"%s\" renamed to \"%s\"
details.formatString: AMG: Duplicate spare pool \"%s\" renamed to \"%s\"

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [This event is obsolete.]

details.customerDescription: AMG: New spare pool \"%s\" created for storage volume 0x%llx
details.formatString: AMG: New spare pool \"%s\" created for storage volume 0x%llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [This event is obsolete.] This informational event is given whenever the "master" Amg has been informed of a new spare storage volume. The Amg is simply indicating which pool the storage volume has been put into. [storageVolumeId] is the 64 bit numeric id of the storage volume (WWN), and [poolName] is the name of the pool, which should always be "*". [Why use an expression here, when the name *must* be "*"?]

details.customerDescription: AMG: New storage volume 0x%016llx added to spare pool \"%s\"
details.formatString: AMG: New storage volume 0x%016llx added to spare pool \"%s\"

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: In some circumstance I don't currently understand, the Amf is telling the Amg that it could not write out a set of storage volume headers. I don't know if it matters. Later: I believe our intent was that only one director in a Plex would actually go and write the storage volume headers. However, I believe that all directors currently go and do it. Thus, having the header update fail on one director is not necessarily important, as long as the write doesn't scramble the data, and there is no later write to fix it, and as long as at least one director succeeds in the write.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Configuration information for the device could not be persisted. This message is significant only if reported by every director.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: If this message is reported by every director, check the cables and connections to the meta-volume and fix any issues. Use the "amf meta restore" command to save the in-memory configuration data to the meta-volume. Check the status of the device sets to determine which device set is not available. Contact EMC technical support

details.customerDescription: failed to initialize device \"%s\" on storage volume.
details.internalDescription: If this message is reported by each director in the Plex the device set did not initialize properly. If any director successfully writes out configuration information, the device set was successfully created.
details.formatString: failed to initialize device \"%s\" on storage volume.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Amg has been asked to find a replacement storage volume for a storage volume that the Amf wants to replace. Unfortunately the spare pool associated with the request has no storage volumes left in it. So, the failed storage volume cannot be replaced, and the device it is in will continue to run in crippled mode. The name of the storage volume (should be equivalent to the hex form of its 64 bit numeric storage volume id) is given, and the id of the spare pool.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Ensure the spare pools required to support automatic storage volume replacement exist and contain storage volumes. Contact EMC Technical Support to manually replace the failed storage volume.

details.customerDescription: No replacement storage volume found in pool.
details.internalDescription: The specified spare pool does not contain any storage volumes to replace the storage volume. The failed storage volume cannot be replaced.
details.formatString: AMG: No replacement storage volume for storage volume \"%s\" found in pool id 0x%llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [This event is obsolete.] A storage volume, with id [storageVolumeId] has been reported as discovered by the storage volume code, via the Amf. That report indicates that the storage volume is associated with a spare pool, whose 64 bit numeric id is [poolId], that the Amg does not know about. The Amg has put the spare storage volume into pool [poolName] instead.

details.customerDescription: AMG: Pool id 0x%016llx does not exist, storage volume 0x%016llx moved to pool \"%s\"
details.formatString: AMG: Pool id 0x%016llx does not exist, storage volume 0x%016llx moved to pool \"%s\"

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Amf has asked the Amg to coordinate a needed rebuild of a RAID-1. The Amg, however, has no rebuild records left to record that request, and so the rebuild will not happen immediately. As soon as the Amg detects that rebuild records are available, it will ask the Amg to scan the amf nodes and start waiting rebuilds. This means that eventually, this rebuild and all others that were delayed will be processed. [amfName] is the name of the Amf (RAID-1) concerned.

details.customerDescription: AMG: No rebuild record for rebuild of \"%s\". Rebuild will be done later.
details.internalDescription: The Plex will automatically rebuild the device when resources beome available.
details.formatString: AMG: No rebuild record for rebuild of \"%s\". Rebuild will be done later.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: When a rebuild is requested, the Amg will chose a director to do the rebuild, based on where current rebuilds are happening. If that director does not have the resources to do the rebuild, the Amg will try another director. Eventually, the Amg will stop trying directors, and will generate this event. [amfName] is the name of the Amf (RAID-1) involved.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: AMG: No controller able to start rebuild on \"%s\" - try manual rebuild.
details.internalDescription: A storage volume failed and the Plex tried to repair the device set but was not successful.
details.formatString: AMG: No controller able to start rebuild on \"%s\" - try manual rebuild.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is created when the "amg padd" command is able to create a new spare pool. [poolName] is the user-given name for the new pool, and [poolId] is the Amg-given 64 bit numeric identifier for the new spare pool.

details.customerDescription: Spare pool \"%s\" created, id 0x%016llx.
details.formatString: Spare pool \"%s\" created, id 0x%016llx.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is generated when the "amg psub" command is able to destroy a spare pool. [poolName] is the current name of the spare pool as given by the user ("[unnamed]" if this is not known), and [poolId] is the 64-bit unique id associated with the spare pool.

details.customerDescription: Spare pool %s
details.formatString: Spare pool %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event confirms a user request to rename a spare pool. If [poolOldName] is unknown, "[unnamed]" will be used.

details.customerDescription: Spare pool %s
details.formatString: Spare pool %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is generated when the "amg movestorageVolume" command is able to move the storage volume with logical unit id [storageVolumeId] from the pool given by its name and id into the pool given by its name and id.

details.customerDescription: Moved storage volume %s from spare pool %s "pool %s/0x%016llx
details.formatString: Moved storage volume %s from spare pool %s "pool %s/0x%016llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is generated when the "amg movedisks" command is able to move [storageVolumeCount] storage volumes from the first spare pool (given by its name and id) to the second spare pool (also given by its name and id).

details.customerDescription: Moved %ld storage volumes from spare pool %s "%s/0x%016llx
details.formatString: Moved %ld storage volumes from spare pool %s "%s/0x%016llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The indicated storage volume pool has become empty. This could be because of automatic replacement of a failing storage volume, or due to the administrator moving storage volumes out of the pool, or due to the creation of a device from storage volumes in the pool, or due to the last storage volume in the pool being removed or becoming out of touch. Severity should really be ERR/CRIT, if the user has any RAID-1s with auto-replace on that are down to a single leg, and use this spare pool. Fixing JBOD events is low-priority today.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Add storage volumes to the reported pool.

details.customerDescription: Storage volume pool %s
details.internalDescription: The device sets that rely on the reported storage volume pool are at risk. The Plex has no storage volumes available in the storage volume pool for auto replacement.
details.formatString: Storage volume pool %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Amf has asked the Amg to coordinate the operation of copying partition [srcName] to partition [destName]. a needed rebuild of a RAID-1. The Amg, however, has no partition copy records left to record that request, and so the partition copy will not happen. The administrator will have to request it manually later via an amf command.

details.customerDescription: AMG: No virtual volume copy record for %s -> %s. Copy not done.
details.formatString: AMG: No virtual volume copy record for %s -> %s. Copy not done.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: When a partition copy is requested, the Amg will chose a director to do the partition copy, based on where current partition copies and rebuilds are happening. If that director does not have the resources to do the partition copy, the Amg will try another director. Eventually, the Amg will stop trying directors, and will generate this event. In this case, the operation was to copy partition [srcName] to partition [destName].

details.customerDescription: AMG: No controller able to start virtual volume copy %s -> %s - try again later.
details.formatString: AMG: No controller able to start virtual volume copy %s -> %s - try again later.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: sensor Warnings - a sensor reading has exceeded limits.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If the message indicates a temperature sensor, check the environmental conditions in your server room. If a "back to normal" notice is not received, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: sensor %s, value %d %s, have exceeded the normal operating range
details.internalDescription: An internal sensor in the engine is reporting a value that is not within acceptable operating conditions.
details.formatString: sensor %s, value %d %s, have exceeded the normal operating range

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: sensor Back to Normal - a sensor resumed to normal operating range.

details.customerDescription: sensor %s, value %d %s, resumed to normal operating range
details.internalDescription: The sensor in the engine returned to within normal operating limits.
details.formatString: sensor %s, value %d %s, resumed to normal operating range

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: application started - when a tower application started.

details.customerDescription: application %s started with args %s
details.formatString: application %s started with args %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: application shutdown - when a tower application shutdown.

details.customerDescription: application shuts down
details.formatString: application shuts down

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: watchdog timer expire - some action (wdExpireAction) will be taken
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: application watchdog timer expired, action: %s
details.internalDescription: Watchdog timer has expired. Plex has taken the action mentioned in the message.
details.formatString: application watchdog timer expired, action: %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: power off - power off everthing except ARM.

details.customerDescription: power shuts down
details.formatString: power shuts down

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: device not present - when a device not present in the enclosure.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Verify the status of the devices in the engine. Replace defective or missing devices as soon as possible. If BOTH fans have stopped, power off the engine.

details.customerDescription: device %s %d is not present
details.internalDescription: The specified device (one of the AC input modules, power supplies, or fan modules) is no longer detected in the engine.
details.formatString: device %s %d is not present

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: device is discovered - when a new device is discovered.

details.customerDescription: device %s %d is discovered
details.internalDescription: A new device has been detected in the engine.
details.formatString: device %s %d is discovered

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: device not operational - when a device is present but not operational.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Verify the status of the devices in the engine. Replace defective or missing devices as soon as possible. If BOTH fans have stopped, power off the engine.

details.customerDescription: device %s %d is not operational, status %s
details.internalDescription: The specified device (one of the AC input modules, power supplies, or fan modules) in the engine is not functioning properly.
details.formatString: device %s %d is not operational, status %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: device operational - when a device resumed to operational.

details.customerDescription: device %s %d resumed to operational
details.internalDescription: The specified device (one of the AC input modules, power supplies, or fan modules) in the engine is now functioning properly.
details.formatString: device %s %d resumed to operational

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: data lost - when the socket is temporarily blocking, record how much data was lost during this time. For the list of possible [connectionId] values (and what they mean), see enum connName_e in file bmgr/connection.h
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Connection id %d chanNum %d lost %ld bytes of data
details.internalDescription: The Plex is set up to display extra information for debugging or trouble shooting. An overflow condition occurred and some of that information was lost.
details.formatString: Connection id %d chanNum %d lost %ld bytes of data

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: InfiniBand device failed built in self test, performed at startup. This is nolonger used.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The module may require servicing. Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: device %s (%s) failed built in self test: 0x%x
details.internalDescription: Power-on self test detected an error within the infiniband switch.
details.formatString: device %s (%s) failed built in self test: 0x%x

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Single bit ECC error has been reported to the bmgr. Bmgr will have corrected the error in memory.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Repeated occurances may indicate the module requires servicing.

details.customerDescription: single bit ECC error: cont %lu addr 0x%lx syn: 0x%lx
details.internalDescription: A single bit ECC error was detected and corrected.
details.formatString: single bit ECC error: cont %lu addr 0x%lx syn: 0x%lx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: bmgr will now change action for after application watchdog expires

details.customerDescription: Watchdog expired action changed
details.internalDescription: The watchdog timer expiring means a director has stopped communicating with the Plex A user has changed the setting of which action the Plex will take in the event of a timeout.
details.formatString: Watchdog expired action changed

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: bmgr will now start send tracedump information to a remote host

details.customerDescription: Start dumping tower trace
details.internalDescription: The Plex is sending internal debug information to the specified host. This information is required by EMC to track down problems.
details.formatString: Start dumping tower trace

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: bmgr is unable to fork off a child to start the tracedump, check the aries card's resources.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Unable to start trace dump
details.internalDescription: The director does not have sufficient resources to begin the transfer of internal debug information. I/O is not affected by this problem but it may lead to other failures on the reporting director.
details.formatString: Unable to start trace dump

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: bmgr is done dumping the tower trace to remote host.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support for retrieval of the saved information.

details.customerDescription: Done dumping trace
details.internalDescription: The Plex has completed the transfer of internal debug information. This information is required by EMC to track down problems.
details.formatString: Done dumping trace

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Unable to retrieve log message from tower
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical support. The state of the director should be investigated.

details.customerDescription: Unable to retieve log messages from tower
details.internalDescription: An internal error has occurred while attempting to retrieve a log message from the director that initiated this message.
details.formatString: Unable to retieve log messages from tower

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A non-fatal internal error was encountered.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical support. The state of the director should be investigated.

details.customerDescription: Internal error:%s %d:%s (%s)
details.internalDescription: A non-fatal internal error has occurred and should be reported to EMC Technical Support.
details.formatString: Internal error:%s %d:%s (%s)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Tower initiated a STONITH request that has been received by the director to die. Customers will have received a message from the nmg about the director failing, nmg/31. They don't need to know it was stonith'ed.

details.customerDescription: Blade 0x%llx being stonith'ed by 0x%llx
details.formatString: Blade 0x%llx being stonith'ed by 0x%llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is produced when an initial check of the device indicates that it is not operational. If a subsequent check shows the device to be still not operational, then event bmgr/9 will be generated.

details.customerDescription: First check %s(%d) not operational, check again
details.formatString: First check %s(%d) not operational, check again

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is to notify user when a new fan is detected and it's been configured.

details.customerDescription: Configuring fan %d
details.formatString: Configuring fan %d

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is produce when debug is turned on and a fan register value is changed unexpectly

details.customerDescription: Fan %d values changed from the default config:0x%02x," "gpiodef:0x%02x, count:0x%02x, dac:0x%02x
details.formatString: Fan %d values changed from the default config:0x%02x," "gpiodef:0x%02x, count:0x%02x, dac:0x%02x

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is produced when a Scorpio's bmgr detects that its ibd process is no longer running.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical support.

details.customerDescription: IB Subnet Manager no longer running
details.internalDescription: The configuration process is no longer running on the InfiniBand module that reported this problem. That process must be restarted to restore the Plex to full operation. Configuration has failed over to the other InfiniBand module while the Plex is in this degraded mode.
details.formatString: IB Subnet Manager no longer running
