eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is produced if the open Plex call for /dev/misc/watchdog fails
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical support.

details.customerDescription: Unable to open
details.internalDescription: In the event that this director locks up on a software error, it will not be automatically restarted.
details.formatString: Unable to open

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is produced if the write Plex call for /dev/misc/watchdog fails
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical support.

details.customerDescription: Unable to write to
details.internalDescription: The watchdog timer is used to check periodically that a director is healthy. If this regular update fails 5 times in a row (approximately), the watchdog will expire and the director will be restarted.
details.formatString: Unable to write to

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical support if this event is received multiple times from the same originator.

details.customerDescription: Unable to get the time from NTP server %s
details.internalDescription: A director was unable to synchronize its internal clock with the Plex The director will retry within the hour.
details.formatString: Unable to get the time from NTP server %s

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If this event occurs often during normal Plex operation contact EMC Technical support.

details.customerDescription: Clock adjusted %c%0u.%03us
details.internalDescription: The time of day was adjusted by a relatively large amount, approximately 1/2 of a second. This event can occur during Plex installation, or after manually setting the time on the GateKeeper server. Time stamps in log messages may no longer be monotonic
details.formatString: Clock adjusted %c%0u.%03us

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical support if this event is received multiple times from the same originator.

details.customerDescription: NTP server %s OK
details.internalDescription: A director was able to synchronize its internal clock with the Plex after previously having failed.
details.formatString: NTP server %s OK

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [I'm not sure exactly what this means, but it has something to do with two separate measures of buffer length not agreeing]

details.customerDescription: BUS buffers don't add up on read
details.formatString: BUS buffers don't add up on read

details.customerDescription: busDoTextCommand: text command too long (%lu)
details.formatString: busDoTextCommand: text command too long (%lu)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [What is a remote command?]

details.customerDescription: Remote command from BUS has invalid mode %lu
details.formatString: Remote command from BUS has invalid mode %lu

details.customerDescription: busDoTextCommand: DMA of command from host failed
details.formatString: busDoTextCommand: DMA of command from host failed

details.customerDescription: busDoTextCommand: DMA of command result failed
details.formatString: busDoTextCommand: DMA of command result failed

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The date and time has been set.

details.customerDescription: date
details.formatString: date

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [This one is very cryptic to me]

details.formatString: %s Galileo - %s

details.customerDescription: host Galileo %s: 0x%08lx
details.formatString: host Galileo %s: 0x%08lx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [I assume this is like utl/1, but I'm not sure]

details.customerDescription: This is the log message!
details.formatString: This is the log message!

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The named partition is now being exported on the indicated bus port.

details.customerDescription: Attached %s to port %lu
details.formatString: Attached %s to port %lu

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This is a warning that we have attached a partition to a bus port, but that partition is not currently able to accept I/O requests.

details.customerDescription: Note that RG underlying %s is dead
details.formatString: Note that RG underlying %s is dead

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The named partition was previously attached to the indicated bus port, but that attachment has now been removed.

details.customerDescription: Detached %s from port %lu
details.formatString: Detached %s from port %lu

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: We have attached the indicated partition as requested, but the flash memory is full or otherwise unable to record that attachment. Thus, on a reboot, the attachment will not be automatically redone.

details.customerDescription: No space to persistently record attach of '%s' to port %lu
details.formatString: No space to persistently record attach of '%s' to port %lu

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [This event is now obsolete - it is no longer produced.]

details.customerDescription: Warning: high water mark set to %d (%d pagelets)
details.formatString: Warning: high water mark set to %d (%d pagelets)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [This event is now obsolete - it is no longer produced.] A temporary attachment of [partitionName] for a flush of replicated pages was unsuccessful because the amf status is not OK.

details.customerDescription: Temporary partition %s could not attach - uninitialised amf
details.formatString: Temporary partition %s could not attach - uninitialised amf

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Occurs only on the director(s) exporting the virtual volume, on the "losing" cluster. Other than processing an AMF detach, this event can also result from a "cch inv discardDirtyData" user command. Dirty pages discarded - this is I/O from the host, which YY previously acknowledged, but which was never written to storage volume. Or, if it made it to storage volume temporarily, until the link came back and we realized this cluster is a loser, and then the data gets overwritten by data from the winning cluster(s).
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No action is required.

details.customerDescription: Volume %s had %u dirty pages discarded
details.internalDescription: This message can occur after the inter-cluster link has come back up, and a cluster re-attaches to a device. It indicates that the cache contained dirty data at the time of the link outage, AND other clusters detached this one during the link outage. So the dirty cache pages at this cluster were discarded, in order to synchronize all mirrors of this virtual volume.
details.formatString: Volume %s had %u dirty pages discarded

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event occurs if the cch layer found no data to discard. But it doesn't know about other layers, and the best it can do is to say "also look for amf/21 with type 'undo log'". This is an undo midi rebuild (see SPR 8451). At the cch layer, this event says "Oops, we were wrong. We told you to restart your application and prepare to lose data, but it seems there wasn't any dirty data to be lost." It would be nice to know this beforehand and tell the user, but that's not yet possible. This event occurs only on the director(s) exporting the virtual volume, on the "losing" cluster. Other than processing an AMF detach, this event can also result from an unnecessary "cch inv discardDirtyData" user command. If the specified virtual volume is detaching at the time that the discard request is made, this event will be emitted and there will be no discard attempt, as it would be redundant.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is required, other than searching for the event mentioned above to see if user data was discarded.

details.customerDescription: No dirty data to discard on virtual volume %s
details.internalDescription: This message can occur after the inter-cluster link has come back up, and a cluster re-attaches to a device. It indicates that the cache contained no dirty data for the given virtual volume when the inter-cluster link went down. The attaching cluster may still have had data discarded in order to resynchronize all mirrors of this virtual volume, this can be detected by an event for a RAID 1 rebuild containing the words "undo log", and containing this device name (not virtual volume).
details.formatString: No dirty data to discard on virtual volume %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Possible flushTypes: {"Detach", "BWT", "User", "ReplTargetShutdown"} Possible reasons: {"inter-cluster link down", "storage device unavailable", "I/O error", "cancelled", "minimizing flushing", "deregistering", "deregistering and minimizing flushing", "unknown cause"}
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Resolve the problem preventing the flush from proceeding. If the synchronous flush was initiated by a user command or script, re-issue the command or re-run the script if appropriate.

details.customerDescription: %s flush of virtual volume %s unable to proceed: %s
details.internalDescription: This message occurs on a director when it is unable to synchronously flush the dirty data for a virtual volume. A failure reason of deregistering indicates this director is already performing an asynchronous flush on that virtual volume. Once the asynchronous flush completes a synchronous flush will succeed. A failure reason of 'minimizing flushing' indicates the virtual volume cannot be flushed as the intercluster link is down and I/O is suspended until the administrator chooses on which cluster I/O should continue.
details.formatString: %s flush of virtual volume %s unable to proceed: %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [This event is now obsolete - it is no longer produced.] None

details.customerDescription: Finished flushing dirty data from cache for BWT
details.internalDescription: This message occurs on a director when it has finished flushing all the cached dirty data after a BWT notification.
details.formatString: Finished flushing dirty data from cache for BWT

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If the performance implications of this value are important, correct the configuration and restart the tower. Contact EMC Technical Support if you are not aware of setting this parameter.

details.customerDescription: evictAfterFlush kw expected bool, got \"%s\"
details.internalDescription: When the director is started up, it can be passed a series of parameters to alter its default behaviour. The value for one of those, "evictAfterFlush", was not in the expected boolean format.
details.formatString: evictAfterFlush kw expected bool, got \"%s\"

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Report this event to EMC Techincal Support. It likely does not indicate a problem, but the Plex configuration should be examined to see if the causes of the high concurrency can be addressed.

details.customerDescription: Very high concurrency detected on page 0x%"FS64"x of virtual volume %s.
details.internalDescription: Many operations are active on the specified page. The EMC cache coherency is able to handle this level of concurrency, but if the level increases too much further, problems may arise.
details.formatString: Very high concurrency detected on page 0x%"FS64"x of virtual volume %s.

details.formatString: director 0x%016llx is running a binary with different version (%s).

details.customerDescription: SCSI I_T nexus (i 0x%016llx t 0x%016llx) is ready
details.internalDescription: The target consumer will start receiving incoming IO from this I_T nexus
details.formatString: SCSI I_T nexus (i 0x%016llx t 0x%016llx) is ready

details.customerDescription: SCSI I_T nexus (i 0x%016llx t 0x%016llx) is lost
details.internalDescription: The remote initiator departed.
details.formatString: SCSI I_T nexus (i 0x%016llx t 0x%016llx) is lost

details.customerDescription: SCSI target port %p (0x%016llx|0x%016llx) is unrealized

details.formatString: SCSI target port %p (0x%016llx|0x%016llx) is unrealized

details.customerDescription: The SCSI target port ([portName]|[directorName]) has been disabled.
details.internalDescription: The SCSI target port ([portName]|[directorName]) has been disabled.
details.formatString: SCSI target port %p (0x%016llx|0x%016llx) is destroyed

details.customerDescription: The SCSI IT nexus [IT] has been banished because it connects two ports with different roles
details.internalDescription: The SCSI IT nexus [IT] has been banished because it connects two ports with different roles
details.formatString: Banish %s because port role mismatch: local %s remote %s.

details.customerDescription: The SCSI IT nexus [IT] has been banished because it connects a com ports with role [local_role] to a remote cluster director port
details.internalDescription: The SCSI IT nexus [IT] has been banished because it connects a com ports with role [local_role] to a remote cluster director port
details.formatString: Banish %s because cross site node connected from a local port with role %s.

details.customerDescription: The SCSI IT nexus [IT] has been banished because it connects a com ports with role [local_role] to a local cluster director port
details.internalDescription: The SCSI IT nexus [IT] has been banished because it connects a com ports with role [local_role] to a local cluster director port
details.formatString: Banish %s because local site node connected from a local port with role %s.

details.customerDescription: FC COM port [port_name] with role [port_role]: link came up.
details.internalDescription: FC COM port [port_name] with role [port_role]: link came up.
details.formatString: COM port %s (role: %s) link up.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Link went down on a FC COM port, depending on the port role, a physical path to local or remote cluster COM has been lost.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Link went down on a FC COM port, depending on the port role, a physical path to local or remote cluster COM has been lost.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the state of the COM port, make sure it is enabled; check the cable and the SFP, make sure they are properly plugged in; check the switch if applicable, make sure it is operational and the corresponding port is enabled.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the state of the COM port, make sure it is enabled; check the cable and the SFP, make sure they are properly plugged in; check the switch if applicable, make sure it is operational and the corresponding port is enabled. Contact EMC support.

details.customerDescription: FC COM port [port_name] with role [port_role]: link went down.
details.internalDescription: FC COM port [port_name] with role [port_role]: link went down.
details.formatString: COM port %s (role: %s) link down.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The link didn't come up on a FC COM port for long time, depending on the port role, a physical path to local or remote cluster COM is missing.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The link didn't come up on a FC COM port for long time, depending on the port role, a physical path to local or remote cluster COM is missing.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the state of the COM port, make sure it is enabled; check the cable and the SFP, make sure they are properly plugged in; check the switch if applicable, make sure it is operational and the corresponding port is enabled. However, if this is a single cluster deployment, it is ok for a COM port with role wan-com not to reach link up.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the state of the COM port, make sure it is enabled; check the cable and the SFP, make sure they are properly plugged in; check the switch if applicable, make sure it is operational and the corresponding port is enabled. However, if this is a single cluster deployment, it is ok for a COM port with role wan-com not to reach link up. Contact EMC support.

details.customerDescription: FC COM port [port_name] with role [port_role] hasn't reached link up after [timeout].
details.internalDescription: FC COM port [port_name] with role [port_role] hasn't reached link up after [timeout].
details.formatString: COM port %s (role: %s) didn't reach link up in %s.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The interface is found, the status is unknown.

details.customerDescription: found local interface (%d) (name: %s).
details.internalDescription: The Plex found an ethernet interface with index [index] and name [ifName].
details.formatString: found local interface (%d) (name: %s).

details.arguments: index ifname address mask netmask bandwidth
details.customerDescription: local interface (%d) (name: %s) address: %s:%s bandwidth %u just became up.
details.internalDescription: The local ethernet interface index [index] name [ifName] just became online with IP address [address] and network mask [netmask]. The first hop bandwidth is [bandwidth] bps (0 means unknown).
details.formatString: local interface (%d) (name: %s) address: %s:%s bandwidth %u just became up.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check the ethernet cable and the directly attached switch/router.

details.arguments: index ifname address mask netmask bandwidth
details.customerDescription: local interface (%d) (name: %s) address: %s:%s bandwidth %u just went down.
details.internalDescription: The ethernet cable attached to the port may have been pulled; or the directly attached switch/router may be resetting.
details.formatString: local interface (%d) (name: %s) address: %s:%s bandwidth %u just went down.

details.arguments: index ifname address mask netmask bandwidth
details.customerDescription: local interface (%d) (name: %s) address: %s:%s bandwidth %u configuration changed.
details.internalDescription: The configuration of ethernet interface index [index] name [name] has been updated. It should normally result in interface status or attribute change soon.
details.formatString: local interface (%d) (name: %s) address: %s:%s bandwidth %u configuration changed.

details.arguments: index ifname address mask netmask bandwidth
details.customerDescription: local interface (%d) (name: %s) address: %s:%s bandwidth %u attribute(s) changed.
details.internalDescription: At least one attribute of ethernet interface index [index] name [name] has changed.
details.formatString: local interface (%d) (name: %s) address: %s:%s bandwidth %u attribute(s) changed.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A director with [uuid1] just connected to local director, however, it has the same IP address / port number pair as a departed director with [uuid2].

details.customerDescription: a new director 0x%016llx service %s took the IP address and port number of obsolete director 0x%016llx.
details.formatString: a new director 0x%016llx service %s took the IP address and port number of obsolete director 0x%016llx.

details.arguments: uuid service r_minconn r_maxconn l_minconn l_maxconn u_minconn u_maxconn
details.customerDescription: director 0x%016llx service %s has different connection count setings (min %u, max %u) than local director (min %u, max %u), using (min %u, max %u)
details.internalDescription: Just established connection(s) to a remote director [uuid], however, the remote director and the local director have different minconn/maxconn settings. Using u_minconn and u_maxconn for minconn/maxconn values, which is the maximum of [r_minconn] and [l_minconn] for minconn, and the maximum of [r_maxconn] and [l_maxconn] for maxconn. Administrative action should be taken to eliminate this difference.
details.formatString: director 0x%016llx service %s has different connection count setings (min %u, max %u) than local director (min %u, max %u), using (min %u, max %u)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Service [service] started to listen on port [port].

details.customerDescription: Service %s listens on port %d."
details.internalDescription: Service [service] started to listen on port [port].
details.formatString: Service %s listens on port %d."

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event only show up when CTS_DEBUG_RECVSTALL is enabled to level 2 or higher (not part of a production build). It indicates that the connection [pointer] hasn't received any incoming byte for [seconds]. And com/tcp will try to rectify it by close the connection soon.

details.customerDescription: conn %p service %s lost activity for %u sec.
details.formatString: conn %p service %s lost activity for %u sec.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Select() indicates that there were something ready on connection [pointer] for receiving, but recv() returned zero byte. This is a good indication that the connection is broken.

details.customerDescription: ready conn %p service %s sent 0 byte?
details.formatString: ready conn %p service %s sent 0 byte?

details.customerDescription: Packet contents: %s
details.internalDescription: This event follows event 16, 17, 18 or 19, when a corrupted packet was received, dumping out the contents of the packet.
details.formatString: Packet contents: %s

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: received a packet with wrong magic from %s at connection state %s service %s
details.internalDescription: There is an incoming packet contains a wrong leading marker. If this happens too often, that means there is likely somebody attacking the Plex
details.formatString: received a packet with wrong magic from %s at connection state %s service %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: One incoming packet from IP address [addr] contains an unknown type [type]. Therefor the connection will be closed and the IO would continue on other avalable connections.

details.customerDescription: received a packet from %s with unknown type %d via service %s
details.formatString: received a packet from %s with unknown type %d via service %s

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: received a packet from %s with wrong checksum: %x %x" "via service %s
details.internalDescription: An incoming packet from [addr] contains a wrong checksum.
details.formatString: received a packet from %s with wrong checksum: %x %x" "via service %s

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: received a packet with wrong tail magic from %s via service %s
details.internalDescription: Received a packet with wrong tail marker.
details.formatString: received a packet with wrong tail magic from %s via service %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An IP network device is no longer present. The network device driver may have been unloaded by accident.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An IP network device is no longer present. The network device driver may have been unloaded by accident.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Reboot the director.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Reboot the director. If the problem persists, contact EMC technical support.

details.customerDescription: An IP network device is no longer present.
details.internalDescription: An IP network device is no longer present.
details.formatString: IP network device %s (port %s) is no longer present.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An IP network device that was missing is now present.

details.internalDescription: An IP network device is now present.
details.formatString: An IP network device %s (port %s) is now present.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An IP network port that was down is now up.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An IP network port that was down is now up.

details.internalDescription: An IP network port is now up.
details.formatString: An IP network port %s (%s) just became up.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Link went down on a port, depending on the port role, a physical path to local or remote cluster has been lost.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Link went down on a port, depending on the port role, a physical path to local or remote cluster has been lost.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the state of the port, make sure it is enabled; check the cable and the SFP, make sure they are properly plugged in; check the switch if applicable, make sure it is operational and the corresponding port is enabled.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the state of the port, make sure it is enabled; check the cable and the SFP, make sure they are properly plugged in; check the switch if applicable, make sure it is operational and the corresponding port is enabled. If the link remains down, contact EMC support.

details.customerDescription: An IP network port has gone down.
details.internalDescription: An IP network port has gone down.
details.formatString: IP network port %s (%s) has gone down.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Interface settings are different from firmware configurations. Reapplying the firmware configuration.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Reapplying the firmware configuration for IP port.

details.customerDescription: Reapplying the firmware configuration for IP port.
details.internalDescription: Interface settings are different from firmware configurations, reapplying the configuration.
details.formatString: Interface %s (%s) settings are different from the firmware configuration, reapplying the configuration.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Nvol read failed.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Unexpected nvol read error.
details.internalDescription: Unexpected nvol read error.
details.formatString: Unexpected nvol read result: %s.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A connection is degraded. The link path between two directors is experiencing high packet loss, high latency or degraded bandwidth problem.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A connection is degraded. The link path between two directors is experiencing high packet loss, high latency or degraded bandwidth problem.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the network cable and SFP, make sure they are properly plugged in and clean the Fiber connectors along the link path.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the network cable and SFP, make sure they are properly plugged in and clean the Fiber connectors along the link path.

details.customerDescription: A connection is degraded.
details.internalDescription: A connection is degraded.
details.formatString: The connection %s from network port %s to IP %s is degraded.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A degraded connection is back to normal. This clears a previous connection degraded condition for this specific connection.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A degraded connection is back to normal. This clears a previous connection degraded condition for this specific connection.

details.customerDescription: A degraded connection is back to normal.
details.internalDescription: A degraded connection is back to normal.
details.formatString: The degraded connection %s from network port %s to IP %s is back to normal.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An SFP is missing, inserted incorrectly, or faulty.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An SFP is missing, inserted incorrectly, or faulty.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Apply the following measures until the issue has been resolved: 1. Identify the physical port specified in the event; 2. If the SFP is missing, insert a new SFP and attach the appropriate cable; 3. Re-seat the SFP; 4. Replace the SFP; 5. Contact EMC for FRU to replace the IO SLIC.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC customer support.

details.customerDescription: An SFP on Ethernet port is not responding.
details.internalDescription: An SFP on Ethernet port is not responding.
details.formatString: SFP is not detected on port %s (dev %s)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An SFP that had previously been missing has now been detected.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An SFP that had previously been missing has now been detected.

details.customerDescription: An SFP that was previously not responding has been detected.
details.internalDescription: An SFP that was previously not responding has been detected.
details.formatString: SFP has been detected on port %s (dev %s)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The EMC part number of the SFP was not recognized. It is required to use EMC approved SPFs with the EMC products.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The EMC part number of the SFP was not recognized. It is required to use EMC approved SPFs with the EMC products.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Replace the SFP with an EMC approved SFP for the product.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC customer support.

details.customerDescription: The port is equipped with an SFP which is not approved by EMC. Please contact EMC customer support for replacement.
details.internalDescription: The port is equipped with an SFP which is not approved by EMC. Verify how this SFP end up in the shipped product and replace it.
details.formatString: SFP on port %s (dev %s) is not an EMC approved part: manufacture \"%s\", part number \"%s\", serial number \"%s\"

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A port, previously detected equipped with an SFP not approved by EMC, has now been equipped with an SFP approved by EMC.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A port, previously detected equipped with an SFP not approved by EMC, has now been equipped with an SFP approved by EMC.

details.customerDescription: An SPF not approved by EMC, has been replaced with an approved SFP.
details.internalDescription: An SPF not approved by EMC, has been replaced with an approved SFP.
details.formatString: SFP on port %s (dev %s) has been replaced with an EMC approved part: manufacture \"%s\" part number \"%s\" serial number \"%s\"

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Incoming laser is not detected on an optical Ethernet port.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Incoming laser is not detected on an optical Ethernet port.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Apply the following measures until the issue has been resolved: 1. Identify the physical port mentioned in this event. 2. Check if the optical cable had been inserted into the SFP, plug in cable if needed. 3. Reseat the SFP. 4. Follow the optical cable to the switch, write down the switch/port information. 5. Inspect the switch side cabling/SFP issues. 6. Verify the switch port configuration.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC customer support.

details.customerDescription: No incoming laser had been detected on an Ethernet port.
details.internalDescription: No incoming laser had been detected on an Ethernet port [port_name] (device [device_name]).
details.formatString: port %s (dev %s) detects no receive power

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Incoming laser is detected on a port that previously detected no incoming laser..
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Incoming laser is detected on a port that previously detected no incoming laser..

details.customerDescription: Incoming laser is detected on a port previously without incoming laser.
details.internalDescription: Incoming laser is detected on a port previously without incoming laser.
details.formatString: port %s (dev %s) has detected receive power

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: One 10Gig Ethernet IO module has defective firmware.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC support to get replacement 10Gig Ethernet IO module.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: One 10Gig Ethernet IO module has firmware version that is earlier than any validated version .
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Replace the 10Gig Ethernet IO module.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC support to get replacement 10Gig Ethernet IO module.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The DISK layer has been notified of the arrival of the storage volume with scsi target pointer [TargetPointer] and logical unit id [TargetId], and this is a storage volume that has been previously seen by the DISK layer.

details.customerDescription: target %p id %s already initialized
details.formatString: target %p id %s already initialized

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The DISK layer has been notified of the arrival of the storage volume with logical unit id [ID], and it has repeatedly tried and failed to get its capacity with the scsi READ CAPACITY command. Because of this, the DISK layer will not notify the AMF layer of this storage volume. If the storage volume is part of a device group, this may prevent that device group from becoming online.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: storage volume %s: scsi_readCapacity failed
details.internalDescription: The reported storage volume did not respond as expected to a READ CAPACITY during storage volume discovery. This storage volume may require servicing or replacing.
details.formatString: storage volume %s: scsi_readCapacity failed

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The DISK layer is ignoring the storage volume with logical unit [ID], because it failed to allocate memory to increase the size of the storage volume pool. If the storage volume is part of a device group, this may prevent that device group from becoming online.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Remove the latest storage volumes added to the Plex and remaining storage volumes will be recognized. Contact EMC Technical Support for advice on upgrading your Plex

details.customerDescription: could not grow storage volume pool, storage volume %s ignored
details.internalDescription: The Plex discovered more storage volumes than it can currently handle, and failed to allocated more memory to handle those extra storage volumes. The extra storage volumes will be ignored.
details.formatString: could not grow storage volume pool, storage volume %s ignored

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [This event is now obsolete - it is no longer produced.] The DISK layer is re-trying an I/O on the storage volume with wwn [wwn]. Specifically, it is re-trying an operation of type [op] (allowed values: read, write) on the block range from [phaseStart] up to, but not including, [phaseEnd]. This is actually one phase of the I/O from block [ioStart] up to, but not including, [ioEnd]. Note: smaller I/Os will have only one phase, resulting in the phase start and end equaling the I/O start and end, respectively.

details.arguments: wwn op phaseStart phaseEnd ioStart ioEnd
details.customerDescription: storage volume 0x%016llx: re-trying %s, phase: [%lu, %lu) of i/o: [%lu, %lu)
details.formatString: storage volume 0x%016llx: re-trying %s, phase: [%lu, %lu) of i/o: [%lu, %lu)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [This event is now obsolete - it is no longer produced.] The DISK layer is re-trying a scsi READ CAPACITY command on the storage volume with logical unit id [ID].

details.customerDescription: storage volume %s: re-trying READ CAPACITY
details.formatString: storage volume %s: re-trying READ CAPACITY

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The DISK layer is re-trying an I/O on the storage volume with logical unit id [ID]. Specifically, it is re-trying an operation of type [op] (allowed values: read, write) on the block range from [ioStart] up to, but not including, [ioEnd]. A free-form short text description of the reason for the re-try is in [reason]. This reason is meant to help in debugging and post-mortem analysis. The [debugValue] field contains a value useful for debugging and post-mortem analysis.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Monitor the storage volume to see if retries become more frequent. If they become more frequent, replace the storage volume.

details.arguments: id op ioStart ioEnd reason debugValue
details.customerDescription: storage volume %s: re-trying %s [%lu, %lu) reason \"%s\" 0x%x
details.internalDescription: A transient error was detected while trying to read or write the given block range of the given storage volume. The operation will be re-tried. If it fails after many re-tries, then the failure will be escalated.
details.formatString: storage volume %s: re-trying %s [%lu, %lu) reason \"%s\" 0x%x

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [This event is now obsolete - it is no longer produced.] This is the same as event storageVolume/6, but it occurs at a different place in the code.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Monitor the storage volume to see if retries become more frequent. If they become more frequent, replace the storage volume.

details.customerDescription: storage volume 0x%016llx: re-trying %s [%lu, %lu)

details.formatString: storage volume 0x%016llx: re-trying %s [%lu, %lu)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [This event is now obsolete - it is no longer produced.] This is the same as event storageVolume/6, but it occurs at a different place in the code.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Monitor the storage volume to see if retries become more frequent. If they become more frequent, replace the storage volume.

details.customerDescription: storage volume 0x%016llx: re-trying %s [%lu, %lu)
details.internalDescription: A transient error was detected while trying to read or write the given block range of the given storage volume. The operation will be re-tried.
details.formatString: storage volume 0x%016llx: re-trying %s [%lu, %lu)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [This event is now obsolete - it is no longer produced.] This is the same as event storageVolume/6, but it occurs at a different place in the code.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Monitor the storage volume to see if retries become more frequent. If they become more frequent, replace the storage volume.

details.customerDescription: storage volume 0x%016llx: re-trying %s [%lu, %lu)
details.internalDescription: A transient error was detected while trying to read or write the given block range of the given storage volume. The operation will be re-tried. If it fails after many re-tries, then the failure will be escalated.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The DISK layer has re-tried on I/O on the storage volume with logical unit id [ID] a number of times, and is now giving up and reporting an I/O failure to the AMF layer. The specific I/O was of type [op] (allowed values: read, write) on the block range from [ioStart] up to, but not including, [ioEnd]. A free-form short text description of the reason for the re-try is in [reason]. This reason is meant to help in debugging and post-mortem analysis. The [debugValue] field contains a value useful for debugging and post-mortem analysis.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Monitor the storage volume to see if retries become more frequent. If they become more frequent, replace the storage volume.

details.arguments: id op ioStart ioEnd reason debugValue

details.formatString: can't create storageVolumeInit thread

details.customerDescription: storage volume id 0x%016llx could not set mode pages - mode select failed with status %lu
details.formatString: storage volume id 0x%016llx could not set mode pages - mode select failed with status %lu

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [This event is now obsolete - it is no longer produced.]

details.customerDescription: storage volume id 0x%016llx has \"unknown\" vendor "combination %s / %s - not setting mode pages
details.formatString: storage volume id 0x%016llx has \"unknown\" vendor "combination %s / %s - not setting mode pages

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [This event is now obsolete - it is no longer produced.]

details.customerDescription: storage volume 0x%016llx: re-trying attempt to set mode pages
details.formatString: storage volume 0x%016llx: re-trying attempt to set mode pages

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The DISK layer has been notified of the arrival of the storage volume with logical unit [luid], and it has repeatedly tried and failed to get its inquiry data with the scsi INQUIRY command. Because of this, the DISK layer will not notify the AMF layer of this storage volume. If the storage volume is part of a device group, this may prevent that device group from becoming online.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: storage volume %s: scsi_inquiry failed
details.internalDescription: The reported storage volume did not respond as expected to an INQUIRY during storage volume discovery. This storage volume may require servicing or replacing.
details.formatString: storage volume %s: scsi_inquiry failed

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The DISK layer is re-trying a scsi READ CAPACITY command on the storage volume with logical unit id [luid].

details.customerDescription: storage volume %s: re-trying INQUIRY
details.formatString: storage volume %s: re-trying INQUIRY

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The tower tried to set all mode pages for the storage volume with logical unit id [luid]. However, the action failed, because the SCSI mode select command failed with status [errCode]. The value [errCode] is not a standard SCSI error value; it is a value used internally in the tower. It is present here to aid in debugging.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support. The storage volume may require replacement.

details.customerDescription: storage volume %s could not set mode pages - mode select failed with status %lu
details.internalDescription: During initial storage volume setup, the writing of configuration data failed.
details.formatString: storage volume %s could not set mode pages - mode select failed with status %lu

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The tower wants to set all mode pages for the storage volume with logical unit id [luid]. However, the tower will only go ahead and set all mode pages if the storageVolume's model is among one of a known set. In this case, the storageVolume's vendor ID [vendorId] and product ID [productId] are not in that known set, so the mode pages have not been set. The tower will continue to use the storage volume, but the mode settings for the storage volume are not known to have reasonable and consistent values, so there is a small probability of unpredictable behaviour.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support for advice on upgrading your Plex

details.customerDescription: storage volume %s \"unknown\" vendor "combination %s / %s - not setting mode pages
details.internalDescription: The reported storage volume type is not fully supported in this software release. Mode page settings cannot be applied to this storage volume.
details.formatString: storage volume %s \"unknown\" vendor "combination %s / %s - not setting mode pages

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The scsi layer is re-trying an attempt to set all the mode pages on the storage volume with logical unit id [luid].

details.customerDescription: storage volume %s: re-trying attempt to set mode pages
details.formatString: storage volume %s: re-trying attempt to set mode pages

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Storage volume [ID] returned sense key ABORTED COMMAND on [op] (read, write) on the specified block range. This might be an indication of an occurrence of spr 7331. Once that spr is fixed, this event should be deleted both from this file and the code that generates the event message. (Why deleted? Because in a perfect world, or even in a world of limited crappiness, there isn't any reason to have a heart attack over a single instance of ABORTED COMMAND.)
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If notices of this type become frequent, contact EMC technical support.

details.customerDescription: storage volume %s: %s [%u, %u): Possible data corruption detected, contact EMC technical support
details.internalDescription: An error was detected while trying to read or write the given block range of the given storage volume. The operation will be re-tried. If it fails after many re-tries, then the failure will be escalated. In addition, there have been situations wherein large numbers of this type of error have occurred in conjuction with data corruption. Therefore, this error may indicate data corruption.
details.formatString: storage volume %s: %s [%u, %u): Possible data corruption detected, contact EMC technical support

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The DISK layer is re-trying an I/O on the storage volume with logical unit id [ID]. Specifically, it is re-trying an operation of type [op] (allowed values: read, write) on the block range from [ioStart] up to, but not including, [ioEnd]. The reason for the re-try is that less data was received by the tower than was expected for the operation, and when many of these errors occur, the problem is usually a bad cable or SFP.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Monitor the storage volume to see if retries become more frequent. If they become more frequent, try cleaning or replacing cable(s) or replacing SFP(s) in the path to the storage volume.

details.customerDescription: Storage volume retrying due to data underrun.
details.internalDescription: A transient error was detected while trying to read or write the given block range of the given storage volume. The operation will be re-tried. If it fails after many re-tries, then the failure will be escalated.
details.formatString: storage volume %s: re-trying %s [%lu, %lu) reason: data underrun, check cables/SFPs

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The DISK layer has re-tried on I/O on the storage volume with logical unit id [ID] a number of times, and is now giving up and reporting an I/O failure to the AMF layer. The specific I/O was of type [op] (allowed values: read, write) on the block range from [ioStart] up to, but not including, [ioEnd]. The reason for the re-try is that less data was received by the tower than was expected for the operation, and when many of these errors occur, the problem is usually a bad cable or SFP.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check event logs to see if the retries have been frequent. If they have been frequent, try cleaning or replacing cable(s) or replacing SFP(s) in the path to the storage volume. In addition, it will be necessary to issue the "amf resurrect" command to make the storage volume usable.

details.arguments: id op ioStart ioEnd reason debugValue
details.customerDescription: Storage volume communication problem due to data underrun.
details.internalDescription: A series of transient errors were detected while trying to read or write the given block range of the given storage volume. The failure has been escalated, and the operation will not be re-tried.
details.formatString: storage volume %s: communication problem, giving up on %s [%lu, %lu) reason: data underrun, check cables/SFPs

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check the SCSI storage device where the problem storage volume comes from and try to clear the reservation from management interface of the storage device. Once the reservation is cleared, the user should run a 'disk renew' to re-initialize this storage volume

details.customerDescription: storage volume %s: reservation conflict detected, please clear the reservation on the storage volume
details.internalDescription: A storage volume that has been previously reserved by a third-party initiator is discovered. Because of the outstanding reservation, our firmware receives reservation conflict SCSI status code for certain scsi commands it sends.
details.formatString: storage volume %s: reservation conflict detected, please clear the reservation on the storage volume

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event tells what scsi implementation (its name is [name]) is being used.

details.customerDescription: using %s storage volume implementation
details.formatString: using %s storage volume implementation

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Increase GENERIC_DISK_MAX_DRIVERS.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Call EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Too many storage volume drivers, ignoring driver %s
details.internalDescription: The Plex has not enough room to store a storage volume driver, it will continue without this storage volume driver.
details.formatString: Too many storage volume drivers, ignoring driver %s

details.customerDescription: no memory for storage volume
details.internalDescription: A memory shortage has prevented the Plex from allocating a data structure to store information about a storage volume. The Plex will continue without this storage volume.
details.formatString: no memory for storage volume

details.customerDescription: found storage volume %s
details.internalDescription: The Plex has gained visibility to a storage volume.
details.formatString: found storage volume %s

details.customerDescription: lost storage volume %s
details.internalDescription: The Plex has lost visibility to a storage volume.
details.formatString: lost storage volume %s

details.customerDescription: no memory for scsi storage volume %s
details.internalDescription: A memory shortage has prevented the Plex from allocating a data structure to store information about a scsi storage volume. The Plex will continue without this storage volume.
details.formatString: no memory for scsi storage volume %s

details.customerDescription: no memory for '%s' command on scsi storage volume %s
details.internalDescription: A memory shortage has prevented the Plex from issuing a scsi command to a scsi storage volume. The Plex will retry the command.
details.formatString: no memory for '%s' command on scsi storage volume %s

details.customerDescription: scsi storage volume %s does not allow changing of '%s' mode parameter in '%s' mode page
details.internalDescription: The results from a mode sense indicate that the Plex would prefer to change a mode parameter in a mode page for a scsi storage volume but was not allowed to do so. The Plex will continue without changing the mode parameter.
details.formatString: scsi storage volume %s does not allow changing of '%s' mode parameter in '%s' mode page

details.customerDescription: scsi storage volume %s could not find pageCode %d in changeable values
details.internalDescription: The results from a mode sense indicate that the Plex would prefer to change a mode parameter in a mode page for a scsi storage volume but was not allowed to do so. The Plex will continue without changing the mode parameter.
details.formatString: scsi storage volume %s could not find pageCode %d in changeable values

details.customerDescription: scsi storage volume %s does not support saving mode pages
details.internalDescription: The Plex would like to save some mode parameters on a scsi storage volume but detected that the storage volume does not support saveable mode pages. The Plex will continue without saving mode parameters.
details.formatString: scsi storage volume %s does not support saving mode pages

details.customerDescription: scsi storage volume %s does not support changing mode pages
details.internalDescription: The Plex would like to change some mode parameters on a scsi storage volume but detected that the storage volume does not support changeable mode pages. The Plex will continue without changing mode parameters.
details.formatString: scsi storage volume %s does not support changing mode pages

details.customerDescription: read capacity 16 command retried too often on scsi storage volume %s
details.internalDescription: A scsi storage volume repeats giving unexpected responses to the Read Capacity 16 command. The Plex will continue without this storage volume.
details.formatString: read capacity 16 command retried too often on scsi storage volume %s

details.customerDescription: Storage volume is temporary unavailable for I/O because it is in the middle of an implicit ALUA transition.
details.internalDescription: VPLEX will continue operating without this storage volume.
details.formatString: Storage volume %s started implicit ALUA transition handling

details.customerDescription: Stop waiting for implicit ALUA transition to finish because the state of the storage volume changed to unknown.
details.internalDescription: Most likely the scsi layer detected that the implicit ALUA transition finished and is figuring out which paths are active optimized and non-optimized. The Plex will continue with this storage volume.
details.formatString: storage volume %s stopped ALUA transition handling

details.customerDescription: Finished waiting for implicit ALUA transition.
details.internalDescription: Reenable I/O for the affected storage volume. The Plex will continue with this storage volume.
details.formatString: storage volume %s finished implicit ALUA transition handling

details.customerDescription: The Implicit ALUA transition on a storage volume took too long.
details.internalDescription: Stop waiting for it. Resume I/O and stumble along.
details.formatString: Test Unit Ready command retried too often on storage volume %s

details.customerDescription: Storage volume cannot start implicit ALUA transition handling due to out of memory condition.
details.internalDescription: I/Os to this storage volume are not suspended and as a consequence the implicit ALUA transition may take more time.
details.formatString: Storage volume %s can't start ALUA transition handling (no resources)

details.customerDescription: no memory for virtual storage volume %s
details.internalDescription: A memory shortage has prevented the Plex from allocating a data structure to store information about a virtual storage volume. The Plex will continue without this storage volume.
details.formatString: no memory for virtual storage volume %s

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC technical support for assistance in determining the cause of the failure and appropriate recovery steps.

details.customerDescription: Disruption [disruptionType] while [componentName] in hurt mode
details.internalDescription: During failure recovery, another disruption occurred, and could not be handled. Plex integrity may be compromised.
details.formatString: Disruption %u while %s in hurt mode

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Dmg is failing over.

details.customerDescription: dmg is failing over
details.internalDescription: This message is reported during the normal director failure recovery process.
details.formatString: dmg is failing over

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The dserver has been redetermined, but this particular NS was and still is the dserver.

details.customerDescription: I am still the dserver
details.formatString: I am still the dserver

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The dserver has been redetermined. This NS used to be the dserver but is not any more.

details.customerDescription: I am no longer the dserver
details.formatString: I am no longer the dserver

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The dserver has been redetermined. This NS was not the dserver before, but now it is.

details.customerDescription: I am now the dserver
details.formatString: I am now the dserver

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: If the tower is using the concept of quorum, this message indicates that the DMG is shutting down due to a loss of quorum.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: quorum lost, shutting down
details.internalDescription: The Plex is expecting more directors than are currently active. This may be due to multi-director failure or loss of communications between Control Frames in the Plex
details.formatString: quorum lost, shutting down

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Upon loss of quorum, the DMG will shut down the dserver functionality.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check all inter-chassis connections. If problem persists, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: terminating dserver port
details.internalDescription: The Plex is expecting more directors than are currently active. This may be due to multi-director failure or loss of communications between Control Frames in the Plex
details.formatString: terminating dserver port

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The failure recovery for virtual volume [volumeName] has completed. Recovery is done on a per-volume basis, rather than a per-snac basis.

details.customerDescription: Failure recovery completed for virtual volume %s (0x%llx)
details.formatString: Failure recovery completed for virtual volume %s (0x%llx)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: There has been a director group change, so this existing director is sending its virtual volume state information to the dserver.

details.customerDescription: Sending virtual volume attachment info to dserver
details.formatString: Sending virtual volume attachment info to dserver

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [This event is now obsolete - it is no longer produced.] The membership of the NS's current share group has been updated because of a new member joining or a current member leaving.

details.customerDescription: DMG: Share group membership updated
details.formatString: DMG: Share group membership updated

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Failure recovery for virtual volume [volumeName] ([clusterGroup]) is beginning.

details.customerDescription: Initiating failure recovery for virtual volume %s (0x%llx)
details.formatString: Initiating failure recovery for virtual volume %s (0x%llx)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Some directors were unable to flush the relevant virtual volume on a group change. Therefore, the group change is being abandoned until such time as the directors are able to flush again.

details.customerDescription: dclient abandoning current request
details.formatString: dclient abandoning current request

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An attempt was made on a group change to flush this partition, but the flush failed.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check the state of the storage volumes on the Device Configuration screen. For any storage volumes that are not alive, check physical connections to the enclosures and that all storage volumes are seated properly and powered on.

details.customerDescription: Could not flush virtual volume %s
details.internalDescription: During a configuration change, the Plex attempted to flush cached data but was unable to do so because one or more storage volumes were unreachable. The Plex will retry once the storage volumes become reachable.
details.formatString: Could not flush virtual volume %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: After a director departs, the Plex will be performing failure recoveries, and it is not safe for director changes (insertions, removals or restarts) to take place. After this event, it is safe for these things to happen.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is required; however, if a director addition is desired, the Plex is now ready to receive another director.

details.customerDescription: Failure recovery completed for all virtual volumes.
details.internalDescription: The Plex has completed failover recovery. director insertion is now possible.
details.formatString: Failure recovery completed for all virtual volumes.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This NS has successfully registered to virtual volume [volumeName].

details.customerDescription: Registration complete to virtual volume %s
details.formatString: Registration complete to virtual volume %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This NS has successfully deregistered from virtual volume [volumeName].

details.customerDescription: Deregistration complete from virtual volume %s
details.formatString: Deregistration complete from virtual volume %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The membership of the NS's current share group has been updated because of a new member joining or a current member leaving for virtual volume [volumeName].

details.customerDescription: Share group membership updated for virtual volume %s
details.formatString: Share group membership updated for virtual volume %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [This event is now obsolete - it is no longer produced.] Flushing on all directors in the share group for virtual volume [volumeName] has completed, marking the conclusion of all recovery for this virtual volume.

details.customerDescription: Completed flushes on virtual volume %s
details.formatString: Completed flushes on virtual volume %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: All of failure recovery has completed on all virtual volumes. Therefore, the Plex is out of degraded mode, and additional director failures can be tolerated.

details.customerDescription: Exiting degraded mode
details.formatString: Exiting degraded mode

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [partName] [suspended seconds] [suspended 1/10000 seconds] [drain seconds] [drain 1/10000 seconds] This event is currently used only for detaches, to indicate how long it took us to process some other director's detach from the given partition. The first time is the total length of time for which I/O was suspended, the second time is the amount of time it took for active I/Os to drain once we started the suspend.

details.customerDescription: %s suspended %lld.%04lld s (drain %lld.%04lld s)
details.formatString: %s suspended %lld.%04lld s (drain %lld.%04lld s)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Recovery from one or more director failures (with all links up) took longer than a particular threshold, putting hosts connected to that volume at risk of a DU. The system should be examined to see if this is the case, and if so, whether intervention is required.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: If any hosts experienced a DU, they may need to be recovered.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: If any hosts experienced a DU, they may need to be recovered.

details.customerDescription: Recovery from simple director failure took too long.
details.internalDescription: Recovery from simple director failure took too long.
details.formatString: Recovery from simple director failure took %llu.%03llu seconds

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If the problem occurs frequently, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: fc%lu: resetting due to missing IO completion(s)
details.internalDescription: The Plex is recovering from an internal error that only affects the reported port. Host I/O is not affected.
details.formatString: fc%lu: resetting due to missing IO completion(s)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [This event is now obsolete - it is no longer produced.] Found a device with wwn [wwn].

details.customerDescription: fc: found device 0x%016llx
details.internalDescription: A device with the reported WWN is now available for use. A wwn starting with 0x20000004cf is a Seagate storage volume. A wwn starting with 0x2000000453 is a director.
details.formatString: fc: found device 0x%016llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [This event is now obsolete - it is no longer produced.] Lost the device with wwn [wwn].
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check all SFPs and cables for good connections, especially any that were changed recently. Check for a "link up" light on the attached Fibre Channel switch. If the problem persists, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: fc: lost device 0x%016llx
details.internalDescription: A device with the reported WWN is no longer available for use. A wwn starting with 0x20000004cf is a Seagate storage volume. A wwn starting with 0x2000000453 is a director.
details.formatString: fc: lost device 0x%016llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [This event is now obsolete - it is no longer produced.] Port [portId] found activity on the wire.

details.customerDescription: fc%ld: link up
details.internalDescription: This back-end port is now available to communicate with storage volumes.
details.formatString: fc%ld: link up

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [This event is now obsolete - it is no longer produced.] Port [portId] lost activity on the wire.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check the SFP, cable, and switch attached to this back-end port, especially anything that has been changed recently. If problem persists, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: fc%ld: link down
details.internalDescription: The reported Fibre Channel port has no signal therefore no devices are accessibe through that port. Devices may still be accessible through another port, but the maximum possible throughput is decreased.
details.formatString: fc%ld: link down

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [This event is now obsolete - it is no longer produced.] Found loop [nPortId] from port [portId]. Discard this event in case Nishans (that do nPortId remapping) are involved.

details.customerDescription: fc%lu: found loop 0x%06x
details.internalDescription: A loop of devices has joined the fabric viewable through the reported port. This event occurs when a storage volume enclosure is connected. Note that some long haul iFCP devices may cause this event to be erroneously reported.
details.formatString: fc%lu: found loop 0x%06x

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [This event is now obsolete - it is no longer produced.] Lost loop [nPortId] from port [portId]. Discard this event in case Nishans (that do nPortId remapping) are involved.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check for failures in all Fibre Channel equipment linking the loop device to the backend switch.

details.customerDescription: fc%lu: lost loop 0x%06x
details.internalDescription: A loop of devices has left the fabric viewable through the reported port. Possible failures that can cause this problem include SFP failure, enclosure I/O module failure, switch port failure, disconnecting or powering off an enclosure, or a cable failure between the loop device and the switch. Note that some long haul iFCP devices may cause this event to be erroneously reported.
details.formatString: fc%lu: lost loop 0x%06x

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [This event is now obsolete - it is no longer produced.] Resetting fibre channel device with wwn [wwn]. If the reset fails the user will eventually get a message that the storageVolume/device is unreachable from a higher layer.

details.customerDescription: fc: reset of target device [wwn]
details.formatString: fc: reset of target device [wwn]

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [This event is now obsolete - it is no longer produced.] Log out followed by log in to detect whether target device [wwn] has disappeared. If the login fails the user will eventually get a message that the storageVolume/device is unreachable from a higher layer.

details.customerDescription: fc: logout
details.formatString: fc: logout

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This indicates a malformed response from the board manager to an environment variable operation.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action required.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The NS has completed its initialization.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This is a duplicate of event 2. It just happens to be generated from a different place in the code. The same event number should probably have been used.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The tower (director software) is halting with status [status]. The effect of this depends on whether or not the watchdog timer is set to reboot the board. %%%: This entry needs updating when we finally decide what the watchdog setting is for the customer setup.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: tower halting with status [status]

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This is a duplicate of event 2, except it only occurs on a hosted environment that customers will never have. We should probably just have used event 2.

details.customerDescription: Director initialization complete.
details.internalDescription: This director finished initialization. The Plex is ready for use once the majority of the directors finish their initialization.
details.formatString: Director initialization complete.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A spurious isr occurs when, by the time the mips responds to an interrupt, the interrupt request has been removed. If spurious isr's occur repeatedly, it would be good to hear about them but we'll have to just watch for these in the 'yylog' file hidden away from customer eyes. Customer support will make a habit of taking copies of these logs whenever we have access to customer Plex .

details.formatString: spurious isr

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The floor code which chooses what Fibre Channel WWN's to use for the back-end Fibre Channel chips, and the "hard" WWN pairs for the front-end Fibre Channel chips has noticed that the 48 bit IEEE Mac on an Aries card does not contain the original EMC OUID (0x000453). This is not fatal, but is an interesting occurrence.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support. The reported director should be returned to EMC for servicing.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Displays heap memory consumption, including current use both as a scalar and as a ratio of total heap size, and shows the change since the last floor/30 or floor/31 event was emitted.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Consider sequentially rebooting the directors to counteract a potential memory leak. Start with the director that has the least free memory, since extra memory is required during failure recovery. The "mem watch" or "mem stats" commands can be used to query space usage on each director.

details.formatString: %s: verbs initialized

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Incorrect configuration in Gamla eeprom image. It is supposed to be configured to cause the Gamla to load its microcode and configuration from the driver over the pci bus but it has loaded automatically, potentially using the wrong code or configuration. You are strongly encouraged to run initboard and restart the tower.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: %s: gamla microcode already loaded
details.internalDescription: An unexpected internal error occurred.
details.formatString: %s: gamla microcode already loaded

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The MIPS is expecting a download status of 1 (Gamla waiting for download) or 3 (download done). Any other status means that the Gamla microcode is in an unexpected state, likely due to old or corrupted eeprom images. Run initboard and restart the tower.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: %s: init failed: unexpected download status: %d
details.internalDescription: An unexpected internal error occurred.
details.formatString: %s: init failed: unexpected download status: %d

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Any value other than 0xa0 or 0xa1 means that the Gamla state is corrupted or Mellanox created a new chip and didn't tell us. Very unlikely.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: %s: init failed: unknown chip rev: 0x%x
details.internalDescription: An unexpected internal error occurred.
details.formatString: %s: init failed: unknown chip rev: 0x%x

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Gamla eeprom image and the microcode stored in the tower are not compatible. Run initboard and restart tower.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: %s: init failed: gamla fw loader incompatible
details.internalDescription: An unexpected internal error occurred.
details.formatString: %s: init failed: gamla fw loader incompatible

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The tower gave up waiting for the Gamla to download its microcode, likely due to the wrong contents on the eeprom (ie. A0 microcode for an A1 Gamla or vice versa). Run initboard and restart the tower.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: %s: init failed: fw download timed out

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The ib driver read an unexpected value from DMAC.DMAEQ[eqNum].IBCSE. The failed descriptor is retried.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.internalDescription: An unexpected internal error occurred.
details.formatString: %s: unknown remote IB channel error 0x%x on EQ %d

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Gamla reported a local channel error. The Plex is either misconfigured or there was a transient failure. The failed descriptor is retried to deal with the latter. If it's a configuration problem then the descriptor will eventually exceed the maximum number of retries and the relevant QP will be moved into an error state. Please collect a Gamla register space dump and report the problem.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: %s: descriptor contents error on EQ %d
details.internalDescription: An unexpected internal error occurred.
details.formatString: %s: descriptor contents error on EQ %d

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Port link states are probed every second; whenever a link state changes the appropriate event (30,31,32) is generated. A linkUp state doesn't necessarily mean that IB traffic is able to flow, the subnet manager must bring the port states to ACTIVE after assigning LIDs.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check IB cables and Contact EMC Technical Support for assistance.

details.customerDescription: %s: both ib links down
details.internalDescription: Both IB links are down.
details.formatString: %s: both ib links down

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: See discussion under event ib/30.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: %s: ib link %d down
details.internalDescription: The mentioned IB link is down. The director has an IB connection to each switch, one of the connections is not functional. Link 0 is between the director and the lower switch, link 1 is to the upper. Note that there will be no further events until one or both link states change again, ie. the other link is lost or the lost link is re-established.
details.formatString: %s: ib link %d down

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: See discussion under event ib/30.

details.customerDescription: %s: both ib links up
details.internalDescription: Both IB links are up.
details.formatString: %s: both ib links up

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event will be followed by event 30. The purpose of this event is to help distinguish actual link failures from those brought about intentionally by the board manager as part of watchdog processing.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: %s: ib port(s) powered off (0x%x)

details.formatString: %s: ib port(s) powered off (0x%x)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A local IB port transitioned from an inactive to an active state. This is generally the result of the Subnet Manager assigning a LID to the port and activating it.

details.formatString: ib port 0x%llx is now active.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A local IB port transitioned from an active state to an inactive state. This is generally the result of the Subnet Manager disabling the port, of somebody disabling the switch port we are connected to or of somebody pulling the IB cable attached to this port.

details.customerDescription: ib port 0x%llx is now inactive.
details.formatString: ib port 0x%llx is now inactive.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A local IB port was able to complete its initial round of discovery after transitioning to an active state.

details.customerDescription: ib port 0x%llx completed discovery.
details.formatString: ib port 0x%llx completed discovery.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A local IB port is beginning its initial round of discovery after transitioning to an active state.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The physical link status is now up. This generally means that the ports on both sides of the physical link are now powered.

details.customerDescription: ib port 0x%llx link up.
details.formatString: ib port 0x%llx link up.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The physical link status is now down. This generally means the one of the ports on either side of the physical link has lost power or that an IB cable is no longer connected to the port.

details.customerDescription: ib port 0x%llx link down.
details.formatString: ib port 0x%llx link down.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The specified local port is in a direct-connect subnet with another director and has the higher port GUID. It is therefore starting a subnet manager instance.

details.customerDescription: ib port 0x%llx starting subnet manager.
details.formatString: ib port 0x%llx starting subnet manager.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The specified local port was the subnet manager for a direct-connect subnet between two directors, but the link has gone down. The subnet manager is therefore stopping.

details.customerDescription: ib port 0x%llx stopping subnet manager.
details.formatString: ib port 0x%llx stopping subnet manager.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The customer is using iblonghaul=1 on their Plex and their SM returned a large value for the timeout (>= 1 second) on a path record. We assume the timeout value to be correct, but since the timeout was so large warn the user of a possible misconfiguration.

details.customerDescription: Subnet manager returned a path a path timeout of %s for a PathRecord query. This may indicate an SM misconfiguration.
details.formatString: Subnet manager returned a path a path timeout of %s for a PathRecord query. This may indicate an SM misconfiguration.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The customer is not using iblonghaul=1 on their Plex and their SM returned a large value for the timeout (>= 1 second) on a path record. We assume the timeout value to be incorrect and override it with the specified value (which is a compile-time default of 524 us).

details.customerDescription: Subnet manager returned a path timeout of %s for a PathRecord query. Overriding with a timeout of %s.
details.formatString: Subnet manager returned a path timeout of %s for a PathRecord query. Overriding with a timeout of %s.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The ibdm component has commands to display the current cache of known services discovered on the fabric ("ibdm cache").

details.customerDescription: IB%d Arrival of service entry '0x%016llx "ioc 0x%016llx on IbPort guid 0x%016llx
details.internalDescription: Arrival of a discovered service entry on a DM-capable IbPort on the subnet.
details.formatString: IB%d Arrival of service entry '0x%016llx "ioc 0x%016llx on IbPort guid 0x%016llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The ibdm component has commands to display the current cache of known services discovered on the fabric ("ibdm cache").

details.customerDescription: IB%d Departure of service entry '0x%016llx "ioc 0x%016llx on IbPort guid 0x%016llx
details.internalDescription: Departure of a discovered service entry on a DM-capable IbPort on the subnet.
details.formatString: IB%d Departure of service entry '0x%016llx "ioc 0x%016llx on IbPort guid 0x%016llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The ibdm component has commands to display the current cache of known services discovered on the fabric ("ibdm cache"). It is also possible to trigger a rediscovery ("ibdm discover") before the next scheduled polling period.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Monitor subnet for packet loss or problems related to the IbPort identified.

details.customerDescription: IB%d reached error limit (%u) trying to discover remote IbPort guid 0x%016"FS64x" -- giving up until next round
details.internalDescription: Problems were encountered when attempting to communicate with DM-capable remote IbPort on the subnet. The DM cache may not be up to date.
details.formatString: IB%d reached error limit (%u) trying to discover remote IbPort guid 0x%016"FS64x" -- giving up until next round

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This should not happen. The consequence is that the Nmg will give up on trying to send a message. This is not normally fatal, unless it continues to happen, in which case this director will eventually be declared dead.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If this message occurs frequently, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Failed to resend message: %s
details.internalDescription: An unexpected error occurred in internal director communications. The Plex will retry and continue to function if further errors do not occur. Occassional occurences of this message are not a cause for alarm; however, frequent occurences may be an early indication of a potential single director failure.
details.formatString: Failed to resend message: %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This should not happen, since it indicates that the COM layer has given the director a departure notification for itself.
