As long as a corresponding arrival notification arrives before this director gives up on starting a discovery, this is not a serious problem. However, if the director gives up on starting discovery, then it will end up being declared dead by the other directors.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If this message occurs frequently, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Nmg: can't find self (0x%016llx) in unofficial list - discovery not started.
details.internalDescription: An unexpected error occurred in internal director communications. The Plex will retry and continue to function if further errors do not occur. Occassional occurences of this message are not a cause for alarm; however, frequent occurences may be an early indication of a potential single director failure.
details.formatString: Nmg: can't find self (0x%016llx) in unofficial list - discovery not started.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This should not happen. This director is attempting to send a discovery token, and the COM is returning an immediate failure. This generally indicates a disagreement between COM and the Nmg about what target addresses and ports are valid. If the problem goes away soon enough, the Nmg will recover. If not, this director will eventually be declared as dead.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If this message occurs frequently, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Nmg: failed to send discovery token: %s
details.internalDescription: An unexpected error occurred in internal director communications. The Plex will retry and continue to function if further errors do not occur. Occassional occurences of this message are not a cause for alarm; however, frequent occurences may be an early indication of a potential single director failure.
details.formatString: Nmg: failed to send discovery token: %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Nmg has received an arrival notification from the COM layer about a director that it already knows about. The Nmg ignores the duplicate notification.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Arriving director 0x%llx already on visible list
details.internalDescription: The reported arriving director is already known. The duplicate notification is ignored and the Plex continues to function normally.
details.formatString: Arriving director 0x%llx already on visible list

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Nmg has received a departure notification from the COM layer about a director that it doesn't know about. That can happen if the Nmg has already declared the director as gone for other reasons, such as failing to send a message to it. The Nmg ignores the notification.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If this message occurs frequently, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Never saw arrival of departing director 0x%llx
details.internalDescription: An unexpected error occurred in internal director communications. The Plex will retry and continue to function if further errors do not occur. Occasional occurences of this message are not a cause for alarm; however, frequent occurences may be an early indication of a potential single director failure.
details.formatString: Never saw arrival of departing director 0x%llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This should not happen. The Nmg has received a direct error from the COM call to send a "newSet" token on its way. The Nmg will give up on the immediate attempt. The normal Nmg recovery processes should trigger a discovery retry at a later time. If the error persists, then likely the Nmg will end up declaring this director as dead.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If this message occurs frequently, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Nmg: cannot start newSet token on its way: %s
details.internalDescription: An unexpected error occurred in internal director communications. The Plex will retry and continue to function if further errors do not occur. Occasional occurences of this message are not a cause for alarm; however, frequent occurences may be an early indication of a potential single director failure.
details.formatString: Nmg: cannot start newSet token on its way: %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: When the Nmg is discovering the set of active directors (directors), it sends a token around to accumulate the set. This director has received the token, which includes the COM Uuid of the found directors. This director has had no arrival notification of the listed lowest COM Uuid. Thus, this director cannot properly function in the set, and will remove its own COM Uuid from the set, effectively removing itself from the set that the remaining directors will consider alive. This situation can come about because of delayed arrival notifications from the COM layer. In that case, the Nmg usually recovers, and operation continues normally.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If this message persists, the director will not be useable and will require a reset. Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Nmg: I don't know about the" " lowest (0x%016llx), I'm removing myself
details.internalDescription: An unexpected error occurred in internal director communications.
details.formatString: Nmg: I don't know about the" " lowest (0x%016llx), I'm removing myself

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This director is trying to forward the discovery token to the next director in the forming loop, but has received an immediate COM error on the attempt. This could indicate that something has just happened with the communication link to that next director. The Nmg stops trying to forward the token, and relies on the normal discovery retry to continue, on the assumption that this director will either get a COM notification that the problem director has departed, or the problem will go away.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If this message occurs frequently, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Nmg: cannot forward discovery token on its way: %s
details.internalDescription: An unexpected error occurred in internal director communications. The Plex will retry and continue to function if further errors do not occur. Occasional occurences of this message are not a cause for alarm; however, frequent occurences may be an early indication of a potential single director failure.
details.formatString: Nmg: cannot forward discovery token on its way: %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This director has received a discovery token indicating that the lowest known COM Uuid is "sender-uuid", but this director has been notified of a director whose COM Uuid is lower (lowest-uuid). This generally indicates that the original sender is out of date in its COM notifications. The expectation is that the true lowest director will start discovery soon. This director thus simply drops the discovery token.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If this message occurs frequently, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Dropping discovery token from 0x%016llx - director" " 0x%016llx is my lowest
details.internalDescription: An unexpected error occurred in internal director communications. The Plex will retry and continue to function if further errors do not occur. Occasional occurences of this message are not a cause for alarm; however, frequent occurences may be an early indication of a potential single director failure.
details.formatString: Dropping discovery token from 0x%016llx - director" " 0x%016llx is my lowest

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A properly configured customer Plex should not see this, and if seen, it indicates a misconfiguration of that customer Plex. The Plex will often run fine after this event. Customer Plex must be corrected to guarantee correct operation, however.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Using director count from newSet which exceeds expected count.
details.internalDescription: The Plex contains more directors than described in the on-board configuration information. The Plex may not operate correctly.
details.formatString: Local director count in newSet %u > expected count %lu: using newSet count %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This is an expected message, which should occur once per boot. It indicates that enough directors (directors) have joined the Nmg group of directors, that the Nmg can be sure it is seeing a majority of the directors. It is only after this event that the Nmg will announce director arrivals to its clients, and hence full distributed operation will commence.

details.customerDescription: Quorum (%u) from %lu directors reached
details.formatString: Quorum (%u) from %lu directors reached

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This message is currently accompanyied by an abort of the director reporting it. It should only happen if more than one other director disappears at the same time, and the remaining number of directors is less than half of the total number. This director cannot be sure that a network partition has not happened, and so aborts so that it does not alter on-disk data in a way that might conflict with live directors that it cannot communicate with.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Quorum from %u directors lost - only have %u
details.internalDescription: The departure of a director reduced the number of active directors to an unacceptable number. If a director is in the process of rebooting it will rejoin the active set without user intervention. If the director repeatedly sends this message, contact EMC Technical Support.
details.formatString: Quorum from %u directors lost - only have %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The "newSet" token is part of the discovery sequence that the Nmg uses to get all directors agreeing on the set of directors. This director has had an immediate COM failure when trying to send it. That should only happen if a COM departure has slipped in at the right instant. The Nmg will simply ignore the failure, relying on its normal discovery retry mechanism to try again at a later date, when presumeably this error will not occur again.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If this message occurs frequently, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Nmg: failed to send newSet
details.internalDescription: An unexpected error occurred in internal director communications. The Plex will retry and continue to function if further errors do not occur. Occasional occurences of this message are not a cause for alarm; however, frequent occurences may be an early indication of a potential single director failure.
details.formatString: Nmg: failed to send newSet

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Nmg has gotten an immediate COM error when trying to forward the "normal" circulating token to the next member of the Nmg loop. This could indicate that that director has just died from the COM point of view. The Nmg essentially ignores the error, relying on the normal retry mechanisms to send another token.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If this message occurs frequently, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Level %u: can't forward token to 0x%016llx: %s
details.internalDescription: An unexpected error occurred in internal director communications. The Plex will retry and continue to function if further errors do not occur. Occasional occurences of this message are not a cause for alarm; however, frequent occurences may be an early indication of a potential single director failure.
details.formatString: Level %u: can't forward token to 0x%016llx: %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Nmg holds on to the circulating token for a small amount of time before sending it on to the next director in the loop. This is done by allocating a timer to trigger the forwarding. If the attempt to allocate the timer fails (e.g. due to lack of memory), the Nmg will simply forward the token immediately. This shouldn't cause any problems, but if the error persists, then this director is in real trouble with respect to memory, and will likely collapse for other reasons.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If this message occurs frequently, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Level %u: can't allocate timer for token hold time - forwarding immediately
details.internalDescription: An unexpected error occurred in internal director communications. The Plex will retry and continue to function if further errors do not occur. Occasional occurences of this message are not a cause for alarm; however, frequent occurences may be an early indication of a potential single director failure.
details.formatString: Level %u: can't allocate timer for token hold time - forwarding immediately

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This director is the "lowest" in the Nmg set of directors. Thus, it is the one that is responsible for sending out "discovery" tokens when changes in the set occur, or when the normal circulating token gets lost. When sending out the discovery token, this director expects it to come back around the loop of directors. After a timeout, the discovery has not returned, and that has happened a number of times (both timeout and count are configurable). So, this director concludes that the director that it is sending the discovery token to is not alive, or otherwise not able to receive and forward it. So, this director assumes that director is dead, removes it from the director set and will start sending the discovery to the next director in the set.

details.customerDescription: Nmg: no discovery response from" " 0x%016llx - assuming he is gone
details.formatString: Nmg: no discovery response from" " 0x%016llx - assuming he is gone

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [This message is obsolete and no longer produced.] This director has not seen a normal or discovery token for a long time, but has not thought that it could start discovery itself. It doesn't even think that it can be a group by itself. So, it issues this event and does nothing. A COM arrival notification of another director will start things up again.

details.customerDescription: Nmg: lost activity, and no-one to talk to
details.formatString: Nmg: lost activity, and no-one to talk to

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This director believes itself to be the lowest-id director in the Plex and that the Plex is either just starting up, or is restarting from a change in the set of live directors. It is trying to start an Nmg discovery cycle. It has no free message to do that with. It will try again later. Continued failure will result in this director being declared dead.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If this message occurs frequently, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Level %u: no message for discovery initiation
details.internalDescription: An unexpected error occurred in internal director communications. The Plex will retry and continue to function if further errors do not occur. Occasional occurences of this message are not a cause for alarm; however, frequent occurences may be an early indication of a potential single director failure.
details.formatString: Level %u: no message for discovery initiation

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The NMG could not find the expected director count in the flash, so it is assuming that only one director is expected.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Missing expected director count in flash: assuming 1
details.internalDescription: Configuration information is either missing or invalid. The Plex may operate as expected, however this message will occur with every Plex reset until the configuration information is corrected. The missing information is considered mandatory, and correct operation is not guaranteed.
details.formatString: Missing expected director count in flash: assuming 1

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The NMG found an expected director count in flash, but it was invalid. Therefore it will assume that only one director is expected.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Invalid expected director count in flash: assuming 1
details.internalDescription: Configuration information is invalid. The Plex may operate as expected, however this message will occur with every Plex reset until the configuration information is corrected. The invalid information is considered mandatory, and correct operation is not guaranteed.
details.formatString: Invalid expected director count in flash: assuming 1

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The NMG found the expected director count of [expectedDirectorCount] in the flash, but it is unacceptable in some way (ie. equal to 0 or greater than the max number of directors). Therefore it will assume that only one director is expected.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Expected director count of %lu in flash: assuming 1
details.internalDescription: Configuration information is invalid. The Plex may operate as expected, however this message will occur with every Plex reset until the configuration information is corrected. The invalid information is considered mandatory, and correct operation is not guaranteed.
details.formatString: Expected director count of %lu in flash: assuming 1

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: If [errorReportFrequency] errors have accumulated sending to director [COM-uuid] (name [userName]) then this warning will be generated. The occurrence of this could be an early (or direct) indication of communication errors between this director and the indicated one. Note that *all* COM sends contribute to this error count, not just Nmg message sends. So, this message could indicate receive buffer problems on the target director for some component.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: %lu errors have accumulated sending to director 0x%016llx (%s)
details.internalDescription: The normal threshold for errors when sending messages to the reported director was exceeded. This situation may lead to director failure.
details.formatString: %lu errors have accumulated sending to director 0x%016llx (%s)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: If [errorReportFrequency] errors have accumulated rdma-ing to director [COM-uuid] (name [userName]) then this warning will be generated. This is similar to event nmg/23, except that it refers to RDMA (Remote DMA) operations rather than message sends. The Nmg itself does not use RDMA operations.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: %lu errors have accumulated rdma-ing to director 0x%016llx (%s)
details.internalDescription: The normal threshold for errors when sending data to the reported director was exceeded. This situation may lead to director failure.
details.formatString: %lu errors have accumulated rdma-ing to director 0x%016llx (%s)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Nmg has read its name [nodeName] from flash. However, this name is already in use somewhere else. Therefore it will not be re-used.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Rename the affected directors to ensure each has a unique name.

details.customerDescription: My director name \"%s\" is already in use elsewhere - not using it
details.internalDescription: Two or more directors in the Plex have the same name. Unique identifiers for directors are required. The Plex will use the numeric identifier and continue to function normally.
details.formatString: My director name \"%s\" is already in use elsewhere - not using it

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This director has received a remote command from some other director, but has no free Nmg message with which to send a reply. The command in question will have been executed, but the originating director will end up timing out waiting for the reply that it won't get.

details.customerDescription: No Nmg message to send command reply
details.formatString: No Nmg message to send command reply

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Nmg creates a new thread to execute a remote command it has received. It cannot execute the command in the message receive context since the command could block indefinitely. The attempt to create the thread has failed. Normally, the Nmg will then send back a result giving a "CMDERR_NOTHREAD" error code. However, it couldn't even allocate an Nmg message to send that reply. So, in this case, the command is not executed, and no reply is sent back to the originator, who will time out waiting.

details.customerDescription: No Nmg message to send thread create failure command reply
details.formatString: No Nmg message to send thread create failure command reply

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Nmg has received a reply from a remote command, but it does not have a remote command outstanding to match it up with. This can happen if the remote director takes too long to execute the command and reply to it - the local director could have timed out waiting for the reply and given up on it.

details.customerDescription: Remote command reply discarded - no-one waiting for it
details.formatString: Remote command reply discarded - no-one waiting for it

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A very stale message has arrived, and the Nmg will ignore it. This is sometimes seen on Linux when debugging one director and not another. Messages get stuck in sockets, and are delivered when things free up, but by then can be very out of date if the Nmg has declared the director being debugged as dead, and gone on without it.

details.customerDescription: %s nmd_seqno %llu - discarding old %s %llu
details.formatString: %s nmd_seqno %llu - discarding old %s %llu

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The nmg has completely lost communication with all directors. In this state, it will attempt to contact all directors that it has ever seen, in an attempt to rejoin the world.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If this message occurs frequently, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Level %u: lost activity, trying to restart communication
details.internalDescription: An unexpected error occurred in internal director communications. The Plex will retry and continue to function if further errors do not occur. Occasional occurences of this message are not a cause for alarm; however, frequent occurences may be an early indication of a potential single director failure.
details.formatString: Level %u: lost activity, trying to restart communication

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The indicated director is joining the Plex from the Nmg's point of view. There will have been a previous notification from the specific COM layer that has found the new director. This Nmg event does not indicate anything about whether or not we have reached quorum. See event 11.

details.customerDescription: Director %s joins official local group
details.formatString: Director %s joins official local group

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The reported director requires a reset. Check later in the event log for a message indicating failure recovery has completed for all virtual volumes. After that message is received it is safe to restart the director. Contact EMC Technical Support for further assistance.

details.customerDescription: Director %s leaves official local group
details.internalDescription: The Plex has determined the reported director failed. If configured for failover support, the Plex will reallocate resources and resume operation with a reduced number of directors.
details.formatString: Director %s leaves official local group

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A single director (director) has left the Plex due to HW, communication or SW issues. The Plex will be attempting to recover from that loss.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The reported director requires a reset. Check later in the event log for a message indicating failover recovery has completed for all partitions. After that message is received it is safe to restart the director. Contact EMC Technical Support for further assistance.

details.customerDescription: Level %u: director count decreased from %lu to %lu
details.internalDescription: A director left the Plex The Plex is attempting to recover.
details.formatString: Level %u: director count decreased from %lu to %lu

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: When a director receives a discovery token, it should forward it on to the next director in the discovery cycle, and then send a discovery acknowledgement back to the director that sent it the token. If these acks are not received by the sending director, it will conclude that the recipient director is dead, and emit this message.

details.customerDescription: Director 0x%016llx is not sending discovery acks - assuming he is gone
details.formatString: Director 0x%016llx is not sending discovery acks - assuming he is gone

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Enough time has passed without receiving any sort of token that we have had to take some action, and declare the lowest director to be dead.

details.customerDescription: Nmg: no communications from 0x%016llx - assuming he is gone
details.formatString: Nmg: no communications from 0x%016llx - assuming he is gone

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: We have failed too many sends to the given node - declare it to be dead.

details.customerDescription: Level %u: %lu send failed to director 0x%016llx - calling it dead
details.formatString: Level %u: %lu send failed to director 0x%016llx - calling it dead

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: We are dropping a discovery token because it is missing a director that we think should be there.

details.customerDescription: Dropping discovery - it's missing director 0x%016llx
details.formatString: Dropping discovery - it's missing director 0x%016llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The NMG found an expected cluster count in flash, but it was invalid. Therefore it will assume that only one cluster is expected.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Invalid expected cluster count in flash: assuming 1
details.internalDescription: Configuration information is invalid. The Plex may operate as expected, however this message will occur with every Plex reset until the configuration information is corrected.
details.formatString: Invalid expected cluster count in flash: assuming 1

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The NMG found an expected cluster count in flash, but it was out of range. Therefore it will assume that only one cluster is expected.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Expected cluster count of %lu in flash: assuming 1
details.internalDescription: Configuration information is invalid. The Plex may operate as expected, however this message will occur with every Plex reset until the configuration information is corrected.
details.formatString: Expected cluster count of %lu in flash: assuming 1

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Nmg official group contains directors with enough different cluster id's to meet or exceed the stored "clustercount" value, and so distributed Rmg configuration commands are now allowed.

details.customerDescription: All clusters accounted for
details.internalDescription: All geographically separated clusters that have been configured into the Plex are now present and connected, or have been declared as excluded. So, administrator actions which modify the distributed Plex configuration, and which were prevented, are now allowed.
details.formatString: All clusters accounted for

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Nmg official group is changing, and the change makes one of the known clusters have no active members. Because of that, the number of "live" clusters has dropped below the configured "clustercount" value. So, distributed Rmg commands which affect the Plex configuration are now disallowed.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Restore communication link or remote cluster.

details.customerDescription: Not all clusters accounted for
details.internalDescription: One of the clusters that the Plex configuration contains is no longer visible. This could be because of loss of communication with that cluster, or loss of all directors at that cluster. The remaining Plex will not allow some distributed configuration changes to be made until communication is re- established, or the missing cluster is declared excluded.
details.formatString: Not all clusters accounted for

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The nmg has failed to send the given type of message to the given node. This may or may not be a problem, depending on whether or not the message can be resent, or, if the target director is dead, whether or not the nmg can restore the situation.

details.customerDescription: Level %u: failed to send %s to 0x%016llx
details.formatString: Level %u: failed to send %s to 0x%016llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A discovery message arrived, but it was from a director other than the one we consider to be the heart. The message will be ignored. This can happen normally, for instance, when a new lowest director takes over, but some directors haven't yet received the departure notification for the old heart.

details.customerDescription: Level %u: discovery arrived from wrong heart 0x%016llx
details.formatString: Level %u: discovery arrived from wrong heart 0x%016llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The heart director has gone a number of ticks without hearing from the indicated director, and so is declaring it as dead.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: None, unless this is persistent and cannot be attributed to communication hardware problems.

details.customerDescription: Giving up on %s, hb %llu vs director %llu
details.formatString: Giving up on %s, hb %llu vs director %llu

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A newset message arrived, but it was from a director other than the one we consider to be the heart. The message will be ignored. This should never happen, except under very strange timings of director arrival/departure/death-declaring.

details.customerDescription: Level %u: newset arrived from wrong heart 0x%016llx
details.formatString: Level %u: newset arrived from wrong heart 0x%016llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The "nmg clusterexclude" command has been issued on a director at some cluster that cannot see it, and thus the indicated cluster has been declared as no longer part of the active group.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Restore communication link or remote cluster.

details.customerDescription: Administrator has declared cluster %u excluded
details.internalDescription: The administrator has told the Plex to stop waiting for intercluster communications to resume, and to declare the indicated cluster as excluded from the active group. This prevents the cluster from automatically re-joining the group when the link to it recovers.
details.formatString: Administrator has declared cluster %u excluded

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The write to flash memory to store the cluster id of the declared master cluster has failed. On a reboot, this director will not know the clusterid of the master cluster. It will assume it is not at the master cluster.

details.customerDescription: Save of master cluster id to flash failed
details.formatString: Save of master cluster id to flash failed

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The value read from flash for the cluster id of the master cluster was not 4 bytes in length. The Nmg will assume a master cluster id of 1, which typically does not match any cluster.

details.customerDescription: Invalid master cluster id in flash: assuming 0
details.formatString: Invalid master cluster id in flash: assuming 0

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The administrator on some director has issued the "nmg sitemaster" command to set the cluster id of the master cluster. This event serves as a log record of that action.

details.customerDescription: Setting master cluster id to %u (was %u)
details.formatString: Setting master cluster id to %u (was %u)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The first director with the given cluster id has arrived. This marks the arrival of that cluster, from the point of view of the reporting director.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is required unless the reported cluster is not expected to be part of the Plex

details.customerDescription: Cluster %u arrives
details.internalDescription: The director that originated this message has recognized the arrival of a director from the reported cluster. This event occurs during Plex initialization aross the network link.
details.formatString: Cluster %u arrives

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The last director with the given cluster id has departed. This marks the loss of the indicated cluster from the point of view of the reporting director. To stop auto-reattach of dr1s when cluster 3 returns, issue command "nmg clusterexclude 3" during the link outage, or "setautoexclude 3 [delay]" before the outage. TODO: re-visit this once we know what commands will be available to the user via yycli.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check for problems with the network link to the indicated cluster. Check the equipment at the indicated cluster for malfunctions. Check the detach settings of each distributed device to see the pre-configured action.

details.customerDescription: Cluster [clusterId] departs
details.internalDescription: The directors at the indicated cluster are not responding to communications. This often indicates a network link failure, or could be caused by all directors at that cluster failing (e.g. a power outage). The Plex will recover when the link is restored. For any distributed device with a mirror at the missing cluster, I/O to the device will be suspended - either until the cluster returns, or until that cluster is detached.
details.formatString: Cluster %u departs

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This director has gone a number of ticks without hearing from the heart, and so is declaring it as dead.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: None, unless this is persistent and cannot be attributed to communication hardware problems.

details.customerDescription: Giving up on local heart %s, %u missed ticks
details.formatString: Giving up on local heart %s, %u missed ticks

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: In this situation, we can't persist the exclude decision and guarantee that if the cluster goes down, the set of directors that subsequently boots up and gains quorum will know about the exclude. This event will no longer be possible in FP3, when we persist exclude information to storage volume headers.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Ensure that strictly greater than half of the original configured count of directors at the cluster are running before issuing the command again.

details.customerDescription: Could not exclude cluster %u - not enough live directors at cluster %u
details.internalDescription: The administrator attempted to exclude a cluster, but by the time the command was executed, there were not enough live directors to carry out the command correctly. More directors must be booted before the command can be retried.
details.formatString: Could not exclude cluster %u - not enough live directors at cluster %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: We used to ABORT in this situation, but we're trying to be friendlier.

details.customerDescription: Clusters %u and %u have declared each other detached
details.internalDescription: Two clusters have declared each other detached.
details.formatString: Clusters %u and %u have declared each other detached

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: If different directors at a cluster have different values for whether or not their cluster should be auto reattached, we will go with manual reattaching.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Re-issue the command if and when the missing directors are rebooted.

details.customerDescription: Changing auto reattach setting at cluster %u without all directors at the cluster present
details.internalDescription: The setting for auto reattaching the given cluster has been changed, but not all directors at the cluster were running when the command was executed. When the other directors are active, re-issue the command.
details.formatString: Changing auto reattach setting at cluster %u without all directors at the cluster present

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event occurs only on the the cluster(s) that did the exclude (exclude-er), not on the excluded cluster (the exclude-ee). If CXFS is involved, we recommended not auto-reattaching devices when the link comes back.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Issue the CLI command 'clusterunexclude' to unexclude the given cluster. Depending on your application, you may have to take other steps first, such as insuring your metadata server is in a healthy state. If there is instability in communications between clusters it may be advisable to wait until network problems are resolved before unexcluding the cluster.

details.customerDescription: Cluster %u is ready to be unexcluded
details.internalDescription: The reported cluster is now available for unexcluding to the Plex Once the CLI command 'clusterunexclude' is issued, any other clusters that are also waiting for unexclude, and that are in communications with this cluster, will also be unexcluded.
details.formatString: Cluster %u is ready to be unexcluded

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This director is trying to kill the identified director (see nmg/58), but the call to do that has failed. The STONITH may succeed on other directors at this cluster, but if not, this cluster's reliability may be compromised. This may affect the correctness of user data. Note that the call always fails on Linux towers - STONITH is not implemented for Linux towers.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check the status of the reported director and all network connections to that director. Contact EMC Technical support for assistance.

details.customerDescription: Failed to reset a problem director.
details.internalDescription: The Plex has determined the reported director requires a reset, however the Plex was unable to stop the director and perform the reset.
details.formatString: floor_stonith call failed for director %s/0x%016llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An internal call that is part of the mechanism for performing a STONITH operation has failed. The STONITH may succeed on other directors at this cluster, but if not, this cluster's reliability may be compromised. This may affect the correctness of user data.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check the status of the reported director and all network connections to that director. Contact EMC Technical support for assistance.

details.customerDescription: Failed to reset a problem director.
details.internalDescription: The Plex has determined the reported director requires a reset, however the Plex was unable to stop the director and perform the reset.
details.formatString: No AppId for director %s/0x%016llx - Stopping director failed

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This director is part of a group that has reached concensus that the identified director (by director-name and com-uuid) should no longer be part of the operating group at this cluster. This director is thus going to try to STONITH the identified director.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A reset of the director may take several minutes to complete. If the director does not rejoin the Plex automatically, it can be restarted. Refer to the Management Console Users Guide or contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Stopping director [director-name]/[com-uuid]
details.internalDescription: The reported director is not functioning correctly or has lost connectivity to some other directors in the Plex It will be halted. If automatic restart is enabled, it will be restarted, and will rejoin the Plex when it is safe for it to do so.
details.formatString: Stopping director %s/0x%016llx

details.customerDescription: Forgetting about cluster %u
details.internalDescription: The operator has chosen to remove the specified cluster from the Plex
details.formatString: Forgetting about cluster %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The write to flash memory to store the director id of the last known lowest director at this cluster has failed. On a reboot, this director will not know the correct director id. This may affect its quorum decisions, depending on what other directors at its cluster know.

details.customerDescription: Save of 'last lowest director' to flash failed
details.formatString: Save of 'last lowest director' to flash failed

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No action, or attempt to restore communication to the noted cluster.

details.customerDescription: Administrator at another cluster has previously declared cluster %u excluded
details.internalDescription: At some time in the past, an administrator at another cluster had declared the reported cluster as excluded. This cluster has now come in contact with a cluster that knows that, and is learning about that exclusion.
details.formatString: Administrator at another cluster has previously declared cluster %u excluded

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event occurs not when the link comes back, but when the operator does the unexclude (which can be hours later).
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No action is needed - network links are coming up.

details.customerDescription: Administrator at another cluster has previously declared this (%u) cluster as excluded
details.internalDescription: At some time in the past, an administrator at another cluster had declared this cluster as excluded. This cluster has now come in contact with a cluster that knows that, and is learning about the exclusion.
details.formatString: Administrator at another cluster has previously declared this (%u) cluster as excluded

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The write to flash of the configured cost values for the indicated cluster, relative to this cluster, failed. On a reboot, this director will not know those configured values, and so may not handle the intercluster link optimally. When this is noticed, the user can re-issue the "nmg setcost" command to re-set the values.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support and relay the information contained in the error message.

details.customerDescription: Save of costs for cluster %u to flash failed
details.internalDescription: The operator has just changed the configured values for the costs of communication from the local cluster to the reported cluster. This director was unable to write the new values to non-volatile memory. If this director is rebooted, it will have incorrect values, which may affect some Plex choices for remote I/O optimization.
details.formatString: Save of costs for cluster %u to flash failed

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The version hash is a simple hash of the "buildinfo" string, which can be seen using the tower "version" command. It is put into all Nmg messages, and checked on receipt.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If this situation arose because a director with a different version of firmware was inserted into the Plex and booted, then shut down that director. If the situation arose because a communications link has been brought up by mistake, then take down that communications link.

details.customerDescription: Director running a different version of the software detected.
details.internalDescription: An Nmg "heartbeat" message has been received from the specified other director (specified by name if available, else director COM Uuid), which appears to be running a different version of the firmware. This situation is dangerous - newer versions of the firmware may be trying to use capabilities that don't exist in older versions.
details.formatString: Received %s heartbeat from 0x%llx with swHash %u instead of %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The version hash is a simple hash of the "buildinfo" string, which can be seen using the tower "version" command. It is put into all Nmg messages, and checked on receipt.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If this situation arose because a director with a different version of firmware was inserted into the Plex and booted, then shut down that director. If the situation arose because a communications link has been brought up by mistake, then take down that communications link.

details.customerDescription: Director running a different version of the software detected.
details.internalDescription: An Nmg message has been received from the specified other director, which appears to be running a different version of the firmware. This situation is dangerous - newer versions of the firmware may be trying to use capabilities that don't exist in older versions.
details.formatString: Received %s from %s with swHash %u instead of %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Nmg version number is in all Nmg messages. It is a single-byte field at the beginning of the message, which is intended to change when the basic format of the messages changes.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If this situation arose because a director with a different version of firmware was inserted into the Plex and booted, then shut down that director. If the situation arose because a communications link has been brought up by mistake, then take down that communications link.

details.customerDescription: Received message had a version mismatch.
details.internalDescription: An Nmg message has been received from the specified other director which reports a different version of Nmg messages. That means that this director can't even understand that director's messages. The message is not processed.
details.formatString: Received message from 0x%llx with version %u instead of %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Early heartbeat messages did not contain the version number. However, that place would have been a 0/1 flag. With the current version number of 3, a mismatch will be detected.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If this situation arose because a director with a different version of firmware was inserted into the Plex and booted, then shut down that director. If the situation arose because a communications link has been brought up by mistake, then take down that communications link.

details.customerDescription: Received heartbeat had a version mismatch.
details.internalDescription: An Nmg heartbeat message has been received from the specified other director which reports a different version of Nmg messages. That means that this director can't even understand that director's messages. The message is not processed.
details.formatString: Received %s heartbeat from 0x%llx with version %u instead of %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: "The tower context in the yycli" means the tower console, for us mortals.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The director will be in a partially booted state, which allows a value to be set for director-count. Contact EMC technical support for assistance.

details.customerDescription: No flash setting for nodecount
details.internalDescription: This director found no value for the director-count variable in its flash memory. A valid value must be present before the director will boot.
details.formatString: No flash setting for nodecount

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The director will be in a partially booted state, which allows a value to be set for nodecount. Contact EMC technical support for assistance.

details.customerDescription: Out of range flash setting ([value-from-flash]) for nodecount
details.internalDescription: The value read from flash for director-count is either 0 or too large, and so the director boot process has suspended.
details.formatString: Out of range flash setting (%u) for nodecount

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The director will be in a partially booted state, which allows a value to be set for clustercount. Contact EMC technical support for assistance.

details.customerDescription: No flash setting for clustercount
details.internalDescription: This director found no value for the cluster-count variable in its flash memory. A valid value must be present before the director will boot.
details.formatString: No flash setting for clustercount

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The director will be in a partially booted state, which allows a value to be set for cluster-count. Contact EMC technical support for assistance.

details.customerDescription: Out of range flash setting (%u) for clustercount
details.internalDescription: The value read from flash for cluster-count is either 0 or too large, and so the director boot process has suspended.
details.formatString: Out of range flash setting (%u) for clustercount

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is for information purposes only.

details.customerDescription: Flash configured director count: %u
details.formatString: Flash configured director count: %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is for information purposes only.

details.customerDescription: NVol configured cluster count: %u
details.formatString: NVol configured cluster count: %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is for information purposes only.

details.customerDescription: NVol configured known clusters: [%u]
details.formatString: NVol configured known clusters: [%u]

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is for information purposes only.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Examine the network, to see if the cause of the disruption can be identified and resolved.

details.customerDescription: Empty global NMG group change suppressed
details.internalDescription: There has been a temporary disruption in the network that caused the NMG to rediscover. After the rediscovery, all directors running before the disruption were still part of the Plex
details.formatString: Empty global NMG group change suppressed

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Nmg has received a departure notification from the COM layer about a director that it believes is already departed. The Nmg ignores the notification.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If this message occurs frequently, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Departing 0x%llx director not on visible list
details.internalDescription: An unexpected error occurred in internal director communications. The Plex will retry and continue to function if further errors do not occur. Occasional occurences of this message are not a cause for alarm; however, frequent occurences may be an early indication of a potential single director failure.
details.formatString: Departing 0x%llx director not on visible list

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is needed unless this and similar messages are being repeated more than is normal, in which case investigation into network problems may be warranted.

details.customerDescription: Initiating global discovery (%s)
details.internalDescription: Because of the specified reason, the Nmg component of the tower is starting another round of determining what the set of interoperating clusters should be. The underlying reason is usually the arrival or departure of a visible director, or a communication issue.
details.formatString: Initiating global discovery (%s)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Because of the specified reason, the Nmg component of the tower is starting another round of discovery with specified iteration number. This action determines what the set of interoperating local directors should be. The underlying reason is usually the arrival or departure of a visible director, or a communication issue.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is needed unless this and similar messages are being repeated more than is normal, in which case investigation into inter-director communication problems may be warranted.

details.customerDescription: Initiating local discovery iteration [iterationNumber] ([reason])
details.formatString: Initiating local discovery iteration %u (%s)

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is needed unless this and similar messages are being repeated, in which case investigation into communication problems may be warranted.

details.customerDescription: Received my own %s token request
details.internalDescription: A situation that is not normally expected has occurred. This may be a signal that communication errors have been ocurring.
details.formatString: Received my own %s token request

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is needed unless this and similar messages are being repeated, in which case investigation into communication problems may be warranted.

details.customerDescription: Never had arrival for unusable director 0x%llx
details.internalDescription: A situation that is not normally expected has occurred. This may be a signal that communication errors have been ocurring.
details.formatString: Never had arrival for unusable director 0x%llx

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If this director keeps rebooting and getting killed, investigate why it it seems to be having trouble seeing other directors, or seeing directors that other directors do not see.

details.customerDescription: Local discovery declares this director unwanted - aborting
details.internalDescription: The software is resolving issues with determining the set of directors to run at this cluster by deciding that this director should not be part of that set. This is usually because this director cannot see directors (both local and remote) that other directors can see. This message often doesn't come out, because the director is STONITHed first.
details.formatString: Local discovery declares this director unwanted - aborting

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Supply the missing setting. This is a Plex configuration issue. An invalid (wrong size) setting will also result in this event.

details.customerDescription: No flash setting for knownClusters
details.internalDescription: Required flash memory setting "knownClusters" was not found.
details.formatString: No flash setting for knownClusters

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Supply the missing setting. This is a Plex configuration issue.

details.customerDescription: Empty flash setting for knownClusters
details.internalDescription: Required flash memory setting "knownClusters" is empty.
details.formatString: Empty flash setting for knownClusters

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Resolve any communication issues. If none can be found, and the problem persists, reboot either this director or the indicated director.

details.customerDescription: Not reporting director %s - %u sends outstanding to it
details.internalDescription: This director is having trouble sending messages to the indicated director. This could indicate general communication problems.
details.formatString: Not reporting director %s - %u sends outstanding to it

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: "remoteDirectorsVisible" is how many directors at other clusters this director can see. "directorCount" is how many directors within the cluster that this director can see. "wantedGoneCount" and "problemCount" are values relating to the algorithm used to remove some director from the local director group, based on visibility differences between it and other directors. If the communication visibility issues (Com presence) continue for long enough, the director will be STONITHed in order that the Plex regain operation.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check for communication issues both within the cluster containing this director, and between clusters.

details.customerDescription: removing director 0x%llx: remote visible %u local visible %u wantedGone %u problemCnt %u
details.internalDescription: This director is having communications visibility problems with other directors. It has been chosen for expulsion based on it being at least as problematic as any other.
details.formatString: removing director 0x%llx: remote visible %u local visible %u wantedGone %u problemCnt %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: If this happens, tower commands "nmg setallowauto" and "nmg setallowdelay" will set the values.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The proper configuration must be recreated.

details.customerDescription: bad nvol read of cluster join config, len %d not %u
details.internalDescription: The persistent configuration value "NmgAllowInfo" did not have the expected size. It has been ignored, and default values will be used.
details.formatString: bad nvol read of cluster join config, len %d not %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: If this happens, the name can be re-entered with "nmg clustername".
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The desired cluster name should be re-entered into the Plex

details.customerDescription: bad nvol read of cluster name, len %d not %u
details.internalDescription: The persistent configuration value "NmgClusterName" did not have the expected size. It has been ignored, and this cluster will not have a user-configured cluster name.
details.formatString: bad nvol read of cluster name, len %d not %u

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is needed.

details.customerDescription: Not reporting director %s - it re-arrived too early
details.internalDescription: This director has rebooted, but due to difficulties establishing the current local official group of directors, we have not yet been able to depart it. So, its re-arrival will be delayed.
details.formatString: Not reporting director %s - it re-arrived too early

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: If this happens, tower commands "nmg setautowexpelcount" and "nmg setautoexpelseconds" will set the values.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The proper configuration must be recreated.

details.customerDescription: Bad nvol read of auto expel config, len %d not %u
details.internalDescription: The persistent configuration value "NmgAutoExpelInfo" did not have the expected size. It has been ignored, and default values will be used.
details.formatString: Bad nvol read of auto expel config, len %d not %u

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is needed until the conditions that triggered the departures that triggered the auto-expel setting have cleared up. Then the cluster can be manually unexpelled.

details.customerDescription: Auto-expelling cluster %u
details.internalDescription: The active configuration for auto-expelling clusters has been triggered. The cluster will now be auto-expelled, and must be manually unexpelled in order to bring it back.
details.formatString: Auto-expelling cluster %u

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Manually check your bindsets, and correct them where they are bad.

details.customerDescription: Bad read (%d) of bindset data - no bindset activated
details.internalDescription: The format of the persisted metadata describing the various bindsets appears to be invalid. Some bindsets will have been restored, but they may not be correct, so none is activated.
details.formatString: Bad read (%d) of bindset data - no bindset activated

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: If there are more than one of these events during a local discovery, then the current-count on subsequent ones will be decreased by each director being disallowed from the local ring.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check for communication issues both within the cluster containing this director, and between clusters.

details.customerDescription: Removing director 0x%llx", only %u of %u other local directors see it
details.internalDescription: This director is having communications visibility problems with other directors. It has been chosen for expulsion based on it being at least as problematic as any other.
details.formatString: Removing director 0x%llx", only %u of %u other local directors see it

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check for communication issues both within the cluster containing this director, and between clusters.

details.customerDescription: Removing director 0x%llx, can only see %u other directors
details.internalDescription: This director is having communications visibility problems with other directors. It has been chosen for expulsion based on it being at least as problematic as any other.
details.formatString: Removing director 0x%llx, can only see %u other directors

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Recreate the bindings within the bindset as desired.

details.customerDescription: Bindset conflict detected, deleting all of its bindings.
details.internalDescription: A conflict was detected on the given bindset. This could be a disagreement between directors about the number of bindings within the bindset, or about the contents of individual bindings.
details.formatString: Conflict detected on bindset %s, deleting all of its bindings.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Nmg remote code, as a client of the nmg message infrastructure, has to copy incoming remote messages into a new buffer in order to pass them to a thread for processing. However, a new buffer could not be allocated for this copying. Since we can't get a copy of the buffer for the copy, we can't get a buffer for sending a reply indicating this either.

details.customerDescription: No Nmg message to copy remote message for later processing.
details.formatString: No Nmg message to copy remote message for later processing.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Nmg has received an arrival notification over the management network from COM layer about a director from another cluster. The Nmg ignores the unexpected notification. If this occurs repeatedly, there is an error in the configuration of the management network.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: An unexpected error occurred in internal director communications.
details.internalDescription: Unexpected arriving director from another cluster on management network.
details.formatString: Unexpected membership arrival uuid 0x%llx appears from foreign cluster %d

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Nmg has received a departure notification on the management network from the COM layer about a director that it doesn't know about. The Plex will ignore the condition and continue to function if further errors do not occur. Occasional occurences of this message are not a cause for alarm; however, frequent occurences may be an early indication of a potential single director failure.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If this message occurs frequently, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: An unexpected error occurred in internal director communications.
details.internalDescription: Never saw arrival of departing director [uuid].
details.formatString: Never saw arrival of departing membership node 0x%llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Nmg witness version number is in all Nmg witness messages. It is a single-byte field at the beginning of the message, which is intended to change when the basic format of the messages changes.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: There is a mismatch between the software on this node and on the remote node. If the suggested remedies do not fix the problem, contact EMC Technical Support.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: If this situation arose because a director with a different version of firmware was inserted into the Plex and booted, then shut down that director. If the situation arose because a communications link has been brought up by mistake, then take down that communications link.

details.customerDescription: An unexpected error occurred in internal director communications.
details.internalDescription: An Nmg message has been received from the specified other director over the membership network which reports a different version of Nmg messages. That means that this director can't even understand that director's messages. The message is not processed.
details.formatString: Received message from 0x%llx with version %u instead of %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This is an expected message issued by the witness when it is queried about the health of departing nodes. The discovery iteration number matches the number in the earlier nmg_78 message issued when discovery started. The number of nodes queried and the group status returned by the witness is given.

details.customerDescription: normal message reporting results of nmg witness query operation.
details.internalDescription: Local discovery [iterationNumber] witness query for [number] nodes returns [status]
details.formatString: Local discovery iteration %u witness query for %d nodes returns %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This failure exposes the cluster to a Data Unavailability (DU) condition in certain director failure/inter-director link failure scenarios. The nmg witness uses this communication path to check the health of directors that have lost communication over the regular inter-director communication network. If the management network path is down, then a failure of half of the running directors becomes a DU to avoid a potential Data Corruption condition. This is necessary because the health of the inaccessible directors cannot be determined.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: This failure exposes the cluster to a Data Unavailability condition in certain director failure/inter-director link failure scenarios. The event indicates a persistent failure of the link over the management network from the director issuing this event to the director identified by director-name and COM-uuid. If the failure argument is 'never', the connection was never working. If the failure argument is 'not', the connection has failed for the number of seconds given by the secondsSinceOperational argument. NOTE: The other director COM-uuid appears in the VPlexcli director listing as its director-id attribute.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check that the ETH00 and ETH01 ports are enabled on all directors. Check the management network connections. Ensure that the IP routing allows the directors to ping each other. Use the tower command 'nmg winfo' to check the management network communication on each director.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the management network cables and the corresponding management modules. Contact EMC technical support for problem resolution.

details.customerDescription: This event indicates the issuing director does not have trustworthy communication with the identified director over the management network.
details.internalDescription: The nmg witness has been unable to communicate with the specified director over the management network for the interval reported in the event.
details.formatString: Membership com connection to %s/0x%llx untrustworthy: %s operational for %d sec

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This is normal event when issuing the nsfw command "nmg wenable false" and when reading a persisted witness setting at director startup. When enabled, the nmg witness will minimize instances of data unavailablity if multiple director failures occur. You should not override the default settings in normal operation.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: This is normal event when issuing an nsfw witness configuration command and at director startup. You should not change the witness settings unless directed by EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: The nmg witness is disabled.
details.internalDescription: The nmg witness is disabled.
details.formatString: witness is disabled

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This is normal event when issuing the nsfw command "nmg wenable true" and when reading a persisted witness setting at director startup. When enabled, the nmg witness will minimize instances of data unavailablity if multiple director failures occur. You should not override the default settings in normal operation.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: This is normal event when issuing an nsfw witness configuration command and at director startup. You should not change the witness settings unless directed by EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: The nmg witness is enabled.
details.internalDescription: The nmg witness was enabled. The current threshold settings are also displayed.
details.formatString: witness is enabled: trust threshold %u seconds, silence threshold %u seconds

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This is normal event when issuing an nsfw witness configuration command and when reading a persisted witness setting at director startup. The settings control the timing thresholds used by the witness when it is enabled. You should not override the default settings in normal operation. The nsfw command "nmg wsettrust trustThreshold" command changes the trust threshold. The witness uses the trust threshold to judge if the management network connection to a director is trustworthy. For a director in the current local group, if the management network connection has failed for over trustThreshold seconds, the connection is considered untrustworthy and cannot be used by the witness. The nsfw command "nmg wsetsilence silenceThreshold" changes the silence threshold. The witness uses the silence threshold to determine if a director disconnected from the regular network has actually failed. The witness considers the director failed if it has been disconnected for at least silenceThreshold seconds.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: This is normal event when issuing an nsfw witness configuration command and at director startup. You should not change the witness settings unless directed by EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: One or more nmg witness parameters were changed.
details.internalDescription: One or more nmg witness parameters were changed. The enable status will be "enabled" or "disabled". The current and previous threshold values are given. If a value is not changed, the previous value will be the same as the current value.
details.formatString: witness parameter change: %s with trust threshold %u seconds (was %u), silence threshold %u seconds (was %u)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The persistent configuration value "NmgWitnessParameters" did not have the expected size. It has been ignored, and default values will be used.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The persistent configuration value for the witness could not be read. The default values will be used.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: If this happens, tower commands "nmg wenable", "nmg wsettrust", "nmg wsetsilence" will set the values.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The proper configuration must be recreated. Contact EMC Techincal Support.

details.customerDescription: There was an error reading persisted witness parameters.
details.internalDescription: bad nvol read of witness paramters, actualLen was read, not expectedLen
details.formatString: bad nvol read of witness parameters config, len %d not %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The cluster reporting this event has been unable to establish communication with Cluster Witness Server for the last 30 seconds or more. This may be due to failure of Cluster Witness Server (process, VM, or server); or due to loss of management network connectivity between this cluster's Management Server and Cluster Witness Server (loss of physical connectivity, route misconfiguration, or loss of VPN); or due to failure of Management Server or due to loss of private management connectivity between the lowest UUID director and the Management Server in this cluster.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The cluster reporting this event has been unable to establish communication with Cluster Witness Server. This may be due to the failure of the server or loss of network connectivity.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check if the Virtual Machine hosting the Cluster Witness Server is running. Check if the Management Server is running and verify the VPN settings b/w the Management Server and the Cluster Witness Server.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check network connectivity between the local Management Server and Cluster Witness Server. Check whether Cluster Witness Server VM is running. If the problem persists, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: The cluster is unable to communicate with the Cluster Witness Server.
details.internalDescription: The cluster is unable to communicate with the Cluster Witness Server.
details.formatString: The cluster %u has been unable to establish communication with the Cluster Witness Server for %u seconds.

details.customerDescription: Communication is established between this cluster and Cluster Witness Server.
details.internalDescription: Communication is established between this cluster and Cluster Witness Server.
details.formatString: The communication between cluster %u and the Cluster Witness Server is established.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This is a normal event indicating either that a booting director has learned its configuration or that a director accepted an administrative configuration change.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: This is a normal event indicating either that a booting director has learned its configuration or that a director accepted an administrative configuration change.

details.customerDescription: One or more Cluster Witness parameters were changed.
details.internalDescription: One or more Cluster Witness parameters were changed. The enable status will be "enabled" or "disabled". The current and previous public and private IP addresses of the Cluster Witness Server are provided.
details.formatString: Cluster Witness parameter change: %s with public server IP address %s (was %s) with private server IP address %s (was %s)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This is normal event when Cluster Witness is enabled.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: This is normal event when Cluster Witness is enabled.

details.customerDescription: Cluster Witness is enabled.
details.internalDescription: Cluster Witness is enabled. The current and previous public and private IP addresses of the Cluster Witness Server are provided.
details.formatString: Cluster Witness is enabled: public server IP address %s (was %s), private server IP address %s (was %s)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is generated when Cluster Witness is administratively disabled.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: This event is generated when Cluster Witness is administratively disabled.

details.customerDescription: Cluster Witness is disabled.
details.internalDescription: Cluster Witness Server is disabled
details.formatString: Cluster Witness is disabled

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An invalid/corrupt message has been received from the Cluster Witness Server by the identified cluster. This message has been dropped.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the integrity of the management network.

details.customerDescription: An invalid/corrupt message has been received from Cluster Witness Server by the identified cluster.
details.internalDescription: An invalid/corrupt message has been received from the Cluster Witness Server by the identified cluster.
details.formatString: Received an invalid cluster witness message (type: %u) destined to cluster %u (local cluster is %u), specified nextState %s.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An invalid health-check broadcast message has been received on a director of this cluster. This broadcast message will be dropped. This could occur if some directors of a cluster have different clusterIds configured.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check if all directors in a cluster have the same clusterId and are configured correctly.

details.customerDescription: An invalid health-check broadcast message has been received on a director of this cluster.
details.internalDescription: An invalid health-check broadcast message has been received on a director of this cluster.
details.formatString: Droping an invalid health-check broadcast message on cluster %u (local cluster is %u), node-id %u, specified nextState %s.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Cluster Witness Server has detected and reported an inter-cluster partition. This marks the loss of connectivity between the remote cluster and the reporting cluster. This may be due to physical failure or congestion of the inter-cluster network.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Cluster Witness Server has detected and reported an inter-cluster partition. This marks the loss of connectivity between the remote cluster and the reporting cluster. This may be due to physical failure or congestion of the inter-cluster network.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Verify all cables connected to WAN-COM ports on the directors. Verify physical connectivity as well as load on the corresponding inter-cluster network.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: If the problem persists, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Cluster Witness Server detected an inter-cluster partition and has provided its guidance to proceed with the configured detach rule settings.
details.internalDescription: Cluster Witness Server detected an inter-cluster partition and has provided its guidance to proceed with the configured detach rule settings.
details.formatString: Cluster Witness Server has detected a cluster partition and is providing guidance to proceed with the configured detach rule settings on the cluster %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Cluster Witness Server detected that the remote cluster is unreachable. This could mean that the remote cluster has either failed or become isolated from both its peer cluster and the Cluster Witness Server. This could be due to site disaster event. Alternatively, this could be due to dual failure of the inter-cluster and management networks.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Cluster Witness Server detected that the remote cluster has either failed or become isolated. This could be due to to site disaster or due to dual failure of inter-cluster and management networks.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Verify the state of the remote cluster. Also, check the state of inter-cluster network as well as the management network connecting the remote cluster to Cluster Witness Server.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: If the problem persists, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Cluster Witness Server detected that the remote cluster has either failed or become isolated and provided its guidance to the local cluster.
details.internalDescription: Cluster Witness Server detected that the remote cluster has either failed or become isolated and provided its guidance to the local cluster.
details.formatString: Cluster Witness Server detected that remote cluster %u has either failed or become isolated. This cluster %u is guided to proceed with I/O on all distributed volumes in all synchronous consistency groups regardless of configured detach rule settings.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Cluster Witness Server has reported that the local cluster was isolated and must suspend I/O on all distributed volumes in all synchronous consistency groups until its connectivity with the peer cluster recovers. This could either take place after a cluster fails and reboots and then finds itself partitioned from its peer cluster but capable of communicating with Cluster Witness Server. Alternatively, this could take place after a cluster becomes isolated and later recovers connectivity with Cluster Witness Server. At the point this event is reported the clusters cannot communicate with each other. This could be either due to partition of inter-cluster network or potential failure or isolation of the remote cluster.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Cluster Witness Server detected that the local cluster was previously isolated and must suspend I/O on all distributed volumes in all synchronous consistency groups until its connectivity with the peer cluster recovers. This could be due to problems with the inter-cluster network or due to current failure or isolation of the remote cluster.
