eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Verify the state and load of the inter-cluster network. Check the state of the remote cluster. Also, check the state of management connectivity between the remote cluster's Management Server and Cluster Witness Server.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: If the problem persists, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Cluster Witness Server detected that the local cluster has become isolated and provided its guidance.
details.internalDescription: Cluster Witness Server detected that the local cluster has become isolated and provided its guidance.
details.formatString: Cluster Witness Server detected that this cluster %u has become isolated. This cluster is suspending I/O on all distributed volumes in all synchronous consistency groups regardless of configured detach rule settings.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Cluster Witness cannot be enabled on systems with more than the supported number of clusters. This could occur due to mis-configuration of clusterIds.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Cluster Witness cannot be enabled on systems with more than the supported number of clusters. If the problem persists, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: The number of observed clusters exceeds the limit currently supported by Cluster Witness (2).
details.internalDescription: The number of observed clusters exceeds the limit currently supported by Cluster Witness (2).
details.formatString: Cluster Witness cannot be enabled on systems with more than %u deployed clusters.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The cluster reporting this event has been unable to receive any guidance from the Cluster Witness Server for the last 10 seconds. This may be due to failure of the Cluster Witness Server (process, VM, or server); or due to loss of management network connectivity between this cluster's Management Server and Cluster Witness Server (loss of physical connectivity, route misconfiguration, or loss of VPN); or due to failure of Management Server or due to loss of private management connectivity between the lowest UUID director and the Management Server in this cluster.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The cluster reporting this event has been unable to receive any guidance from the Cluster Witness Server for the last 10 seconds. This may be due to failure of the Cluster Witness Server or loss of network connectivity.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check if the Virtual Machine hosting the Cluster Witness Server is running. Check if the Management Server is running and verify the VPN settings b/w the Management Server and the Cluster Witness Server.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check network connectivity between the local Management Server and Cluster Witness Server. Check whether Cluster Witness Server VM is running. If the problem persists, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: The cluster did not receive any guidance from the Cluster Witness Server within 10 seconds.
details.internalDescription: The cluster did not receive any guidance from the Cluster Witness Server within the isolation timeout of 10 seconds.
details.formatString: The isolation timer expired for cluster %u without any guidance from Cluster Witness Server. This cluster is suspending I/O on all distributed volumes in all synchronous consistency groups regardless of configured detach rule settings.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Cluster Witness Client in the cluster reporting this event has changed its Cluster Witness state either based on loss/recovery of inter-cluster connectivity or based on guidance received from Cluster Witness Server.

details.customerDescription: The cluster changed internal Cluster Witness state.
details.internalDescription: Cluster Witness Client is changing its internal state either based on loss/recovery of inter-cluster connectivity or based on guidance received from Cluster Witness Server.
details.formatString: Cluster Witness Client changed state from %s to %s: (enabled %c, remClusterCount %u).

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Cluster Witness Client in the cluster reporting this event has received a message with unsupported protocol version from the Cluster Witness Server. This event may potentially be reported after incorrectly performed upgrade. While this condition persists, connectivity between the Cluster Witness Server and the cluster that reported this event may be severed.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: If this condition persists, ensure that software on all directors as well as Cluster Witness Server software is upgraded to a release where Cluster Witness Server and Client use compatible protocol versions.

details.customerDescription: A message with unsupported protocol version has been received from Cluster Witness Server.
details.internalDescription: The Cluster Witness Client received a message with unsupported protocol version from the Cluster Witness Server.
details.formatString: Cluster Witness Client dropped %u received message(s) with unexpected protocol version (received version in the last message: %u, expected version: %u).

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The persistent configuration value "NmgClusterWitnessParameters" did not have the expected size. It has been ignored, and default values will be used.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The persistent configuration value for the Cluster Witness could not be read. The default values will be used.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: If this happens, tower commands "nmg cwenable", "nmg cwpub", "nmg cwpriv" may be used to set the values.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The proper Cluster Witness configuration must be recreated. Please, contact EMC Techincal Support.

details.customerDescription: There was an error reading persisted Cluster Witness parameters.
details.internalDescription: During NVOL read operation for Cluster Witness configuration paramters, a record of unexpected size was read
details.formatString: bad nvol read of Cluster Witness parameters config, len %u not %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The most likely root cause is memory corruption within nsfw and/or Cluster Witness Server.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: There are no known causes for this condition. Please contact EMC Customer Service.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The content of distributed volumes in the configured consistency groups may be diverging due to conflicting detach. Once the clusters re-establish connectivity with one another, manual intervention will be required to identify the cluster whose data should be used for recovery. Use \"consistency-group resolve-conflicting-detach\" VPlexcli command to select a cluster for each consistency group to be the source to resynchronize distributed volumes in that group.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The content of distributed volumes in the configured consistency groups may be diverging due to conflicting detach. Once the clusters re-establish connectivity with one another, manual intervention will be required to identify the cluster whose data should be used for recovery. Use \"consistency-group resolve-conflicting-detach\" VPlexcli command to select a cluster for each consistency group to be the source to resynchronize distributed volumes in that group.

details.customerDescription: Cluster Witness Server has detected potential conflicting detaches of distributed volumes in consistency groups.
details.internalDescription: Cluster Witness Server observed inconsistent clusters\' states, which is likely to cause conflicting detaches of distributed volumes in consistency groups.
details.formatString: Cluster Witness Client %u dropped %u received message(s) with inconsistentState rejection response (current cluster state %s, specified next cluster state %s).

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An nmg message could not be routed from the given source director to the given destination director. This event can be generated if a director or communication connectivity between directors is lost during local discovery.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An internal message could not be routed from the given source director to the given destination director. This event can be generated if a director or communication connectivity between directors is lost during local discovery.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: No action is required, since the message will be retried in the next round of local discovery.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: No action is required, since the message will be retried.

details.customerDescription: An internal message could not be routed to its final destination.
details.internalDescription: An nmg discovery message could not be routed to its final destination.
details.formatString: Message could not be routed from 0x%llx to 0x%llx (type %u, iteration %u)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An nmg message allocation level is higher than normal.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An internal message allocation level is higher than normal.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: This may be a transient issue, so first check that the higher than normal allocation level still exists (an NMG_EVENT_MESSAGE_ALLOCATION_THRESHOLD_CLEARED event will be issued if the number of allocated messages drop to more normal levels). If the condition persists, then check for inter- and intra-cluster networking issues, since higher than normal networking delays can trigger scenarios where nmg messages are held for long periods of time.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: This may be a transient issue, so first check that the higher than normal allocation level still exists (an NMG_EVENT_MESSAGE_ALLOCATION_THRESHOLD_CLEARED event will be issued if the number of allocated messages drop to more normal levels). If the condition persists, then check for inter- and intra-cluster networking issues, since higher than normal networking delays can trigger scenarios where these internal messages are held for long periods of time. If the above steps do not resolve this issue, then please contact EMC Customer Service.

details.customerDescription: An internal message allocation threshold has been crossed.
details.internalDescription: An nmg message allocation threshold has been crossed.
details.formatString: Message allocation threshold (%u) reached

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An nmg message allocation level was higher than normal, but has dropped to more normal usage levels.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An internal message allocation level was higher than normal, but has dropped to more normal usage levels.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: No action is required.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: No action is required.

details.customerDescription: An internal message allocation level was higher than normal, but has dropped to more normal levels.
details.internalDescription: An nmg message allocation level was higher than normal, but has dropped to more normal levels.
details.formatString: Message allocation dropped below threshold

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is reported by all directors on a given cluster when an NMG group change event indicates that the NVOL server is moving.

details.customerDescription: Nvol server is now uuid 0x%llx
details.formatString: Nvol server is now uuid 0x%llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Reported by the current NVOL server when it detects that the server has changed

details.customerDescription: FS
details.formatString: FS

details.customerDescription: FS scan complete - nvol ready
details.formatString: FS scan complete - nvol ready

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Either the NVOL server is not configured, or there is a problem with the metadata storage volume, or the NVOL file system has been corrupted. The user should check that the NVOL server is configured and check that the metadata storage volume is ready. If the file system has been corrupted, some configuration data can still be recovered.

details.customerDescription: Couldn't read metavolume header - nvol not ready
details.internalDescription: The internal non-volatile (NVOL) storage server could not startup. This could affect various Plex components that depend on the storage server for saved configuration settings.
details.formatString: Couldn't read metavolume header - nvol not ready

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Issuing "nvol mkfs" will recreate the file system, but the data from the point of error to the end will be lost.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The NVOL file system has been corrupted and must be repaired. Contact EMC Technical support.

details.customerDescription: Non-volatile storage filesystem corruption detected.
details.internalDescription: The internal non-volatile (NVOL) storage server could not scan the file system, which means it has been corrupted in some way. The NVOL server will not start normal operations until the file system has been repaired.
details.formatString: Incomplete record, read %d blocks at %lld (last %lld)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Issuing "nvol mkfs" will recreate the file system, all data in the existing file system will be lost.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The NVOL file system is either not configured or has been corrupted. The file system should be reconfigured. Contact EMC Technical support.

details.customerDescription: Couldn't read metavolume header - nvol not ready
details.internalDescription: The internal non-volatile (NVOL) storage server could not initialize file system because the metadata header is corrupted in some way. The NVOL server will not start normal operations until the file system has been repaired.
details.formatString: Couldn't read metavolume header - nvol not ready

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Issuing "nvol mkfs" can be used to increase the size of the file system without losing data.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Create a larger meta-volume with a larger NVOL file system. Contact EMC Technical Support for assistance.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Issuing "nvol mkfs" can be used to increase the size of the file system without losing data.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Create a larger meta-volume with a larger NVOL file system. Contact EMC Technical Support for assistance.

details.customerDescription: File System is full, compact failed
details.internalDescription: The internal non-volatile (NVOL) storage server file system is full, so the database cannot be compacted. No data has been lost, but a failure of the server could result in lost configuration data.
details.formatString: File System is full, compact failed

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Issuing "nvol rm key" will remove the corrupted key so that its contents can be regenerated, but its current contents will be lost.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The specified record within the NVOL file system has been corrupted and must be repaired. Contact EMC Technical Support for assistance.

details.customerDescription: Bad CheckSum %d for key %s, expected %d
details.internalDescription: The internal non-volatile (NVOL) storage server keeps a ckecksum with every record, both in memory and on storage volume. If the checksum of the current record contents does not match the saved checksum, it means the data has been corrupted in some way. The NVOL server will continue with the corrupted data, but the data should be repaired.
details.formatString: Bad CheckSum %d for key %s, expected %d

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Issuing "nvol compact" when the metadata storage volume is repaired will flush the entire in-memory database to storage volume.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Investigate why writing to the meta-volume failed. If failure cannot be corrected. Create a new meta-volume and copy the in memory data to the new meta-volume.

details.customerDescription: Write Error in [location], data not persisted
details.internalDescription: The internal non-volatile (NVOL) storage server writes all records immediately to storage volume, but also keeps a copy of the data in memory. If the write to storage volume fails, the record is still in memory, but its contents could be lost if the in-memory copy is lost due to director failure or shutdown. The NVOL server will continue with the vulnerable data, and will persist it when the metadata storage volume is repaired.
details.formatString: Write Error in %s, data not persisted

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Issuing "nvol compact" when the Plex load returns to normal will ensure that all changes have been persisted to storage volume.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The Plex is overloaded and is running out of memory. The load on the Plex should be reduced.

details.customerDescription: Could not create thread %s
details.internalDescription: The internal non-volatile (NVOL) server uses threads to perform some of its work. If a thread cannot be created, the work cannot be performed. The NVOL server will continue processing the work requests that it can, but some state changes may not be persisted to storage volume.
details.formatString: Could not create thread %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The nvol database should be checked to see if any updates are missing.

details.customerDescription: Lock holder 0x%016llx departed clearing lock
details.internalDescription: The internal non-volatile (NVOL) server allows clients to lock the database to make multiple updates appear atomic. If the client has departed without clearing the lock, the multiple updates may not have completed. The lock is cleared to allow other clients to continue, but some updates could be missing.
details.formatString: Lock holder 0x%016llx departed clearing lock

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The internal non-volatile (NVOL) storage server file system usage has crossed the warning threshold and is almost full. Although no data has been lost, action should be taken to prevent a potential data loss.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: This event indicates that the NVOL filesystem has crossed the warning threshold and is almost full.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Issuing "nvol mkfs" can be used to increase the size of the file system without losing data.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: While this event does not indicate an immediate failure, it is advised that the NVOL file system be resized to prevent it from filling up. Contact EMC Technical Support for assistance.

details.customerDescription: File System usage has crossed the warning threshold.
details.internalDescription: The internal non-volatile (NVOL) storage server file system usage has crossed the warning threshold and is almost full.
details.formatString: File System usage greater than %u%%

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Depending on the hardware platform, the port component expects a fixed inventory of devices to be reported by the low level device drivers. This event indicates that some low level driver has reported a device whose name is not in the fixed 'layout'.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: On initialization of the firmware, unexpected hardware was detected.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: To avoid this when running on non standard hardware configurations either edit the layout or run with the "portenglayout=1" boot option.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Technical Support for assistance.

details.customerDescription: Device [device] not found in port layout.
details.internalDescription: On initialization of the firmware, unexpected hardware was detected, for which no port role could be established.
details.formatString: Device %s not found in port layout

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A hardware port is being enabled by user.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A hardware port is being enabled by user.

details.customerDescription: Device [device] is being enabled with role [role].
details.internalDescription: A hardware port [device] is being enabled with role [role].
details.formatString: enabling port %s role %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A hardware port is being disabled by user.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A hardware port is being disabled by user.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The administrator requested to disable a port.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The administrator requested to disable a port, please make sure this is as planned.

details.customerDescription: Device [device] with role [role] is being disabled.
details.internalDescription: A hardware port [device] with role [role] is being disabled.
details.formatString: disabling port %s role %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event shows various internal qlogic revision levels as reported by the qlogic firmware on reset. portId: the qlc port being reported The string inside the [] should be "ISP". If this isn't so, the chip isn't behaving properly. The other fields are: chip: the chip revision level risc: the risc processor revision rom: the risc rom revision level seq: the sequencer revision mbox8: the buffer and module revision levels NOTE: There are other values reported by the chip that are not printed out here. These include the frame buffer module fibre protocol modules

details.arguments: portId string chip risc rom seq mbox8
details.customerDescription: qlc%d: less [%c%c%c%c%c%c] chip %d risc %d rom %d seq %d mbox8 %x
details.formatString: qlc%d: <%c%c%c%c%c%c> chip %d risc %d rom %d seq %d mbox8 %x

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Port [portId] is initialized.

details.customerDescription: qlc%d: firmware initialized
details.formatString: qlc%d: firmware initialized

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Port [portId] has received a lip reset.

details.customerDescription: qlc%d: received a lip reset
details.internalDescription: On a GSX 3000, qlc0 corresponds to the port labeled FC0, qlc1, qlc2 through qlc15 correspond to the ports labeled FC1, FC2 through FC15, respectively.
details.formatString: qlc%d: received a lip reset

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Port [portId] has received a port config changed. The port is reset.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is required. Contact EMC Technical Support only if this event occurs frequently on the same port.

details.customerDescription: qlc%d: received a port config changed
details.internalDescription: On a GSX 3000, qlc0 corresponds to the port labeled FC0, qlc1, qlc2 through qlc15 correspond to the ports labeled FC1, FC2 through FC15, respectively.
details.formatString: qlc%d: received a port config changed

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Port [portId] has received a target reset. The port is reset.

details.customerDescription: qlc%d: received a target reset
details.internalDescription: On a GSX 3000, qlc0 corresponds to the port labeled FC0, qlc1, qlc2 through qlc15 correspond to the ports labeled FC1, FC2 through FC15, respectively.
details.formatString: qlc%d: received a target reset

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Port [portId] found an iocb with status [status] on the response queue. The port is reset.

details.formatString: qlc%d: response iocb with unexpected status 0x%x

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The qlogic firmware delivered a port logout event.

details.customerDescription: qlc%d: received a port logout
details.internalDescription: A port logout is an indication that the port discovery timed out, a port name changed or relogin happened. This is normal during start up and fibre channel fabric disruptions. On a GSX 3000, qlc0 corresponds to the port labeled FC0, qlc1, qlc2 through qlc15 correspond to the ports labeled FC1, FC2 through FC15, respectively.
details.formatString: qlc%d: received a port logout

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The qlogic firmware delivered a global logo event. This indicates that all communication from this port dropped (for example due to a pulled cable).

details.customerDescription: qlc%d: received a global logo
details.formatString: qlc%d: received a global logo

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The qlogic driver decided to make a debug dump of the qlogic firmware. This dump should be helpful for qlogic to analyze this problem. Port [portId] ran into difficulties. The dump is made to physical address [physicalAddress] and has a length of [length] bytes. Important parameters for getting an actual Ascii dump are the end offset of the sram memory [sramHigh], the request queue length [reqLen] and response queue length [respLen]. In case there was not enough room for a full dump the [truncateString] will indicate so.

details.customerDescription: qlc%d: debug dump to phys 0x%llx len %d%s
details.formatString: qlc%d: debug dump to phys 0x%llx len %d%s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Qlogic firmware on port [portId] gave us a second task with tag [rxid]. The task that we have been given earlier with this tag has not yet been completed. If the Qlogic firmware was asked to abort a task it provides us only with a tag (it should also provide us with an initiator id, target id and logical unit number according to the scsi spec), we would not know which of these two tasks to abort.

details.customerDescription: qlc%d: rxid (0x%x) already exists
details.formatString: qlc%d: rxid (0x%x) already exists

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Qlogic firmware on port [portId] gave us a second task with tag [rxid]. The task that we have been given earlier with this tag has not yet been completed. If the Qlogic firmware was asked to abort a task it provides us only with a tag (it should also provide us with an initiator id, target id and logical unit number according to the scsi spec), we would not know which of these two tasks to abort.

details.customerDescription: qlc%d: rxid (0x%x) already exists
details.formatString: qlc%d: rxid (0x%x) already exists

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The qlc layer could not allocate memory to create a thread to reset qlogic chip [portId].
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support. The director may require a reset.

details.customerDescription: qlc%d: can't create qlcPortPanic thread
details.internalDescription: The fibre channel chip on the indicated port requires a reset to resolve an internal error. The Plex was unable to allocate the resource to perform this reset. On a GSX 3000, qlc0 corresponds to the port labeled FC0, qlc1, qlc2 through qlc15 correspond to the ports labeled FC1, FC2 through FC15, respectively.
details.formatString: qlc%d: can't create qlcPortPanic thread

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The qlc layer could not find a free preallocated connection.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support. The director may require a reset.

details.customerDescription: qlc%d: Could not allocate connection
details.internalDescription: The Plex was unable to allocate the resource to establish a connection. On a GSX 3000, qlc0 corresponds to the port labeled FC0, qlc1, qlc2 through qlc15 correspond to the ports labeled FC1, FC2 through FC15, respectively.
details.formatString: qlc%d: Could not allocate connection

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The qlc layer could not find a free entry in the port database.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support. The director may require a reset.

details.customerDescription: qlc%d: Could not allocate connection in port database
details.internalDescription: The Plex was unable to allocate the resource to establish a connection. On a GSX 3000, qlc0 corresponds to the port labeled FC0, qlc1, qlc2 through qlc15 correspond to the ports labeled FC1, FC2 through FC15, respectively.
details.formatString: qlc%d: Could not allocate connection in port database

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Received task before login

details.customerDescription: qlc%d: Received task before login (loopId 0x%x)

details.internalDescription: The qlogic firmware tells our firmware about a task before it told our firmware about the login over which the task arrives.

details.internalDescription: The qlogic firmware tells our firmware about a task before it told our firmware about the login over which the task arrives.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: MOD_VP_CONFIG iocb failed

details.customerDescription: qlc%d virtual port %d creation failed %d"
details.internalDescription: A MODIFY_VIRUTAL_PORT_CONFIGURATION iocb that has been issued to the qlogic firmware failed with error code [vpResult]. As a result the corresponding virtual port realization fails.
details.formatString: qlc%d virtual port %d creation failed %d"

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: VP_CONTROL iocb failed

details.customerDescription: qlc%d virtual port %d enabling failed with code %d"
details.internalDescription: A VIRUTAL_PORT_CONTROL iocb that has been issued to the qlogic firmware failed with error code [vpResult]. As a result the corresponding virtual port realization fails.
details.formatString: qlc%d virtual port %d enabling failed with code %d"

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: VP_CONTROL iocb failed

details.customerDescription: qlc%d virtual port %d disabling failed with code %d"
details.internalDescription: A VIRUTAL_PORT_CONTROL iocb that has been issued to the qlogic firmware failed with error code [vpResult]. As a result the corresponding virtual port destroy fails.
details.formatString: qlc%d virtual port %d disabling failed with code %d"

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Qlogic firmware might be stuck.

details.customerDescription: qlc%d: No heartbeat for more " than %d seconds.
details.internalDescription: The firmware running on the qlogic interface [interfaceId] is either dead or is too busy to update the firmware heartbeat.
details.formatString: qlc%d: No heartbeat for more " than %d seconds.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event provides enough information to identify the failed write in both the tower trace and the finisar trace
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check cables to the storage array.

details.arguments: cdb i t lun tag oxid
details.customerDescription: scsi command (cdb 0x%s i 0x%llx t 0x%llx lun 0x%llx tag 0x%x oxid 0x%x) hit invalid rxid error"
details.internalDescription: SCSI command ([cdb] [i] [t] [lun] [tag] [oxid]) has failed with the invalid rxid error. This error could be an indication of a potential silent data corruption, or it could be a legitimate error code that has no impact on data integrity.
details.formatString: scsi command (cdb 0x%s i 0x%llx t 0x%llx lun 0x%llx tag 0x%x oxid 0x%x) hit invalid rxid error"

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event provides enough information to identify the problem connection on the interface, port and the remote device.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: This should change

details.arguments: qiId qp qc remoteNpid remoteDirectorWwn portName
details.customerDescription: qi %d qp %p qc %p: remoteNpid 0x%x remoteWwn 0x%016llx localWwn 0x%016llx is neither in initiator nor target mode
details.internalDescription: A qlc connection between [portName] and [remoteDirectorWwn] is established without neither the initiator nor the target mode bits set. This problem could be a race condition between the FC transport chips between YY director and the remote device. The YY ISP driver will try retrieving the information again shortly.
details.formatString: qi %d qp %p qc %p: remoteNpid 0x%x remoteWwn 0x%016llx localWwn 0x%016llx is neither in initiator nor target mode

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event provides enough information to identify the problem connection on the interface, port and the remote device.

details.arguments: qiId portname status flags initloopid targetloopid
details.customerDescription: qi %d qp 0x%016llx receives a tmf status 0x%x and flags 0x%x on a non-existent login at loopid 0x%x from loopid 0x%x
details.internalDescription: This problem could be a race condition inside the Qlogic firmware that tmfs are received on logins that have been torn down already.
details.formatString: qi %d qp 0x%016llx receives a tmf status 0x%x and flags 0x%x on a non-existent login at loopid 0x%x from loopid 0x%x

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event provides enough information to identify the problem connection on the interface, port and the remote device.

details.customerDescription: qi %d received a IN (status 0x%x flags 0x%x) on a non-existent port at loopid %d
details.internalDescription: This problem could be a race condition inside the Qlogic firmware that tmfs are received on qps that have been torn down already.
details.formatString: qi %d received a IN (status 0x%x flags 0x%x) on a non-existent port at loopid %d

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event provides enough information to identify the problem connection on the interface, port and the remote device.

details.customerDescription: qi %d qp 0x%016llx received a port logout IN on a non-existent qc at loopid %d
details.internalDescription: This problem could be a race condition inside the Qlogic firmware that tmfs are received on a qp that isn't ready yet.
details.formatString: qi %d qp 0x%016llx received a port logout IN on a non-existent qc at loopid %d

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Qlogic firmware might be stuck.

details.customerDescription: qlc%d: No heartbeat for more " than %d seconds. Resetting interface.
details.internalDescription: The firmware running on the qlogic interface [interfaceId] is either dead or has been too busy to update the firmware heartbeat, for longer than the heartbeat timeout. The interface is being automatically reset.
details.formatString: qlc%d: No heartbeat for more " than %d seconds. Resetting interface.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is obsolete - it is no longer produced

details.customerDescription: Rmg: Partition 0x%016llx.%lu mounted on director 0x%016llx lost its last replication target (director 0x%016llx)
details.formatString: Rmg: Partition 0x%016llx.%lu mounted on director 0x%016llx lost its last replication target (director 0x%016llx)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Rmg group code has detected a situation where the same group, based on its unique id, has a different name on this new director from the name known by the old (previously running) directors. The old name wins.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Verify the names assigned to replication groups.

details.customerDescription: Old replication group '%s' appears to have been renamed as '%s'
details.internalDescription: The replication group had a different name on this new director than it had on the previously running directors. Based on its unique ID, the name will be the same as it was for the previous directors.
details.formatString: Old replication group '%s' appears to have been renamed as '%s'

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A newly booting director has found information in its flash about a replication group whose name is the same as a pre-known replication group with a different unique id. The new replication group will be recreated with a name manufactured from the group id.

details.customerDescription: Recreating replication group '%s'
details.formatString: Recreating replication group '%s'

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A change in the set of Rmg replication groups that affects this director has occurred, and the director is trying to store the group information to its flash memory. That store has failed, perhaps because the flash memory is full.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Record the state of this replication group so it can be manually recreated after the next Plex reset, if required. Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Cannot save replication group definitions to flash (current: %s)
details.internalDescription: Writing to the non-volatile memory failed. Data replication is unaffected but this replication group may require manual restoration after the next Plex reset.
details.formatString: Cannot save replication group definitions to flash (current: %s)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This message is essentially the same as rmg/4, except that the error has occurred when trying to flush the final bufferful of data to the flash memory.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Record the state of all replication groups so they can be manually recreated after the next Plex reset, if required. Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Cannot flush replication groups to flash
details.internalDescription: Writing to the non-volatile memory failed. Data replication is unaffected but replication groups may require manual restoration after the next Plex reset.
details.formatString: Cannot flush replication groups to flash

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An Rmg replication group targeted by a replication setting has enough members to satisfy the setting, but of those members, not enough are currently active. Thus, the replication level requested will not actually be met until more of the member directors come online. This event usually happens on startup, where the replication setting is coming from flash memory, and not all directors are online yet. It can also happen when the Plex starts exporting a virtual volume to client hosts.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Once all of the directors are up, check the status of the replication groups to ensure replication is proceeding as expected.

details.customerDescription: Insufficient active members of Rmg group '%s' to setup required replication level.
details.internalDescription: This message can occur during Plex startup when the Plex is attempting to activate replication procedures but not all of the directors that belong to this replication group are initialized yet.
details.formatString: Insufficient active members of Rmg group '%s' to setup required replication level.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A change in replication setting has been made to a virtual volume that is relevant to this director (in that the director is a member of a replication group that the virtual volume is set to use), either via command or via flash memory reads on other directors. When trying to store the new settings to local flash memory, some error has been encountered, such as the flash memory being full.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Record the state of replication settings so they can be manually restored after the next Plex reset, if required. Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Cannot save virtual volume info to flash, current %s
details.internalDescription: Writing to the non-volatile memory failed. Data replication is unaffected but this virtual volume will need to be reconfigured for replication after the next Plex reset.
details.formatString: Cannot save virtual volume info to flash, current %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is the same as event rmg/8 except that the error was encountered on the final flush of a bufferful of data to the flash memory, rather than on an intermediate buffer flush.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Record the state of replication settings so they can be manually restored after the next Plex reset, if required. Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Cannot flush virtual volume info to flash
details.internalDescription: Writing to the non-volatile memory failed. Data replication is unaffected but replicated virtual volumes will need to be reconfigured for replication after the next Plex reset.
details.formatString: Cannot flush virtual volume info to flash

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The named Rmg replication group now only has one member. If that member fails, no replication in the group will be possible.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: To restore redundancy to this group, reset the failed director or add another director to the group.

details.customerDescription: Replication group '%s' no longer has redundancy.
details.internalDescription: Due to a director failure or removal the reported replication group no longer has redundancy. A failure in the remaining director will result in loss of data.
details.formatString: Replication group '%s' no longer has redundancy.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A change in membership of an Rmg replication group that affects this director, such as this director being added to the group, requires that the membership information for the group be written to local flash memory. That write has failed partway through.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Record the state of replication settings so they can be manually restored after the next Plex reset, if required. Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Cannot save membership of group %s to flash
details.internalDescription: Writing to the non-volatile memory failed. Data replication is unaffected but will need to be manually reconfigured after the next Plex reset.
details.formatString: Cannot save membership of group %s to flash

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This is the same as event rmg/10 except that the error has happened on the final flush of a bufferful of membership data.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Record the state of replication settings so they can be manually restored after the next Plex reset, if required. Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Cannot save membership of group %s to flash
details.internalDescription: Writing to the non-volatile memory failed. Data replication is unaffected but will need to be manually reconfigured after the next Plex reset.
details.formatString: Cannot save membership of group %s to flash

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Settings indicate that this director should replicate write data to members of an Rmg replication group, when writing to the indicated virtual volume. However, this director cannot find the group, typically due to no members of that group being currently alive. Replication will not happen. This variant is issued when a replication change is being attempted, either due to an operator command or new information from flash memory.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If this occurs during Plex start up, wait until the Plex finishes initialization. Check Device Configuration screen to ensure all directors are active. Reset any directors that are not alive.

details.customerDescription: Replication suspended for volume without active targets.
details.internalDescription: Only one director in the replication group that virtual volume is assigned to is currently active. No replication is possible at this time. A failure in the active director may result in loss of data.
details.formatString: No active members of target Rmg group for virtual volume %s - not replicated

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is the same as rmg/12, except that this one will occur when the virtual volume is actually exported, either due to an operator enabling a WWN pair, an FC port coming up that can now handle an existing export, or a front-end failover, where the existing enabled export must be moved to some other director.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If this occurs during Plex start up, wait until the Plex finishes initialization. Check Device Configuration screen to ensure all directors are active. Reset any directors that are not alive.

details.customerDescription: No active members of target Rmg group for virtual volume %s - not replicated
details.internalDescription: Only one director in the replication group that virtual volume is assigned to is currently active. No replication is possible at this time. A failure in the active director may result in loss of data.
details.formatString: No active members of target Rmg group for virtual volume %s - not replicated

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A user command has requested the creation of a new Rmg replication group, and that creation is going ahead as requested.

details.customerDescription: replication group '%s' created
details.formatString: replication group '%s' created

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A user command has requested the deletion of an Rmg replication group, and that deletion is going ahead as requested.

details.customerDescription: replication group '%s' deleted
details.formatString: replication group '%s' deleted

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: When reading the onboard flash memory for replication group settings, a director has been found to be in two different groups. This conflict can arise when changes are made when directors are down. The conflict is resolved by removing the director from the first-named group.

details.customerDescription: director %s in both %s and %s - removing from %s
details.formatString: director %s in both %s and %s - removing from %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: When reading the onboard flash memory for replication settings, a setting has been found which references a replication group that does not exist. The group(s) will be shown as [INVALID_GROUP] in the event. That replication setting is being ignored. The invalid setting will not be removed until the set of settings needs to be rewritten.

details.customerDescription: replication setting: 'partition %s src %s tgt %s lvl %lu' is invalid - discarding
details.formatString: replication setting: 'partition %s src %s tgt %s lvl %lu' is invalid - discarding

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Introducing event rmg/21 created a bug. If none of the directors that are members of a replication group have booted when other directors are reading their flash for replication settings, then that group will not have been created yet in the Rmg data structures. Thus, event rmg/21 would have triggered, and those replication settings were ignored. This could happen simply based on the timing of director boots. So, rmg/21 is no longer done. Intead, you can now delete a replication group that has invalid replication settings referencing it - those invalid settings will be deleted first, automatically. For each one so deleted, new event rmg/22 is produced. More detail on this one provided by cg: Normally, you can't delete an Rmg group if there are still some replication settings that reference that group as source or target. However, we got into situations where the directors that are members of a group had not booted (e.g. were dead, or were now in a different city....) So, the towers didn't actually know about the group. But, there could have been replication settings stored on other live directors that reference the group. Those settings are invalid, in that they reference an unknown group. Also, they have no effect, since none of the directors in the group are present. So, back in the time of rmg/21, the Rmg code would automatically delete those replication settings as they were read from flash. But, the lack of any directors that are in the "bad" group could have just been an odd-ball bootup timing thing, and that Rmg group would become valid in a few seconds. So, having automatically deleted what we thought were bad replication settings was a bad thing. (I think that process was actually requested by some SPR, since the rule about not being able to delete a group with active settings referencing it meant that a truely bad group could never be deleted.) So, the resolution of not wanting to delete bad settings, but still wanting to be able to get rid of truely bad Rmg groups, required another fix. That fix was to let the user delete the "bad" Rmg group, but, at that time, to automatically delete any replication settings that reference the group. For each such setting deleted, new event rmg/22 is emitted, to show the details of the setting that is being deleted.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If replication is desired for the reported virtual volume, create a new replication setting with a valid source and target group.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: We don't allow remotely-replicating such partitions because our current implementation of the failure recovery process needs to flush the partition on the replication target director. If a partition is not exported, the flush will not be possible in the event of a failure; therefore we prevent establishing the remote replication relationship.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Either amf-export this partition, or add non-remote members to the target replication group.

details.customerDescription: Only remote replication is available in target "
details.internalDescription: While searching for a replication target for this partition which is not amf-exported, we could only find remote directors (at different clusters). We don't allow remote replication for such partitions.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A scsi command issued by the tower has returned with descriptor format sense data. This data can be useful for debugging. In the following description, each field indicated with an asterix (*) is from the sense data format defined in SCSI-3 SCSI Primary Commands (SPC) 4.5.2. The [tgt] is the target that the scsi command is issued to; The [cmd] is the numeric operation code of the scsi command; [status] is the return status of the command; [resp]* is the response code from byte 0 of the sense data; [snskey]* is sense key of the sense data; [asc]* is the additional sense code; [ascq]* is the additional sense code qualifier; [alen] is the additional sense length;

details.arguments: tgt cmd status resp snskey asc ascq alen
details.formatString: tgt %s cmd 0x%x status 0x%x resp 0x%x snskey 0x%x asc 0x%x ascq 0x%x alen %d

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A scsi command issued by the tower has returned with sense data of reserved response code. This data can be useful for debugging. The response code returned in the sense data is between 0x74h and 0x7Eh, which is reserved according to SPC-3 Revision 21c

details.formatString: Sense data with reserved response code 0x%x has been received from target %s. Sense data: %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A scsi command issued by the tower has returned with sense data of vendor specific format. This data can be useful for debugging. The response code returned in the sense data is vendor specific according to SPC-3 Revision 21c.

details.formatString: Sense data with vendor specific response code %x has been recieved from target %s. Sense data: %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A sanity check is run in the array layer which validates a sane path state. Sanity check failures have been observed in some circumstances with Clariions where the two SPs are claiming contradictory active/passive states for the same unit.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The admin should look at the health of the storage array. It is reporting some very strange results and is likely in a degraded state. The tower command 'scsi unitunbanish' will attempt to heal the banished state by refreshing the underlying ITLs. If this operation fails, (i.e. the unhealthy condition still exists), another error of the same type will be thrown and the unit will be returned to the banished state. This is a blade-local command, and will have to be run on all blades which have the lun banished.

details.internalDescription: Logical unit [luId] resolved an inconsistant path state for the array [arrayId]. Recovery attempts failed and the unit has been banished.
details.formatString: Inconsistent path info resolved for logical unit %s on array %s. Banishing the unit.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: ITs can be banished to prevent COM crosstalk on local and wan ports. Other causes of banishment might be misbehaving ITs. Use 'scsi it banished' to see what is banished.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: If the IT in question should be usable, contact techincal support.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Find the LU that is reporting the unsupported device type and replace or remove. follow VPLEX best practices or do not use this target device.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Switch the target device into a supported mode following VPLEX best practices or do not use this target device.

details.customerDescription: Reservation Conflict on a scsi storage-volume.
details.internalDescription: The scsi storage-volume is reserved by another initiator. The VPLEX is not able to issue I/O commands to the scsi storage-volume.
details.formatString: Reservation Conflicts on scsi lun %s
Failover initiated for logical unit %s on array %s to target controller %s as active.
Failover %s for logical unit %s on array %s to target controller %s as active.

details.internalDescription: This unit has reached a normal, healthy state.
details.formatString: Logical unit %s enters NOMINAL state.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A state of VULNERABLE means that at least one director is missing passive paths to this unit. REPAIRABLE_DEGRADED means that at least one director is missing active paths to the unit. DEGRADED means that at least one director is missing active paths and at least one director (not necessarliy the same director) is missing passive paths for a particular unit. UNREACHABLE means that no directors in the cluster have either active or passive paths to the unit.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the backend wiring and zoning on the system to ensure the logical is presented uniformly to all directors in a fully-redundant configuration from both directors of the active/passive storage array.

details.internalDescription: This event indicates that APFO has a sub-optimal state of connectivity to this logical unit on one or more directors.
details.formatString: Logical unit %s enters %s state.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This could be related to a switch reset or failure, a controller reset or failure, a cable failure, or a zoning problem.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Connections between the director, backend switch, and the storage array should be checked. Verify zoning on the backend switch includes the director and the reported controller in the same zone. Verify the controller and any backend switches are functional.

details.internalDescription: The reported controller is no longer reachable by the reporting director.
details.formatString: Controller %s isn't seen by director %x.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This could be related to a switch reset or failure, a controller reset or failure, a cable failure, or a zoning problem.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Connections between the directors, backend switches, and the storage array should be checked. Verify zoning on the backend switch includes the directors and the reported controller in the same zone. Verify the controller and any backend switches are functional.

details.internalDescription: The reported controller is no longer reachable by any director in the cluster.
details.formatString: Controller %s isn't seen by any directors.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: This is likely indicative of severely degraded hardware and/or fabric condition. Restoring connectivity to the array controllers for all directors is the best path to resolution.

details.internalDescription: A single director cannont be selected to perform the falover of a group of luns due to all of the directors being an unsuitable canditate based on the completeness of their path state. The code, at this point, has to drop the failover decision on the floor.
details.formatString: No suitable executor could be found for failover decision on array %s to controller %s. The luns cannot be failed over.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The SES layer is unable to communicate with the enclosure with the wwn [wwn], because it is already communicating with the maximum allowed number of enclosures, [maxCount].
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support for advice on upgrading your Plex

details.customerDescription: maximum enclosure count (%d) exceeded, enclosure 0x%016llx ignored
details.internalDescription: This Plex requires an upgrade before it can support the number of storage volume enclosures currently connected.
details.formatString: maximum enclosure count (%d) exceeded, enclosure 0x%016llx ignored

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The storage volume with wwn [storageVolumeId] (0 if the SES layer is unable to determine it), in slot [enclSlot] of the enclosure with wwn [enclId] has had its status change, from [oldStatusName] to [newStatusName]. The allowed values for status names are: unsupported, OK, critical, noncritical, unrecoverable, notinstalled , unknown, unavailable.

details.customerDescription: storage volume 0x%016llx enclosure 0x%016llx slot %u status change: %s -> %s
details.formatString: storage volume 0x%016llx enclosure 0x%016llx slot %u status change: %s -> %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The generation number for the configuration of the enclosure with wwn [enclId] has changed, from [oldGeneration] to [newGeneration].

details.customerDescription: encl 0x%016llx: updating config: generation 0x%lx -> 0x%lx
details.formatString: encl 0x%016llx: updating config: generation 0x%lx -> 0x%lx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The SES layer had previously assigned the wwn [storageVolumeId] to the storage volume in slot [enclSlot] of the enclosure with wwn [enclId]. Now the SES layer has discovered that the some other storage volume has the wwn [storageVolumeId], and the storage volume in enclosure [enclId] slot [enclSlot] is pulled out. Therefore, the SES layer concludes that someone has physically moved the storage volume, so it undoes the previous assignment.

details.customerDescription: removing stale mapping of storage volume id 0x%016llx to enclosure 0x%016llx slot %u
details.formatString: removing stale mapping of storage volume id 0x%016llx to enclosure 0x%016llx slot %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The information provided by the enclosures to the SES layer has indicated that more than one physical storage volume location (i.e., enclosure/slot combination) has the wwn [wwn]. At least one of these locations must have the wrong wwn, but the SES layer cannot determine which one, so it removes the wwn from all these locations.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: storage volume id 0x%016llx maps to more than one enclosure " pair - removing all mappings
details.internalDescription: The reported storage volume WWN was reported to be in two different enclosure locations. This situation will not affect IO; however, the reported storage volume will not be visible in the Device Configuration screen.
details.formatString: storage volume id 0x%016llx maps to more than one enclosure " pair - removing all mappings

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The storage volume with wwn [wwn] has more than one distinct AL-PA (arbitrated loop physical address), so the SES layer will be unable to determine the enclosure and slot of this storage volume.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: storage volume id 0x%llx has more than one distinct AL-PA
details.internalDescription: The reported storage volume was reported to be in more than one physical location. This situation will not affect IO; however, the reported storage volume will not be visible in the Device Configuration screen.
details.formatString: storage volume id 0x%llx has more than one distinct AL-PA

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The SES layer has noticed that the storage volume wwn [storageVolumeId] matches more than one storage volume slot of the enclosure with wwn [enclId]. The SES layer cannot determine which, if any, of these slots should have wwn [storageVolumeId], so it refuses to map [storageVolumeId] to any slot.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: not mapping storage volume id 0x%llx - it matches more than one slot of enclosure 0x%llx
details.internalDescription: The reported storage volume was reported to be in more than one physical location. This situation will not affect IO; however, the reported storage volume will not be visible in the Device Configuration screen.
details.formatString: not mapping storage volume id 0x%llx - it matches more than one slot of enclosure 0x%llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The SES layer is no longer able to communicate with the enclosure with wwn [enclId].
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Some storage volume enclosures require storage volumes be installed in specific drive bays for SCSI enclosure services to work. Verify all storage volumes are seated properly and no storage volumes were removed. If problems persist, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: lost contact with enclosure 0x%llx
details.internalDescription: The Plex can no longer communicate with the SCSI enclosure services provided by the reported storage volume enclosure.
details.formatString: lost contact with enclosure 0x%llx

details.internalDescription: The Plex can no longer communicate with the SCSI enclosure services provided by the reported storage volume enclosure.

details.internalDescription: The Plex can no longer communicate with the SCSI enclosure services provided by the reported storage volume enclosure.

details.customerDescription: lost contact with enclosure 0x%llx
details.internalDescription: The Plex can no longer communicate with the SCSI enclosure services provided by the reported storage volume enclosure.
details.formatString: lost contact with enclosure 0x%llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The SES layer has just discovered the enclosure with wwn [enclId], which it can communicate with via a device with wwn [deviceId].

details.customerDescription: found encl wwn 0x%016llx via device 0x%llx
details.formatString: found encl wwn 0x%016llx via device 0x%llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The SES layer is changing the wwn of the storage volume in slot [enclSlot] of the enclosure with wwn [enclId], from [oldStorageVolumeId] to [newStorageVolumeId]. If either of the storage volume id's is unknown (i.e., changing from unknown id to a known one, or vice-versa) it will shown as zero (0).

details.customerDescription: changing storage volume wwn of enclosure 0x%llx slot %u: 0x%llx -> 0x%llx
details.formatString: changing storage volume wwn of enclosure 0x%llx slot %u: 0x%llx -> 0x%llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The storage volume with wwn [storageVolumeId] has no AL-PA in the data structures in the FC layer, so the SES layer is unable to assign this wwn to any enclosure/slot combination.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Call EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: storage volume id 0x%llx has no AL-PA
details.internalDescription: The Plex cannot determine the physical location of the reported storage volume. IO is unaffected; however, that storage volume will not be displayed in the Device Configuration screen.
details.formatString: storage volume id 0x%llx has no AL-PA

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [OBSOLETE] The SES layer has detected a mis-match on the enclosure with wwn [enclId]. The generation number from the enclosure's configuration page is [configGeneration], and that from the enclosures's status page is [statusGeneration]. Because of this, the SES layer will re-fetch the enclosure's configuration page.

details.customerDescription: enclosure id 0x%16llx: generation mis-match: generation mis-match: from-config (%lu) != from-status (%lu)
details.formatString: enclosure id 0x%16llx: generation mis-match: generation mis-match: from-config (%lu) != from-status (%lu)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The SES layer has retried a SES command on the SES device with wwn [interfaceWwn] the maximum number of times. This means that the SES layer now is no longer able to communicate with the device [interfaceWwn]. If that is currently the only device with which the SES layer communicates with the enclosure, then the enclosure is unreachable as well, but in that case, a separate event will be logged in addition to this one.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Ensure all storage volumes are seated properly in all enclosures. View the Device Configuration screen to ensure all required management data is available. Contact EMC Technical Support if problem persists.

details.customerDescription: reached maximum retries on SES device 0x%016llx - giving up
details.internalDescription: Some storage volume enclosures provide two communication paths to SCSI enclosure services, which will be unaffected by one path failure.
details.formatString: reached maximum retries on SES device 0x%016llx - giving up

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This is the same as event ses/17, but it occurs at a different place in the code.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Ensure all storage volumes are seated properly in all enclosures. View the Device Configuration screen to ensure all required management data is available. Contact EMC Technical Support if problem persists.

details.customerDescription: reached maximum retries on SES device 0x%016llx - giving up
details.internalDescription: Some storage volume enclosures provide two communication paths to SCSI enclosure services, which will be unaffected by one path failure.
