details.internalDescription: Some storage volume enclosures provide two communication paths to SCSI enclosure services, which will be unaffected by one path failure.
details.formatString: reached maximum retries on SES device 0x%016llx - giving up

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The SES layer has established contact with an enclosure (wwn [enclId]) that it had previously lost contact with. The contact is via the device with wwn [deviceId].

details.customerDescription: re-established contact with enclosure 0x%016llx via device 0x%llx
details.formatString: re-established contact with enclosure 0x%016llx via device 0x%llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The SES layer has determined that the enclosure with wwn [enclId] fails to properly support the swap bit. (See SCSI-3 SES section 7.1.2). In particular, the SES layer knows that the storage volume in slot [enclSlot] has been recently inserted, yet the swap for that slot in the status page is not set. The SES layer will now behave the same was as if it had discovered the swap bit set. However, it is possible for it to miss situations of this sort, and this event is warning the user to that effect.

details.customerDescription: enclosure 0x%016llx failed to set swap bit for slot %d
details.formatString: enclosure 0x%016llx failed to set swap bit for slot %d

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The SES layer noticed that the enclosure with wwn [enclId] lost one or more of its power supplies, and there is only one working power supply left.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: enclosure 0x%016llx lost one or more power supplies and has only one left
details.internalDescription: One power supply in the reported storage volume enclosure requires servicing.
details.formatString: enclosure 0x%016llx lost one or more power supplies and has only one left

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The SES layer noticed that the enclosure with wwn [enclId] lost one or more of its power supplies, but there are at least two working power supplies left.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Replace the power supplies.

details.customerDescription: enclosure 0x%016llx lost one or more power supplies
details.internalDescription: Although the enclosure lost one or more power supplies, at least two power supplies are still operating.
details.formatString: enclosure 0x%016llx lost one or more power supplies

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The SES layer noticed that temperature of the enclosure with wwn [enclId] has dropped below the "low warning threshold" value.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check environmental conditions in the server room.

details.customerDescription: enclosure 0x%016llx: undertemperature warning
details.internalDescription: The SCSI enclosure services provided by the storage volume enclosure indicates the temperature fell below the acceptable limit.
details.formatString: enclosure 0x%016llx: undertemperature warning

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A previous undertemperature warning condition in the enclosure with wwn [enclId] has been cleared. I.e., the temperature of the enclosure has risen above the "low warning threshold" value.

details.customerDescription: enclosure 0x%016llx: undertemperature warning cleared
details.internalDescription: This event clears a previous under temperature warning.
details.formatString: enclosure 0x%016llx: undertemperature warning cleared

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The SES layer noticed that temperature of the enclosure with wwn [enclId] has dropped below the "low critical threshold" value.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check environmental conditions in the server room.

details.customerDescription: enclosure 0x%016llx: undertemperature failure
details.internalDescription: The SCSI enclosure services provided by the storage volume enclosure indicates the temperature fell below the low critical threshold. The enclosure may shut down automatically.
details.formatString: enclosure 0x%016llx: undertemperature failure

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A previous undertemperature failure condition in the enclosure with wwn [enclId] has been cleared. I.e., the temperature of the enclosure has risen above the "low critical threshold" value.

details.customerDescription: enclosure 0x%016llx: undertemperature failure cleared
details.formatString: enclosure 0x%016llx: undertemperature failure cleared

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The SES layer noticed that temperature of the enclosure with wwn [enclId] has risen above the "high warning threshold" value.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check environmental conditions in the server room.

details.customerDescription: enclosure 0x%016llx: overtemperature warning
details.internalDescription: The SCSI enclosure services provided by the storage volume enclosure indicates the temperature rose above the acceptable limit.
details.formatString: enclosure 0x%016llx: overtemperature warning

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A previous overtemperature warning condition in the enclosure with wwn [enclId] has been cleared. I.e., the temperature of the enclosure has dropped below the "high warning threshold" value.

details.customerDescription: enclosure 0x%016llx: overtemperature warning cleared
details.internalDescription: This event clears a previous overtemperature warning.
details.formatString: enclosure 0x%016llx: overtemperature warning cleared

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The SES layer noticed that temperature of the enclosure with wwn The SES layer noticed that temperature of the enclosure with wwn [enclId] has risen above the "high critical threshold" value.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check environmental conditions in the server room.

details.customerDescription: enclosure 0x%016llx: overtemperature failure
details.internalDescription: The SCSI enclosure services provided by the storage volume enclosure indicates the temperature rose above the high critical threshold. The enclosure may shutdown automatically.
details.formatString: enclosure 0x%016llx: overtemperature failure

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A previous overtemperature failure condition in the enclosure with wwn [enclId] has been cleared. I.e., the temperature of the enclosure has dropped below the "high critical threshold" value.

details.customerDescription: enclosure 0x%016llx: overtemperature failure cleared
details.formatString: enclosure 0x%016llx: overtemperature failure cleared

details.customerDescription: enclosure 0x%016llx now has more than one power supply
details.internalDescription: Just prior to this event, the identified enclosure had only one working power supply, and now it has more than one.
details.formatString: enclosure 0x%016llx now has more than one power supply

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Just prior to this event, the enclosure with wwn [enclId] had only one working fan, and now it has more than one.

details.customerDescription: enclosure 0x%016llx now has more than one fan
details.formatString: enclosure 0x%016llx now has more than one fan

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The SES layer noticed that the enclosure with wwn [enclId] lost one or more of its fans, and there are no working fans left.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: enclosure 0x%016llx lost one or more fans and has none left
details.internalDescription: The reported storage volume enclosure is at serious risk of overheating. IO to storage volumes in this enclosure should be halted and the enclosure shutdown until the situation can be resolved.
details.formatString: enclosure 0x%016llx lost one or more fans and has none left

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The SES layer noticed that the enclosure with wwn [enclId] lost one or more of its fans, and there is only working fan left.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: enclosure 0x%016llx lost one or more fans and has only one left
details.internalDescription: A fan in the reported enclosure failed. The remaining fan is sufficient to cool the enclosure; however, the fan module should be replaced as soon as possible.
details.formatString: enclosure 0x%016llx lost one or more fans and has only one left

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The SES layer noticed that the enclosure with wwn [enclId] lost one or more of its fans, and there are two or more working fans left.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: enclosure 0x%016llx lost one or more fans (but has 2 or more left)
details.internalDescription: A fan in the reported enclosure failed. The remaining fans are sufficient to cool the enclosure; however, the fan module should be replaced as soon as possible.
details.formatString: enclosure 0x%016llx lost one or more fans (but has 2 or more left)

details.customerDescription: enclosure 0x%016llx now has one or more fans
details.internalDescription: Just prior to this event, the enclosure had no working fans, and now it has at least one.
details.formatString: enclosure 0x%016llx now has one or more fans

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This is the same as event ses/17, but it occurs at a different place in the code.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Ensure all storage volumes are seated properly in all enclosures. View the Device Configuration screen to ensure all required management data is available. Contact EMC Technical Support if problem persists.

details.customerDescription: reached maximum retries on SES device 0x%016llx - giving up
details.internalDescription: Some storage volume enclosures provide two communication paths to SCSI enclosure services, which will be unaffected by one path failure.
details.formatString: reached maximum retries on SES device 0x%016llx - giving up

details.customerDescription: cannot create sesInit thread
details.formatString: cannot create sesInit thread

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: In response to an administrator request, this director is commencing a shutdown.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is needed.

details.customerDescription: Director shutting down as requested
details.internalDescription: The operator has requested that this director be shut down. This message confirms that the shutdown process has started.
details.formatString: Director shutting down as requested

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: In response to an administrator request, or a HWH condition, this cluster is shutting down. This event will appear on all directors at the cluster.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The user cannot stop the shutdown, but may have some control over a loss of power situation, and so can be ready for a quick reboot.

details.customerDescription: Cluster shutting down as requested
details.internalDescription: As a result of an operator request, or because of a HWH condition, this cluster has commenced shutdown.
details.formatString: Cluster shutting down as requested

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Shutdown of this director is complete. The director can safely be powered off without loss of data.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The director is now ready for manual user action, such as powering off, physical removal, rebooting, etc.

details.customerDescription: Director shutdown complete
details.internalDescription: This director has completed its shutdown processing and can now be safely powered off (if it has not done so by itself). It can also be rebooted if that is desired.
details.formatString: Director shutdown complete

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This director has completed its part of the shutdown of its cluster. It can be safely powered off without loss of data.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: When all directors at the cluster have completed their shutdown, the entire cluster can be powered off, physically removed, disassembled, etc.

details.customerDescription: Director shutdown complete (cluster shutdown)
details.internalDescription: This director has completed its part of the shutdown of this cluster and can now safely be powered off. However, since the rest of this cluster is being shut down, the other directors should be checked to see if they have all fully shut down before rebooting any of the directors at the cluster.
details.formatString: Director shutdown complete (cluster shutdown)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This director is attempting to shut down, but cannot get needed resources. It will continue retrying on a periodic basis. When it can start shutting down, event shdn/1 will be emitted. 1.11: this is a fatal error.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is needed.

details.customerDescription: Cannot create thread for director shutdown - shutdown will be delayed
details.internalDescription: This director has been asked to shut down, but has encountered a lack of memory to create a thread to do so. It will retry periodically, and will emit an event when it starts its shutdown.
details.formatString: Cannot create thread for director shutdown - shutdown will be delayed

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This director is attempting to shut down as part of the shutdown of its cluster. However, it cannot allocate resources needed. It will continue retrying on a periodic basis. When it can start shutting down, event shdn/2 will be emitted. 1.11: this is a fatal error.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is needed.

details.customerDescription: Cannot create thread for local cluster shutdown - shutdown will be delayed
details.internalDescription: This director needs to shut down as part of shutting down its cluster, but it has encountered a lack of memory. It will retry periodically, and will emit event shdn/2 when it starts its shutdown.
details.formatString: Cannot create thread for local cluster shutdown - shutdown will be delayed

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This director has been told about the shutdown of the specified cluster, and is trying to ensure that it is not exporting data from that cluster to its connected hosts. However, it cannot allocate the needed resources. It will continue retrying on a periodic basis. 1.11: this is a fatal error.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is needed.

details.customerDescription: Cannot create thread for cluster %u shutdown - shutdown will be delayed
details.internalDescription: This director, like all directors, needs to participate in the shutdown of a remote cluster. However, due to a lack of memory, the participation can't be started. This director will retry periodically.
details.formatString: Cannot create thread for cluster %u shutdown - shutdown will be delayed

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A director shutdown was requested (either by the admin or because of a low power signal), but only one director is left at this cluster. So, the shutdown has turned into a cluster shutdown.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is needed.

details.customerDescription: Only one director left at cluster - director shutdown becomes cluster shutdown
details.internalDescription: If the last director at a cluster has been requested to shut down, this is effectively a cluster shutdown. So, the internal details of the shutdown have been changed to be that of a cluster shutdown.
details.formatString: Only one director left at cluster - director shutdown becomes cluster shutdown

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event, and the abort, happens when this director receives shdn component state from another director at this cluster.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is needed.

details.customerDescription: My cluster is shutting down - shutting down this director immediately
details.internalDescription: The local cluster is currently shutting down, but a new director is just booting at this cluster. There is no useful work the new director can do, and it might hinder the shutdown. So, it immediately aborts instead.
details.formatString: My cluster is shutting down - shutting down this director immediately

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A high volume of "Abort Task" messages generally indicate extremely slow or stuck I/O processing (check "cch ops"). Hosts will escalate to "Logical Unit Reset" and "Target Reset" TMFs if they remain unhappy. The status field contains internal SCSI Target and cache status flags for any aborted task.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check I/O processing statistics.

details.arguments: tmf transport initiatorPortName initiatorPortWWN targetPortName targetPortWWN lun qtag status
details.customerDescription: Scsi Task Management Function has been peformed on the specified ITLQ nexus.
details.internalDescription: Task Management Functions (TMFs) are part of error and recovery processing by initiators. In large numbers, they are indicative of high latency I/O processing.
details.formatString: Scsi Tmf [%s] on %s ITLQ: [%s (0x%"FS64x") %s (0x%"FS64x") 0x%"FS64x" 0x%"FS64x"] status %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: More info about current logins is available via provider commands. For qlc, try "qlc show login" or "qlc pdb".
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check fabric zoning and storage-view configurations.

details.customerDescription: Unregistered initiator port established %s IT nexus [%s %s]
details.internalDescription: In SCSI, a nexus represents a connection, or login. Best practises state that initiators should be zoned only to see those target ports through which they have access to storage.
details.formatString: Unregistered initiator port established %s IT nexus [%s %s]

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Failing to handle incoming TMFs, especially Abort Task TMFs, can lead to data corruption.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Malformed Tmf %s summarily rejected (srr %d)
details.internalDescription: A SCSI Task Management Function (TMF) has been rejected because it was malformed by the initiator.
details.formatString: Malformed Tmf %s summarily rejected (srr %d)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Failing to handle incoming TMFs, especially Abort Task TMFs, can lead to data corruption (iproj:773). This situation can occur legitimately as a race condition, but it is rare. If this event is generated frequently, it suggests a bug in the formation of the StdfNexus that is used to search for the matching task to abort.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If these events occur with regularity, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Abort Task Tmf unable to find tag 0x%llx
details.internalDescription: A SCSI Task Management Function (TMF) has been processed for which no active task on the nexus could be found.
details.formatString: Abort Task Tmf unable to find tag 0x%llx

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This log message is generated whenever an FCP initiator port establishes a connection to a target port.

details.customerDescription: An initiator port has established an FCP connection with a target port.
details.internalDescription: An initiator port has established an FCP connection with a target port.
details.formatString: FCP connection established. IT: [%s (0x%"FS64x") %s (0x%"FS64x")]

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This log message is generated whenever a FCP initiator port's connection to a target port is lost, due to logout or departure from the fabric.

details.customerDescription: A target port has lost its FCP connection with an initiator port.
details.internalDescription: A target port has lost its FCP connection with an initiator port.
details.formatString: FCP connection established. IT: [%s (0x%"FS64x") %s (0x%"FS64x")]

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is a generic one. It contains the variable data and format from a tower abort (internal firmware error).
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An internal firmware error has occurred. This is almost certainly a software error, but it can be triggered by unexpected changes in the cluster's environment or configuration.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The affected director is being reset. If normal operation is not restored, contact EMC Technical Support.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The affected director is being reset. If normal operation is not restored, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: A director is resetting due to an internal software failure.
details.internalDescription: The affected director is being reset. Normal operation should be reestablished within minutes.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This log message is produced when the user enters the "log" command on the console with a non-numeric first argument. The entire tail of the command line is the text of the log message.

details.customerDescription: This is the log message.
details.formatString: This is the log message.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This log message is produced when the user's privilege level has been changed from [CmdPrivLevel] to [level] using the essyou command.

details.customerDescription: Privilege level changed from %lu to %lu
details.formatString: Privilege level changed from %lu to %lu

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This looks like just a demonstration of logging. [Should this even be in here?]

details.customerDescription: This is via dbg_event
details.formatString: This is via dbg_event

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The date has been set manually by the user.

details.customerDescription: Date manually set.
details.formatString: Date manually set.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The board shutdown process has been started. This occurs when the "shutdown" command is issued. This command is issued when the administrator wishes to cleanly shut down the director, typically when the director is to be powered off, or restarted. Note that the shutdown command affects the single director only. Note: This message is not displayed in SMS because SMS generates its own message when shut down is started.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Wait for the "Shutdown completed" message.

details.customerDescription: Shutdown started.
details.internalDescription: The shutdown command was issued.
details.formatString: Shutdown started.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The board shutdown process has completed. The director can now be powered off or restarted without starting full recovery activity.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Perform required maintenance, then restart the director/Plex

details.customerDescription: Shutdown completed.
details.internalDescription: The director finished its shutdown process. It can now be serviced.
details.formatString: Shutdown completed.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is issued by the event code when a caller tried to generate an event that does not fit within the Plex buffers. This event is sent out instead, which identifies the level, component and event id of the too-long event.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If the level is higher than INFO, examine surrounding messages in the Plex log. Contact EMC Technical Support if assistance is required.

details.customerDescription: log message too long - lvl %u cmp '%s' id %u
details.internalDescription: A log message received from the director was too long. The message contents were lost.
details.formatString: log message too long - lvl %u cmp '%s' id %u

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This director has been set up to flush trace data to storage volume on [volumeName].

details.customerDescription: Trace-to-storage volume started on virtual volume %s
details.formatString: Trace-to-storage volume started on virtual volume %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Trace to storage volume has been disabled on this director. The disable may be either the result of a user command or due to problems writing to the trace virtual volume.

details.customerDescription: Trace-to-storage volume disabled - on block %llu after %u wraps
details.formatString: Trace-to-storage volume disabled - on block %llu after %u wraps

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Trace to storage volume was not able to keep up with the in-memory tracing and some trace data has been lost. This event is only emitted the first time such an error occurs.

details.customerDescription: Trace-to-storage volume is not keeping up with in-memory trace
details.formatString: Trace-to-storage volume is not keeping up with in-memory trace

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is for information purposes only.

details.customerDescription: sw-version: %s
details.formatString: sw-version: %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is for information purposes only.

details.customerDescription: sw-info: %s
details.formatString: sw-info: %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is for information purposes only.

details.customerDescription: sw-build: %s
details.formatString: sw-build: %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The 'trace autostop' setting was enabled, and the trace buffer has now filled, causing the trace to stop.

details.customerDescription: Trace has been automatically stopped with a full buffer.
details.formatString: Trace has been automatically stopped with a full buffer.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This director has been terminated as expected (e.g. after vaulting has completed).
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: This director has been terminated as expected (e.g. after vaulting has completed).
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The director will be restarted as part of the normal recovery procedure.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The director will be restarted as part of the normal recovery procedure.

details.customerDescription: A director has been terminated as expected.
details.internalDescription: A director has been terminated as expected.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [This event is obsolete - it is associated with the "vdp attach" command, which is no longer supported.]

details.customerDescription: No space to persistently record attach of '%s' to port %lu
details.formatString: No space to persistently record attach of '%s' to port %lu

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A read request has come in to the Vdp layer that extends beyond the size of the partition that the request is for. The Vdp code rejects the request, and logs this event. As of this writing, this event should not be possible, since the STDF front-end code checks the range before passing the request on.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact the application vendor and/or EMC Technical Support, if the problem persists.

details.customerDescription: vdpRead: invalid parms (blk [scsiBlockNumber] cnt [scsiBlockCount] partsz [partSize])
details.internalDescription: An application attempted to read beyond the end of the exported partition. This situation may be due to a software error or incorrect parameters passed to that application.
details.formatString: vdpRead: invalid parms (blk %llu cnt %lu partsz %llu)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event is the same as vdp/2, except for a write, not a read.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact the application vendor and/or EMC Technical Support, if problem persists.

details.customerDescription: vdpWrite: invalid parameters (pg [scsiBlockNumber] cnt [scsiBlockCount] partsz [partSize])
details.internalDescription: An application attempted to write beyond the end of the exported partition. This situation may be due to a software error or incorrect parameters passed to that application.
details.formatString: vdpWrite: invalid parameters (pg %llu cnt %lu partsz %llu)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: When some component, e.g. the Ag, wishes to start doing I/O to a partition, a request is given to the Vdp that it wishes to do so. The Vdp in turn must register the partition with the cache, to enable I/O through the cache, prefetching, replication, etc. This particular event happens when the partition is not ready for I/O at the time (in terms of back-end storage volumes), but then has become ready later. At that point, the registration with the cache has returned an error code. This will prevent I/O.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Vdp: could not register %s with cache when becoming initialized - got result %d
details.internalDescription: An error occurred obtaining internal resources for the export. This situation prevents IO to that partition.
details.formatString: Vdp: could not register %s with cache when becoming initialized - got result %d

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An I/O request has been received by the Vdp after the "shutdown" command has been issued to the director. The shutdown has not yet completed in the Vdp, however (current I/O's are still flushing through). This should not happen, and the Vdp will fail the request.

details.customerDescription: I
details.formatString: I

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This should not happen, and indicates an internal inconsistency in the tower code.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Invalid request - NULL Vdp pointer
details.internalDescription: An unexpected internal error occurred.
details.formatString: Invalid request - NULL Vdp pointer

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An I/O request has arrived at the Vdp, but the structure representing the partition to do the I/O on does not seem to be valid. This represents an error in the tower code. The Vdp will fail the request.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Bad magic in vdpTryRunRequest
details.internalDescription: An unexpected internal error occurred.
details.formatString: Bad magic in vdpTryRunRequest

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An I/O request has arrived at the Vdp, but the request is for a partition that has been detached, and is just flushing its last I/O's through. The component issuing the request is likely in error. The Vdp will fail the request.

details.customerDescription: Invalid request on detached partition
details.formatString: Invalid request on detached partition

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [This event is obsolete - it relates to the soon-to-be-removed "vdp ports" concept.] Partition [partName] was attached to port [port].

details.customerDescription: Attached %s to port %lu
details.formatString: Attached %s to port %lu

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [This event is obsolete - it relates to the soon-to-be-removed "vdp ports" concept.] Partition [partName] was detached from port [port].

details.customerDescription: Detached %s from port %lu
details.formatString: Detached %s from port %lu

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: [This event is obsolete - it is part of the soon-to-be-removed "vdp attach" command.] The partition being attached (see vdp/9) is not actually ready to do I/O yet, due to an incomplete set of back-end storage volumes.

details.customerDescription: Note that RG underlying %s is dead
details.formatString: Note that RG underlying %s is dead

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Vdp could not create a timer to do the check discussed in vdp/13. Thus, there will be no event if the indicated virtual volume does not become I/O-able in a minute.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: could not create timer to check status of pre-attached virtual volume [0x%016llx.%lu]
details.internalDescription: An unexpected internal error occurred.
details.formatString: could not create timer to check status of pre-attached virtual volume [0x%016llx.%lu]

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: If a request to enable I/O for a virtual volume happens before the back end has discovered any of the storage volumes involved in the virtual volume, then the back end does not yet even know about the device and virtual volume. It is possible that it never will. So, the Vdp code starts a one minute timer when such a request comes in. If the virtual volume is not I/O-able after a minute, the Vdp will issue this warning. The status will usually be "media not present". There is no way to convert "volumeName" to a device name. After the device is finally discovered (if it ever is), "vdp l" will show the name and the id. Saved console logs or GUI sessions may show old versions of the id to name mapping.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Wait for the Plex to complete initialization. Verify all expected storage volumes have been discovered and all device sets are available as displayed in the Device Configuration screen.

details.customerDescription: volume %s is still '%s'
details.internalDescription: The storage volumes that comprise the device set containing the reported virtual volume have not been discovered yet. The Plex will retry after discovering the storage volumes.
details.formatString: volume %s is still '%s'

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A simple allocation request has failed. The director is essentially completely out of memory and is unlikely to be working well.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Reduce the load on the director that encountered the problem.

details.customerDescription: no memory to attach %s
details.internalDescription: An internal component could not allocate a small amount of memory when attaching a virtual volume for client export. I/O on that virtual volume will not be possible. If this happens, the Plex will likely be having other more serious problems as well.
details.formatString: no memory to attach %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event comes out when the suspend count for a Vdp attachment goes from 1 to 0.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is needed.

details.customerDescription: Resuming I
details.internalDescription: Volumes are suspended for various reasons, such as the loss of an intercluster link. "Losing" virtual volumes are not automatically resumed after they are again available for I/O. This event is issued when all conditions, internal or manual, that were blocking I/O are released.
details.formatString: Resuming I

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event comes out when the suspend count for a Vdp attachment goes from 0 to 1. If a partition is suspended, this event only happens on the director doing the export of that partition. This event reports only suspensions that are the first of potentially several, so the [reason] may not be very helpful, and is not displayed to the user.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If an intercluster link loss has just occurred, then restoring that link should unsuspend I/O on affected partitions. If that is not possible and I/O must happen, then the administrator will need to declare missing clusters as detached for the Amf in question.

details.customerDescription: Suspending I
details.internalDescription: Partitions are suspended for various reasons, such as the loss of an intercluster link. Temporary suspensions are also used for internal purposes.
details.formatString: Suspending I

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The virtual volume is being attached in the Vdp when it is already suspended. "vdp pst [volumeName]" will show its suspend/resume history. This event should be very rare. It happens if we're just now exporting the virtual volume for the first time, minutes or even days after this cluster was declared the loser after a link outage. It's difficult for SW to detect this case, and automatically clear the lsrSusp flag. It will usually be cleared by the operator doing "amf losersresume *".
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check the virtual volume status. If it is awaiting a manual resume ("amf list detailed" shows "lsrSusp T"), then use the "amf losersresume" command to unsuspend I/O on that virtual volume, when any host applications using it are ready for the data change.

details.customerDescription: Volume %s attached suspended
details.internalDescription: The virtual volume has just been attached, likely because it is now exported to hosts. However, it is not yet ready for I/O. This may be for a brief internal reason, or because an "amf losersresume" is needed to allow I/O on it after its data has changed.
details.formatString: Volume %s attached suspended

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A logging volume is normally created when the Plex or cluster is first installed. Check with your Plex installer or contact EMC Technical Support for assistance.

details.customerDescription: Attaching to virtual volume %s, for which logging is not fully set up.
details.internalDescription: The Plex has been configured to export a virtual volume. The underlying device is not fully protected for logging changed data when a mirror is not accessible. Any write to the virtual volume while the mirror is not accessible can result in the device being marked fully out of date. Full rebuilds begin on unprotected devices when access to the mirror is restored. A mirror is inaccessible during a link outage or if access to storage devices is lost.
details.formatString: Attaching to virtual volume %s, for which logging is not fully set up.

details.customerDescription: Cannot create zero
details.internalDescription: Could not allocate enough memory to create a page full of zeros to use when faking I/O to the indicated virtual volume. I/O will be real.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A new majority setting has been added to the specified volume set. The setting ensures that after the departure of any cluster that is relevant to the volumes in the set (either because they are part of the volumes, or have been identified as "extraSites"), the cluster will be detached as long as the number of in-touch relevant clusters is at least equal to the specified majority number.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Check the state of HWH.

details.customerDescription: HWH state '[stateShortDescription]', shutting down cluster.
details.formatString: HWH state '%s', shutting down cluster.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check the state of your environment file system.

details.customerDescription: Error reading hwhBehaviour env variable, using defaults.
details.formatString: Error reading hwhBehaviour env variable, using defaults.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check/restore the hwhBehaviour variable.

details.customerDescription: Invalid hwhBehaviour env variable ignored.
details.formatString: Invalid hwhBehaviour env variable ignored.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check the state of HWH.

details.customerDescription: HWH state '%s', switching to write-through.
details.internalDescription: Because the HWH device is not in a healthy state, writes from the host will not be acknowledged until the data is on storage volume (not just in cache).
details.formatString: HWH state '%s', switching to write-through.

details.customerDescription: HWH state '%s', switching to write-back.
details.internalDescription: Because the HWH device has returned to a healthy state, writes from the host to virtual volumes set to write-back will now be acknowledged once they are in cache, rather than waiting until the data is on storage volume.
details.formatString: HWH state '%s', switching to write-back.

details.customerDescription: Switch to write-through complete.
details.internalDescription: Switch to write-through complete on this director.
details.formatString: Switch to write-through complete.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If the suspended I/O is due to a failure in the network link, and I/O must be reinstated before the link is restored, then one or more non-communicating clusters must be detached for each virtual volume in the WOF group to allow the remaining clusters access to distributed storage.

details.customerDescription: Suspending I
details.internalDescription: Multi-cluster activities, e.g. loss of a link, and director failures require that all I/O be suspended to the indicated WOF group.
details.formatString: Suspending I

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: All delta catch-ups, etc., have completed.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Verify hosts have recognized the storage is again accessible.

details.customerDescription: Resuming I
details.internalDescription: Synchronization of Plex data is complete. The reported WOF group is once again available for I/O.
details.formatString: Resuming I

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Check the metadata storage volume on the lowest cluster, to ensure that it is healthy and can be read.

details.customerDescription: Master not ready to process %s command.
details.internalDescription: Until persisted state has been read on the lowest uuid director in the Plex WOF configuration commands cannot be processed.
details.formatString: Master not ready to process %s command.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If the failed director cannot be rebooted, contact EMC customer support.

details.customerDescription: Data-preserving failure has caused a temporary loss of WOF consistency on group %s.
details.internalDescription: After a director failure, the Plex flushes out all dirty data to the storage volumes, ignoring WOF consistency. When the flushes complete, WOF consistency will be restored.
details.formatString: Data-preserving failure has caused a temporary loss of WOF consistency on group %s.

details.customerDescription: WOF consistency restored on group %s after director failure.
details.internalDescription: All dirty data from the given WOF group in the Plex at the time of the director failure has been flushed to the underlying storage, and thus WOF consistency is once again available on that WOF group.
details.formatString: WOF consistency restored on group %s after director failure.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This event will go away after the beta, possibly to be replaced by other events.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Issue 'wof resolveFailure [winningCluster]' when all clusters are present.

details.customerDescription: One or more failures causing data loss detected on group %s - 'wof resolveFailure' required to choose a winner.
details.internalDescription: For the current release of WOF functionality, failures resulting in data loss result in the suspension of I/O into the given WOF group. In order to resolve this problem, the 'wof resolveFailure' command must be issued to choose a winning cluster.
details.formatString: One or more failures causing data loss detected on group %s - 'wof resolveFailure' required to choose a winner.

details.customerDescription: Cluster %u chosen to be the winner on WOF group %s after a data-loss failure.
details.internalDescription: The specified cluster has been chosen to contain the desired data image after a failure causing data loss occurred in the Plex Mirrors of all distributed deviceS in the WOF group will be fully rebuilt in order to bring the storage back in sync.
details.formatString: Cluster %u chosen to be the winner on WOF group %s after a data-loss failure.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Restart applications, as required.

details.customerDescription: Discarded uncommitted deltas on WOF group %s.
details.internalDescription: An event (cluster detach or director failure) has caused the Plex to discard all WOF data from the given WOF group not already committed to storage volume.
details.formatString: Discarded uncommitted deltas on WOF group %s.

details.customerDescription: Added virtual volume %s to WOF group %s.
details.internalDescription: The given virtual volume has been added to the given WOF group.
details.formatString: Added virtual volume %s to WOF group %s.

details.customerDescription: Volume %s scheduled for removal from WOF group %s, when the pipeline has been flushed.
details.internalDescription: The admin has requested that the specified virtual volume be removed from the specified WOF group. This will be done once the WOF pipeline has been flushed.
details.formatString: Volume %s scheduled for removal from WOF group %s, when the pipeline has been flushed.

details.customerDescription: Created WOF group %s.
details.internalDescription: A WOF group with the given name has been added to the Plex
details.formatString: Created WOF group %s.

details.customerDescription: Destroyed WOF group %s.
details.internalDescription: A WOF group with the given name has been removed from the Plex
details.formatString: Destroyed WOF group %s.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If access to the reported virtual volume at the repoted cluster is required, remove that virtual volume from the WOF group and I/O will be allowed to proceed.

details.customerDescription: Suspending WOF virtual volume %s exported to hosts at bystander cluster %u.
details.internalDescription: In the current release of WOF functionality, host access to WOF protected virtual volumes is allowed only at clusters that have a mirror of the device set containing that virtual volume. An export at a cluster without a mirror was attempted. I/O to that virtual volume is suspended at that cluster.
details.formatString: Suspending WOF virtual volume %s exported to hosts at bystander cluster %u.

details.customerDescription: Resuming I
details.internalDescription: The reported virtual volume had been remotely exported but was under WOF protection. That type of export is invalid in the current release and that I/O had been suspended. Either that virtual volume was removed from the WOF group or the user has unexported it at the remote cluster.
details.formatString: Resuming I

details.customerDescription: Cluster %u switching to active mode on WOF group %s after being passive for %u deltas.
details.internalDescription: The specified cluster, having not contributed any I/O towards recent WOF deltas on the given WOF group, has now resumed I/O to that group. If the link were to go down, and that cluster were to be detached, data would have to be discarded on the winning cluster in order to maintain write order consistency.
details.formatString: Cluster %u switching to active mode on WOF group %s after being passive for %u deltas.

details.customerDescription: Cluster %u has been passive for %u deltas on WOF group %s - switching to passive mode.
details.internalDescription: The specified cluster, having not contributed any I/O towards recent WOF deltas on the given group, is now being marked as passive. If the link were to go down, and that cluster were to be detached, data would not have to be discarded on the winning cluster in order to maintain write order consistency.
details.formatString: Cluster %u has been passive for %u deltas on WOF group %s - switching to passive mode.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Issue 'wof datachangeresume'.

details.customerDescription: Data image has changed on WOF group %s. Detached losing cluster(s)
details.internalDescription: The exported data image of the given wof group at the cluster that emitted this event has been changed. The reason for the change in data is that we discarded the WOF pipeline (ie. an active cluster was detached or failed and rebooted). The WOF group was not configured to resume I/O automatically in this situation.
details.formatString: Data image has changed on WOF group %s. Detached losing cluster(s)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The given cluster has a newer version of the given WOF group than the local cluster does. This can happen, for instance, if a new cluster joins the Plex or if a cluster fails before it can persist a change to an existing WOF group. The newer version of the WOF group has now been accepted by the local cluster, and operation will continue as normal.

details.customerDescription: Updating to version %llu of WOF group %s, as sent by cluster %u.
details.formatString: Updating to version %llu of WOF group %s, as sent by cluster %u.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The WOF exchange protocol encountered an unexpected error. Hopefully the Plex has recovered from this event, but if it hasn't, then the presence of this event may help us figure out what went wrong.

details.customerDescription: WOF rdma failed on group %s with unexpected error 0x%x.
details.formatString: WOF rdma failed on group %s with unexpected error 0x%x.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The exchange phase of the given WOF group on the local director was interrupted by an nmg group change and needed either to be restarted or abandoned. The specified number of pagelets had already been pulled, from the specified target pagelet count.

details.customerDescription: Exchange phase on WOF group %s interrupted after pulling %u of %u pagelets.
details.formatString: Exchange phase on WOF group %s interrupted after pulling %u of %u pagelets.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The exchange phase of the given WOF group on the local director was interrupted by an nmg group change and needed either to be restarted or abandoned. The local director had not yet received the exchange token, and therefore had not started pulling any pages.

details.customerDescription: Exchange phase on WOF group %s interrupted before beginning to pull any pages.
details.formatString: Exchange phase on WOF group %s interrupted before beginning to pull any pages.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The nvol_write call to store a new maxAggregation value for WOF data transfers has failed. Perhaps nvol is full, or the meta-data storage volume is bad, etc. This is mostly harmless - the new value will simply not be persisted for this cluster.

details.customerDescription: Can't persist new maxAggregation value.
details.formatString: Can't persist new maxAggregation value.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The attempt to create a thread to do the nvol write of a new value of the maxAggregation setting has failed. This is usually an out-of- memory situation. This is mostly harmless - the new value will simply not be persisted for this cluster.

details.customerDescription: Can't create thread to persist new maxAggregation value.
details.formatString: Can't create thread to persist new maxAggregation value.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Address, if possible, the reason for which wthru was requested on the specified WOF group.

details.customerDescription: Avoiding wthru for yve-based WOF group \"%s\".
details.internalDescription: In the current release, WOF groups built from YVE pools do not support going into wthru. In the event that such a group is requested to go into wthru, the request will be ignored.
details.formatString: Avoiding wthru for yve-based WOF group \"%s\".

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Correct the configuration and restart the tower.

details.customerDescription: wofMaxRemoteBlades kw expected unsigned int, got %s
details.internalDescription: When the director is started up, it can be passed a series of parameters to alter its default behaviour. The value for one of those, "wofMaxRemoteBlades", was not in the expected numeric format.
details.formatString: wofMaxRemoteBlades kw expected unsigned int, got %s

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Correct the configuration and restart the tower.

details.customerDescription: wofMaxRemoteBlades kw must be at least 1 and no greater than %d
details.internalDescription: When the director is started up, it can be passed a series of parameters to alter its default behaviour. The value for one of those, "wofMaxRemoteBlades", was less than 1 or greater than 16, which is unsupported.
details.formatString: wofMaxRemoteBlades kw must be at least 1 and no greater than %d

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Issue 'amf lose' as required to let the desired cluster(s) resume I/O, or wait for the link to come back up.

details.customerDescription: Wof group active detach blocked after cluster departure.
details.internalDescription: Active detach has been enabled on the given wof group, and the given cluster has departed. However, that cluster has data in the pipeline of the wof group, as does the local cluster. Therefore, active detach cannot let I/O resume, and the administrator must manually choose one cluster to resume I/O (or wait for the link to come up).
details.formatString: Active detach cannot take effect on wof group %s after departure of cluster %u, manual intervention required to resume I/O

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This is a little awkward at this time but a better solution to this issue needs to wait until the virtual volume manager component comes into existence.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Issue 'amf losersresume'.

details.customerDescription: Data image has changed on WOF group %s. Catching up to the winning cluster(s)
details.internalDescription: The exported data image of the given wof group at the cluster that emitted this event has been changed. The reason for the change in data is because the cluster was detached and has now come back in contact with the winning clusters. The WOF group was not configured to resume I/O automatically in this situation.
details.formatString: Data image has changed on WOF group %s. Catching up to the winning cluster(s)

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The length of the flash-entry that ndu stores should be a mulitple of 8 bytes, the length of a director UUID. It wasn't. Flash may be corrupt.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Shut down the director as quickly as possible, and keep it down until the upgrade sequence succeeds or fails. Report this issue to EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: bad read (len [actual-len]) of uuid list
details.internalDescription: The format of the non-volatile entry that lists the first-upgrader directors is incorrect.
details.formatString: bad read (len %d) of uuid list

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The env_write call returned something other than the length it was asked to write. Flash may be full or damaged.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Shut down the director as quickly as possible, and keep it down until the upgrade sequence is succeeds or fails. Report this issue to EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: bad write (len [actual-len] not [wanted-len]) of uuid list
details.internalDescription: The firmware was unable to write the list of first-upgrader directors to non-volatile memory. Non-volatile memory may now contain an invalid list of first-upgrader directors.
details.formatString: bad write (len %d not %u) of uuid list

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is required.

details.customerDescription: ndu mark success
details.internalDescription: "ndu mark" has completed successfully on this director.
details.formatString: ndu mark success

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is required.

details.customerDescription: ndu release success
details.internalDescription: "ndu release" has completed successfully on this director.
details.formatString: ndu release success

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is required.

details.customerDescription: ndu drain success
details.internalDescription: "ndu drain" has completed successfully on this director.
details.formatString: ndu drain success

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: See Developer-Info entry for "ndu drain failure".
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: See user-action entry for "ndu drain failure".

details.customerDescription: ndu drain failing: timeout
details.internalDescription: "ndu drain" did not complete due to timeout on one or more last-upgrader directors.
details.formatString: ndu drain failing: timeout

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: See Developer-Info entry for "ndu drain failure".
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: See user-action entry for "ndu drain failure".

details.customerDescription: ndu drain failing: %s
details.internalDescription: "ndu drain" did not complete due to a configuration change observed on one or more last-upgrader directors.
details.formatString: ndu drain failing: %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: See developer-info entry for "ndu drain failure".
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: See user-action entry for "ndu drain failure".

details.customerDescription: ndu drain failing: amf-header write
details.internalDescription: "ndu drain" did not complete due to a configuration change observed on one or more last-upgrader directors.
details.formatString: ndu drain failing: amf-header write

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: See Developer-Info entry for "ndu drain failure".
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: See user-action entry for "ndu drain failure".

details.customerDescription: ndu drain failing: nvol write
details.internalDescription: "ndu drain" did not complete due to a configuration change observed on one or more last-upgrader directors.
details.formatString: ndu drain failing: nvol write

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The drain attempt fails if one or more directors timeout or observe a metadata change in the form of either an amf-header write, an nvol write, or a persistent-state change. If the reason for failure is a timeout then using a larger timeout value can increase the likelihood of a subsequent drain-attempt succeeding.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The drain attempt has failed on one or more last-upgrader directors. An undrain is automatically issued on all last-upgrader directors. The drain may be attempted again. However, prior to attempting another drain, all first-upgrader directors must be re-booted if any of them were booted-up prior to the most recent drain attempt.

details.customerDescription: ndu drain failure
details.internalDescription: "ndu drain" has failed to complete successfully on one or more last-upgrader directors. "ndu drain" may be retried if desired. Prior to retrying "ndu drain" a reboot of all first-upgrader directors is necessary if any of the first-upgrader directors were booted-up prior to the most recent "ndu drain".
details.formatString: ndu drain failure

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is required.

details.customerDescription: ndu kill success
details.internalDescription: "ndu kill" has completed successfully on this director.
details.formatString: ndu kill success

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: No user action is required.

details.customerDescription: ndu cancel success
details.internalDescription: "ndu cancel" has completed successfully on this director.
details.formatString: ndu cancel success

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A call to env_read returned something other than the expected value.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Shut down the director as quickly as possible, and keep it down until the upgrade sequence succeeds or fails. Report this issue to EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: unsuccessful read of data
details.internalDescription: The upgrade data that the firmware read from non-volatile memory is invalid.
details.formatString: unsuccessful read of data

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A call to env_read returned something other than the expected value.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Shut down the director as quickly as possible, and keep it down until the upgrade sequence succeeds or fails. Report this issue to EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: unsuccessful read of data version
details.internalDescription: The upgrade data-version that the firmware read from non-volatile memory is invalid.
details.formatString: unsuccessful read of data version

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The read-in data-version is not supported.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Shut down the director as quickly as possible, and keep it down until the upgrade sequence succeeds or fails. Report this issue to EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: data version not supported
details.internalDescription: The upgrade data-version that the firmware read from non-volatile memory is valid but not supported.
details.formatString: data version not supported

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The read-in upgrade data-version is supported but the read-in upgrade data specifies a data-version that is different.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Shut down the director as quickly as possible, and keep it down until the upgrade sequence succeeds or fails. Report this issue to EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: data version mismatch detected
details.internalDescription: The upgrade data read-in from non-volatile memory was read-in successfully but its contents appear to be inconsistent.
details.formatString: data version mismatch detected

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A call to env_write returned something other than the expected value.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Shut down the director as quickly as possible, and keep it down until the upgrade sequence succeeds or fails. Report this issue to EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: unsuccessful write of data
details.internalDescription: The firmware was unable to write upgrade data to non-volatile memory. Non-volatile memory may now contain invalid upgrade data.
details.formatString: unsuccessful write of data

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A call to env_write returned something other than the expected value.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Shut down the director as quickly as possible, and keep it down until the upgrade sequence succeeds or fails. Report this issue to EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: unsuccessful write of data version
details.internalDescription: The firmware was unable to write upgrade data-version to non-volatile memory. Non-volatile memory may now contain an invalid upgrade data-version.
details.formatString: unsuccessful write of data version

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A director detects that its current firmware-version is the same as the one that it was running at the beginning of the upgrade by way of comparing the current firmware-version number against the one that is stored in flash data. If there is no version number in flash data then the director relies on the CMG state-send mechanism, whereby the director knows that it is running the old version of firmware if it is a first upgrader and it is able to communicate with last upgrader directors.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: If one or more directors did not automatically abort the upgrade then report this issue to EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: firmware version inconsistency detected
details.internalDescription: A first-upgrader director booted up and detected that its current firmware version is the same as the one that it was running at the beginning of the upgrade. All directors that are able to communicate with the booting director will automatically abort the upgrade.
details.formatString: firmware version inconsistency detected

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This is a generic 'pass-through' message. When sms sees any xmmg message it will check the xmmg's severity level and if it is ERR or above sms will pass on the message intact so an sms user will see it. Alerts can not be generated on these events.

details.customerDescription: %s
details.internalDescription: This event was generated from the monitoring subsystem.
details.formatString: %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This is a notification of an IB chip detecting an error.

details.customerDescription: Ignoring information unit that is too big
details.internalDescription: An SRP initiator has sent an information unit that is bigger than the value that was negotiated during login.
details.formatString: Ignoring information unit that is too big

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: We validate incoming SRP_RSP tags to ensure they look sane before trusting them. If they don't look good, we emit this event and drop the response. Dropping CMD and TMF responses can lead to aborts and/or connection teardown.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Report problem to target vendor.

details.customerDescription: Malformed SRP_RSP tag 0x%16llx received from target port with remote port identifier 0x%016llx%016llx" -- discarding response
details.internalDescription: An SRP target port has sent an SRP_RSP information unit that contains an invalid 'tag'.
details.formatString: Malformed SRP_RSP tag 0x%16llx received from target port with remote port identifier 0x%016llx%016llx" -- discarding response

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An asynchronous job was created with the provided ID.

details.customerDescription: Async job %llu created.
details.formatString: Async job %llu created.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The specified asynchronous job has finished but its record will not be auto-deleted. (The record can be deleted with an explicit "ajob kill" command).

details.customerDescription: Async job %llu finished, not auto-deleting record.
details.formatString: Async job %llu finished, not auto-deleting record.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The specified asynchronous job has finished. Its record will be deleted on the specified date and time.

details.customerDescription: Async job %llu finished, deleting record on [yyyy:mm:dd:hh:mm:ss].
details.formatString: Async job %llu finished, deleting record on [yyyy:mm:dd:hh:mm:ss].

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The specified asynchronous job was killed.

details.customerDescription: Async job %llu killed.
details.formatString: Async job %llu killed.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The specified asynchronous job is being deleted. It will no longer show up in the "ajob show" results.

details.customerDescription: Deleting async job %llu.
details.formatString: Deleting async job %llu.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This is a generic error message describing a low level problem encountered by the tower snmp agent subsystem.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The tower will not offer access to SNMP agent services until after the next reboot.

details.customerDescription: %s
details.internalDescription: This event was generated from the tower snmp agent subsystem.
details.formatString: %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The ZPEM process has started. All hardware in the engine will be monitored and any anomalies will be reported.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The power and environment monitoring process has started.

details.customerDescription: The power and environment monitoring process has started. All hardware in the engine will now be monitored.
details.internalDescription: The power and environment monitoring process has started.
details.formatString: The power and environment monitoring process has started.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An attempt to start the power and environment monitoring process has failed.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The power and environment monitoring process has failed to start.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The appropriate logs need to be examined to determine the reason of failure. The process gets restarted automatically within a few seconds. If not contact the EMC Technical support.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The process should restart automatically. If the problem persists, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: The power and environment monitoring process failed to start.
details.internalDescription: The power and environment monitoring process failed to start. Any hardware failures in the engine cannot be reported.
details.formatString: The power and environment monitoring process failed to start. Status 0x%x.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The power and environment monitoring process is not running.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The power and environment process monitoring is not running.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The process restarts automatically within a few seconds. If not contact EMC Technical Support.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The process should restart automatically. If the problem persists, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: The power and environment monitoring process is not running.
details.internalDescription: The power and environment monitoring process is not running.
details.formatString: The power and environment monitoring process is halting with status 0x%x.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: ZNS service has now started. This means all registered clients will be able to get notifications on any changes in the hardware environment.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The event notification service has started. This is an internal event.

details.customerDescription: The event notification service has started. This is an internal event.
details.internalDescription: The event notification service has started. Any changes to the hardware will now be notified to all clients.
details.formatString: The notification service started.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The notification service failed to start. This means that hardware information may no longer be available to its registered clients.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A component of the power and environment monitoring has failed to start.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The process will restart automatically within a few seconds. If not contact EMC Technical Support.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The process should restart automatically. If the problem persists, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: A component of the power and environment monitoring has failed to start.
details.internalDescription: The notification service failed to start. All registered clients may not get the power and environment monitoring data.
details.formatString: The notification service failed to start. Status 0x%x.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The notification service has halted due an unexpected software error.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The notification service has halted. This means that the monitoring information maybe not be displayed until the problem is rectified.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The process should restart automatically after a few seconds. If not contact EMC Technical Support for resolution.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The process should restart automatically. If the problem persists, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: The notification service has halted. The power and environment information may no longer be available to the user.
details.internalDescription: The notification service has halted due to an unexpected software error.
details.formatString: The notification service is halting with status 0x%x.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The monitoring thread has started. All the associated hardware will be polled at fixed intervals.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The monitoring thread has started. The associated hardware will be monitored at fixed intervals. Any change in the hardware state will generate a notification.

details.customerDescription: The monitoring thread has started.
details.internalDescription: The monitoring thread has started.
details.formatString: The monitoring thread has now started.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The monitoring thread has failed to start. The hardware may not be monitored until the problem is corrected.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A component of the power and environment monitoring process has failed.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Please look into the debug logs under /tmp director of the corresponding director. Contact EMC Technical Support for resolution.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: The monitoring thread has failed to start due to a software error
details.internalDescription: The monitoring thread failed to start. This could be due a failure to create a new pthread.
details.formatString: The monitoring thread failed to start 0x%x.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The vpd information could not be obtained from the hardware component. This could be due to an error reading the resume PROM.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The Vital Product Data of the hardware component could not be obtained.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check to see if the hardware has been inserted properly in the slot. Validate the hardware, if the problem persists, replace the hardware.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check to see if the correct FRU is inserted. If this doesn't resolve the problem, contact EMC technical support.

details.customerDescription: Failed to get the Vital Product Data. This data identifies a hardware based on the vendor name, slot etc
details.internalDescription: Failed to get the Vital Product Data from the resume PROM of the device.
details.formatString: Failed to get Vital Product Data from Resume PROM for %s: Status = 0x%x.

details.customerDescription: This specifies the operational state of the specified management module.
details.internalDescription: This specifies the operational state of the specified management module.
details.formatString: %s: PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : The operating state of the management module is %s.

details.customerDescription: The marker LED on the management module has been set at the request of the user.
details.internalDescription: The marker LED on the management module has been set at the request of the user.
details.formatString: %s: PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : Marker LED has been set to %s.

details.arguments: ObjectName PartNo SerialNo RevNo ModuleNum LedValue
details.customerDescription: The marker LED on the FC I/O Module has been set at the request of the user.
details.internalDescription: The marker LED on the FC I/O Module has been set at the request of the user.
details.formatString: %s: PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : Marker LED for the FC I/O Module %d has been set to %s.

details.arguments: ObjectName PartNo SerialNo RevNo PortNo PortLinkStatus
details.customerDescription: Reporting the link status of the specified port.
details.internalDescription: Reporting the link status of the specified port.
details.formatString: %s: PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : The link status of Port %d is %s.

details.arguments: ObjectName PartNo SerialNo RevNo PortNo AutoNeg
details.customerDescription: Reporting the auto negotiate settings of the specified port.
details.internalDescription: Reporting the auto negotiate settings of the specified port.
details.formatString: %s: PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : The auto negotiate setting for Port %d is %s.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the cabling. Check if the FRU is inserted correctly. If the problem persists, contact EMC technical support.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The temperature of the FC I/O Module has exceeded the specified temperature threshold.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the environmental conditions of the server room. If the condition persists, contact EMC Technical support.

details.customerDescription: The temperature sensor reading on the FC I/O Module has exceeded the warning limits.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The voltage of the FC I/O Module has exceeded the threshold due to some environmental conditions.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the power supply to the engine. If the FC I/O Module doesn't recover from this condition, contact EMC Technical support.

details.customerDescription: The voltage sensor readings on the FC I/O Module have exceeded the warning limits.

details.customerDescription: The input air temperature of the power supply is nearing threshold limits.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the environmental conditions of the server room. If the condition still persists, contact EMC Technical support.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The speed of the fan is approaching the threshold limits.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The speed of the fan is approaching threshold limits.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The speed of the fan has recovered from an error condition and is now functioning normally.

details.internalDescription: Reporting the operational time available on the standby power supplies.

details.customerDescription: The battery testing interval on the SPS has been changed.
details.internalDescription: The battery testing interval on the SPS has been changed.
details.formatString: %s: SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : Battery testing time interval has been changed to %d.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The charge levels on the battery of the SPS is approaching the error threshold levels. This maybe due to insufficient charging or faulty cabling to the SPS.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The charge levels on the battery of the SPS is approaching the error threshold levels.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The battery of the SPS needs to be recharged immediately. Periodic battery tests have to be conducted to determine if there are sufficient charge levels.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The battery needs of the SPS to be recharged immediately. If the conditions still persists, contact EMC Technical support.

details.customerDescription: The operational time available on the SPS is nearing the error threshold levels. On AC power failure, the system may shut down.
