details.formatString: %s: SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : The operational time available is approaching the warning threshold levels. Current value : %d mins.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The operational time available on the SPS has dropped below the threshold values. This could be due to insufficient battery charging or faulty cabling.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The operational time available on the SPS has dropped below the threshold value.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the cabling and the source power to the SPS. If the problem persists, the SPS needs to be replaced.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: The operational time available of the SPS has dropped below the threshold values. If there is a failure of the AC power supply, the SPS may not provide power. This could lead to a system shutdown.
details.internalDescription: The operational time available of the SPS has dropped below the threshold limits.
details.formatString: %s: SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : The operational time available has dropped the warning threshold levels. Current value :%d mins.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The operational time available on the SPS was very low. The SPS is now sufficiently charged.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The battery time on the SPS is now above the error threshold value.

details.customerDescription: The operational time available on SPS has recovered from an error condition.
details.internalDescription: The operational time available on SPS has now recovered from an error condition.
details.formatString: %s: SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : The operational time available has recovered from error threshold.
%s : SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : The battery tests have started.
%s: SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : The battery tests have been completed. Status :%s.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The battery tests on the SPS failed to complete.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The battery tests on the SPS failed to complete.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Verify the next scheduled battery test. If these tests do not show successful completion, the SPS needs to be replaced.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Verify the next scheduled battery test. If these tests do not show successful completion, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: The battery tests on the SPS failed to complete. The operational time available of the SPS is currently unknown.
details.internalDescription: The battery tests on the SPS failed to complete. This means the power processing capabilities of the SPS is unknown.
details.formatString: %s: SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : The battery tests failed to complete. Status : %s.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A communication failure has been reported while attempting to contact the SPS. This could be due to a failed cable, failed SPS or failed Management Module serial port. It may also be due to an internal configuration problem.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A communication failure has been reported while attempting to contact the SPS. This could be a hardware problem.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Consult the failure detail string in the event log message. If the error is not timeout, then there is an internal director configuration problem. If the error is timeout, then there is a communication failure. If the SPS status display indicates the SPS is operating, then check the cabling between the SPS and the Management Module associated with director. If the problem persists, the faulty component must be identified and replaced immediately.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: If the SPS status display indicates the SPS is operating, the check the cabling between the SPS and the Management Module associated with director. If the problem persists, contact EMC Technical support.

details.customerDescription: The director is unable to communicate with its SPS.
details.internalDescription: The director is unable to communicate with its SPS. This might affect the ability of the director to continue operation in the event of a power failure.
details.formatString: %s: SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : Unable to communicate with SPS%s

details.customerDescription: The operational state of the SPS has changed.
details.internalDescription: The operational state of the SPS has changed.
details.formatString: %s: SerialNo:%s /RevNo:%s : The operational state of the SPS has changed to %s

details.customerDescription: The SPS is on AC and the battery is fully charged.
details.internalDescription: The SPS is on AC and the battery is fully charged.
details.formatString: %s: SerialNo:%s /RevNo:%s : The SPS is on AC and the battery is fully charged.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The SPS is on AC power and the battery is still charging.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The SPS is on AC power and the battery is still charging.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the cabling to the AC source. Also verify that the AC power to the rack is in good state. If continued on AC power, verify that the battery gets fully charged.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the cabling to the AC source. Also verify that the AC power to the rack is in good state. If continued on AC power, verify that the battery gets fully charged. If the problem persists, contact EMC Technical support.

details.customerDescription: The SPS is on AC power and the battery is charging.
details.internalDescription: The SPS is on AC power and the battery is charging.
details.formatString: %s: SerialNo:%s /RevNo:%s : The SPS is on AC power and the battery is charging.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The SPS is on DC power and the battery is discharging.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The SPS is on DC power and the battery is discharging.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the cabling to the AC source. Also verify that the AC power to the rack is in good state. If continued on DC power, the battery will fully discharge. Restore the AC power to the SPS as soon as possible.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the cabling to the AC source. Also verify that the AC power to the rack is in good state. Restore the AC power to the SPS as soon as possible. If the problem persists, contact EMC Technical support.

details.customerDescription: The SPS is on DC power and the battery is discharging.
details.internalDescription: The SPS is on DC power and the battery is discharging.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The SPS is in a faulted state. This could be due to an internal SPS problem, faulty cabling or a faulty AC power. The message contains text describing the fault.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The SPS is in a faulted state.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The cabling of the SPS needs to be checked. Also check the AC power to the SPS. If there is an internal fault or if the problem cannot be identified, the SPS needs to be replaced.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the cabling and the AC power source to the SPS. If the problem persists, contact EMC Technical support.

details.customerDescription: An SPS operational state has changed to faulted.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The SPS specified is not present in the engine.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The SPS has to be inserted into the correct slot as soon as possible. If it is already present, re-seat the SPS or check the serial cable connection to the management module. If problem persists, contact EMC technical support.

details.customerDescription: The SPS is not present in the specified slot.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Both of the SPS are in a faulted state. This is likely due to some faulty cabling or an issue with the AC power.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Both of the SPS are in a faulted state. This is likely due to some faulty cabling or an issue with the AC power.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the cabling and the AC power source to both of the SPS. If the problem persists, replace both of the SPS immediately.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the cabling and the AC power source to both of the SPS. If the problem persists, contact EMC Technical support.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The temperature of the enclosure has exceeded the threshold levels and the director is shutting down.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The temperature of the enclosure has exceeded the threshold and a result of which the director is shutting down.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the ambient temperature of the server room. Verify if the fans are working sufficiently to provide effective cooling.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the ambient temperature of the server room. If the problem still persists contact EMC Technical support.

details.customerDescription: Temperature threshold exceeded; director shutdown in progress.
details.internalDescription: The temperature of the director has reached the threshold levels.
details.formatString: %s: PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : The temperature of the Director has exceeded the warning threshold level.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The temperature of the director has exceeded the threshold values. This could be due to environmental conditions.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The temperature of the director has exceeded the error threshold values.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the ambient temperature of the server room. If the conditions persists, the director needs to be replaced.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the conditions of the server room. If the condition persists, contact EMC Technical support.

details.customerDescription: A temperature sensor on the director is reporting values beyond the error range. The director will shutdown to prevent over heating.
details.internalDescription: A temperature sensor on the director is reporting values which are beyond the error range. The director will shutdown to prevent over heating.
details.formatString: %s: PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : The Director is now shutting down as the temperature has exceeded the threshold levels.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The voltage threshold of the director is approaching the error level. This could be due to a problem with the power supply.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The voltage threshold of the director is approaching the error level. This could be due to some environmental conditions.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the source of the power supply. If the problem still persists, the director needs to be replaced.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: A sensor on the director has detected that the voltage levels are approaching the error threshold values.
details.internalDescription: The voltage values of the director are approaching the error levels. If the voltage exceeds the error threshold, the director may shutdown.
details.formatString: %s: PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : The voltage level of the director is approaching the warning threshold levels.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The director fault code represents the last hardware operation or a hardware fault. The fault is indicated in the fault code string.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The director fault code represents the last hardware operation or a hardware fault. The fault is indicated in the fault code string.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the fault code string and perform the necessary remedy.

details.customerDescription: A director fault code has changed.
details.internalDescription: The fault code for the director has changed because of user action or fault in the hardware.
details.formatString: %s: PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : The fault code on the director has changed.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The voltage on the director has exceeded threshold limits. This may be due to environmental conditions.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The voltage reading on the director has exceeded threshold limits due to some environmental conditions.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the power supply to the director. If the problem still persists, replace the director immediately.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The power supply to the director needs to be checked. If the problem still persists, contact EMC Technical support.

details.customerDescription: A director's voltage level threshold has been exceeded.
details.internalDescription: A voltage sensor on the director reported values beyond acceptable levels.
details.formatString: %s: PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : The voltage level of the director has exceeded the warning threshold levels.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The peer of director [SPIdStr] is not present. The peer director may be removed from the engine.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The peer of director [SPIDStr] is not present.The peer director may be removed from the engine.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check if the director is inserted into the engine. If not, insert into the engine.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check if the director is inserted into the engine. If not, insert into the engine. If the problem still persists, contact EMC Technical support.

details.customerDescription: The peer of director [SPIDStr] is not present.
details.internalDescription: The peer of director [SPIDStr] is not present.

%s: SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : The tests for battery charge levels are now complete.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The battery tests failed to complete on the UPS. This could be because of a faulty battery.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The battery tests to determine the operational time available failed on the UPS. This could be due to hardware fault.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The UPS must be replaced immediately.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Technical support.

details.customerDescription: The battery tests to determine the operational time available failed on the UPS.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The on battery time on the UPS is approaching error threshold levels due to inadequate charging.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The on battery time on the UPS is approaching error threshold levels due to inadequate charging.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check if the UPS has gotten unplugged or check the power cable. If not replace the UPS immediately..
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the power cabling. If the problem persists, contact EMC Technical support.

details.customerDescription: The operational time available reading on the UPS is approaching error threshold levels.
details.internalDescription: The operational time available on the UPS is approaching error threshold levels.
details.formatString: %s: SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : The operational time available is approaching the warning threshold levels. Current value : %d mins.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The operational time available on the UPS has exceeded error threshold levels due to inadequate charging.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The operational time available on the UPS has exceeded error threshold levels due to inadequate charging.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check if the UPS is unplugged or if the power cable is loose. If not, replace the UPS immediately.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check if the UPS is unplugged. Also check the power cable. Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: The operational time available on the UPS has exceeded error threshold levels.
details.internalDescription: The operational time available on the UPS has exceeded error threshold levels.
details.formatString: %s: SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : The operational time available has dropped below the warning threshold levels. Current value : %d mins.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The operational time available on the UPS was very low. It has recovered from that condition.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The operational time available on the UPS was very low. It has recovered from that condition.

details.customerDescription: The operational time available on the UPS was very low. It has now recovered from that condition.
details.internalDescription: The operational time available on the UPS was very low. It has now recovered from that condition.
details.formatString: %s: SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : The operational time available is now greater than the error threshold. Current value :%d mins.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A communication failure has been reported while attempting to contact the UPS. This could be due to a failed cable, failed UPS or failed Management Module serial port. It may also be due to an internal configuration problem.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A communication failure has been reported while attempting to contact the UPS. This could be a hardware problem.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Consult the failure detail string in the event log message. If the error is not timeout, then there is an internal director configuration problem. If the error is timeout, then there is a communication failure. If the UPS status display indicates the UPS is operating, then check the cabling between the UPS and the Management Module associated with director. If the problem persists, the faulty component must be identified and replaced immediately.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: If the UPS status display indicates the UPS is operating, then check the cabling between the UPS and the Management Module associated with director. If the problem persists, contact EMC Technical support.

details.customerDescription: The director is unable to communicate with its associated UPS.
details.internalDescription: The director is unable to communicate with its associated UPS.
details.formatString: %s: SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : The director cannot communicate with its UPS%s
%s: SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : UPS has been discovered.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The state of the I/O Annex is faulted

details.customerDescription: The UPS is on AC and the battery is fully charged.
details.internalDescription: The UPS is on AC and the battery is fully charged.
details.formatString: %s: SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : The UPS is on AC and the battery is fully charged.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The UPS is on AC power and the battery is still charging.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The UPS is on AC power and the battery is still charging.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the cabling to the AC source. Also verify that the AC power to the rack is in good state. If continued on AC power, verify that the battery gets fully charged.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the cabling to the AC source. Also verify that the AC power to the rack is in good state. If continued on AC power, verify that the battery gets fully charged. If the problem persists, contact EMC Technical support.

details.customerDescription: The UPS is on AC power and the battery is charging.
details.internalDescription: The UPS is on AC power and the battery is charging.
details.formatString: %s: SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : The UPS is on AC power and the battery is charging.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The UPS is on DC power and the battery is discharging.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The UPS is on DC power and the battery is discharging.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the cabling to the AC source. Also verify that the AC power to the rack is in good state. If continued on DC power, the battery will fully discharge. Restore the AC power to the UPS as soon as possible.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the cabling to the AC source. Also verify that the AC power to the rack is in good state. If continued on DC power, the battery will fully discharge. Restore the AC power to the UPS as soon as possible. If the problem persists, contact EMC Technical support.

details.customerDescription: The UPS is on DC power and the battery is discharging.
details.internalDescription: The UPS is on DC power and the battery is discharging.
details.formatString: %s: SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : The UPS is on DC power and the battery is discharging.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The UPS is in a faulted state. This could be due to an internal UPS problem, faulty cabling, or a faulty AC power. The message contains text describing the fault.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The UPS is in a faulted state.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The cabling of the UPS needs to be checked. Also check the AC power to the UPS. If there is an internal fault or if the problem cannot be identified, the UPS needs to be replaced.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the cabling and the AC power source to the UPS. If the problem persists, contact EMC Technical support.

details.customerDescription: A UPS' operation state has changed to faulted.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The UPS specified is no longer present.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The UPS specified is no longer present.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The UPS has been disconnected. If it is already present, check the connections to the UPS.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The UPS has been disconnected. If it is already present, check the connections to the UPS. Contact EMC technical support.

details.internalDescription: The UPS specified is no longer present.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: This could be due to faulty serial port on management module, faulty serial cable between the management module and the UPS, faulty UPS or missing UPS in the cluster.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: This could be due to faulty serial port on management module, faulty serial cable between the management module and the UPS, faulty UPS or missing UPS in the cluster.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Please check if the required number of UPS as per the configuration(small,medium,large; none for small and two UPS for medium or large) are present in the cluster. Check if the UPS is powered on and in working condition. Check the serial port and the cabling between the management module and the UPS.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC technical support.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Both of the UPS are in a faulted state. This is likely due to some faulty cabling or an issue with the AC power.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the cabling and the AC power source to both of the UPS. If the problem persists, replace both of the UPS immediately.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the cabling and the AC power source to both of the UPS. If the problem persists, contact EMC Technical support.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The fan in the specified slot is not present.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The other three fans if operational are sufficient to cool the enclosure until the fan is inserted. However the fan module should be inserted immediately. The fan should be reseated if it is present in the slot.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check if the fan is seated correctly. If the problem still persists, contact EMC Technical support.

details.customerDescription: The engine cannot detect the fan in the specified slot.
details.internalDescription: The engine cannot detect the fan in the specified slot.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Two fans in the specified slots are not present at this time.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The other two fans if operational are not sufficient to cool the enclosure until the fans are inserted. The power supply should shut down the system in 3 minutes. The system will not bootup if 2 fans are non-operational. At least one fan module should be inserted immediately. The two fans should be reseated if already present in the slots.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check if the two fans are seated correctly. The power supply should shut down the system in 3 minutes. The system will not bootup if 2 fans are non-operational. If the problem still persists, contact EMC Technical support.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Fans in the specified slots are in faulted state.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The remaining fans, if operational, are not sufficient to cool the engine until the fans are inserted. The power supply will shut down the engine in 3 minutes. The engine will not bootup if multiple fans are non-operational. One or more fan modules should be replaced immediately. The fans should be reseated if already present in the slots.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check if the fans in the specified slots are seated correctly. The power supply will shut down the engine in 3 minutes. The engine will not bootup if 2 fans are non-operational. If the problem still persists, contact EMC Technical support.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The VPN tunnel between this management server and the remote management server is down.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Management of remote and distributed resources is no longer possible.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the ipsec Connection with the cli command "vpn status" to check its state. If the ipsec connection is down, restart it with "ipsec start" command from a terminal command line. If problems still occur, ensure the remote site's management server can be reached.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Call EMC Technical Support.

Copy the certificate to the other management server. On both management servers, run 'security create-host-certificate' and then run the command to 'security import-host-certificate'. Now do an ipsec start
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Call EMC Technical Support.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A partition on the Management Server has exceeded a critical capacity threshold. Corrective action must be taken or valuable logging information may be lost and the Management Server may become unstable.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A partition on your Management Server has exceeded a critical capacity threshold.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: 1. You will need to back up critical data. Run "sudo /tmp/VPlexInstallPackages/VPlex-MS-install --pre-reimage -v -l /var/log/install.log. Move this file to a destination off of the Management Server and delete the local copy. 2. You will need to collect any diagnostic data. Run "collect-diagnostics". Move this file to a destination off of the Management Server and delete the local copy. 3. Find the largest files in the partition by running du -s [partition]> | sort -n. Remove the largest files until the available space is less. This can be confirmed with du -sh [partition].
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: 1. You will need to back up critical data. Run "sudo /tmp/VPlexInstallPackages/VPlex-MS-install --pre-reimage -v -l /var/log/install.log. Move this file to a destination off of the Management Server and delete the local copy. 2. You will need to collect any diagnostic data. Run "collect-diagnostics". Move this file to a destination off of the Management Server and delete the local copy. 3. Find the largest files in the partition by running du -s [partition]> | sort -n. Remove the largest files until the available space is less. This can be confirmed with du -sh [partition].

Move this file to a destination off of the Management Server and delete the local copy. 2. You will need to collect any diagnostic data. Run "collect-diagnostics". Move this file to a destination off of the Management Server and delete the local copy. 3. Find the largest files in the partition by running du -s [partition]> | sort -n. Remove the largest files until the available space is less. This can be confirmed with du -sh [partition].
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: 1. You will need to back up critical data. Run "sudo /tmp/VPlexInstallPackages/VPlex-MS-install --pre-reimage -v -l /var/log/install.log. Move this file to a destination off of the Management Server and delete the local copy. 2. You will need to collect any diagnostic data. Run "collect-diagnostics". Move this file to a destination off of the Management Server and delete the local copy. 3. Find the largest files in the partition by running du -s [partition]> | sort -n. Remove the largest files until the available space is less. This can be confirmed with du -sh [partition].

details.customerDescription: A partition on the Management Server has reached a high capacity.
details.internalDescription: A partition on the Management Server has reached a high capacity.
details.formatString: The following partitions on the management server exceed the %s limit of %d percent: %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A hidden command which should not be used under normal conditions has been executed.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A hidden command which should not be used under normal conditions has been executed.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Advise customer not to use the commands which are not exposed and should not be used under normal conditions.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Please contact EMC Technical Support for further inputs.

details.customerDescription: A hidden command which should not be used under normal conditions has been executed.
details.internalDescription: Customer has executed a hidden command, advise customer not to use commands which are not exposed and should not be used under normal conditions.
details.formatString: Hidden command '%s' has been executed.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Either the Cluster Witness Server or the two clusters might have lost connectivity with the Management Server during the execution of enable/disable command. Other potential causes could be failure of the Cluster Witness Server or either of the clusters.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: VPLEX CLI command to administratively enable (or disable) Cluster Witness functionality failed due to lack of connectivity during its execution.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Ensure that the management connectivity between all Cluster Witness components is properly established and the Cluster Witness Server and both clusters are operational and re-issue the command again. The system may be at risk of DU/DL if connectivity issues persist for one of the components and the Cluster Witness admin state is inconsistent. To reduce the risk of DU/DL, refer to the troubleshooting procedure for using disable-cluster-witness-on-cluster and disable-cluster-witness-server VPlexadmin commands to disable Cluster Witness functionality on the cluster and server respectively.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Ensure that Cluster Witness Server and both clusters are operational. Validate VPN management connectivity. Rectify any observed connectivity issues and re-issue the command to ensure that all Cluster Witness components have the same admin-state.

details.arguments: component returncode statuscode componentname1 adminstate1 componentname2 adminstate2 componentname3 adminstate3
details.customerDescription: The VPLEX CLI command to enable (or disable) Cluster Witness functionality has failed due to lack of connectivity.
details.internalDescription: VPLEX CLI command to enable (or disable) Cluster Witness functionality has failed on one of the components due to which the overall-admin-state of Cluster Witness might be inconsistent or unknown. It is very crucial to get the admin-state of each Cluster Witness Component into either enabled or disabled state.
details.formatString: Enable/Disable of Cluster Witness failed on %s with Returncode %s and Statuscode %s. %s admin-state is %s, %s admin-state is %s, %s admin-state is %s.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The director failed to allocate memory to create a new Fibre Channel port
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The system is running out of memory.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Need to analyze why the system is running out of memory, upgrading to a newer release might be necessary.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The system is running out of memory. Please contact EMC customer support.

details.customerDescription: No memory to start a Fibre Channel port.
details.internalDescription: The system is running out of memory, which had prevented a Fibre Channel port being initialized.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Failed to map PCI memory base address for a Fibre Channel device.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The system has PCI configuration issue.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Take following steps until the issue was solved: 1. remove and insert the kernel module zmod; 2. reboot the director; 3. upgrade the BIOS and extended post firmware; 4. install a newer release.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The PCI device is not usable. Please contact EMC customer support.

details.customerDescription: Failed to map PCI memory for a Fibre Channel port.

details.formatString: tach%d (%s): could not get MMIO mapping for MMIO bar

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An internal error caused a Fibre Channel port being attached more than once.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A Fibre Channel port might not function right.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Disable the port, wait until it is disabled, then enable it to work around the issue; This system might need to be upgraded to a newer release.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Disable and enable the corresponding port. Please contact EMC customer support.

details.customerDescription: Duplicate initialization of a Fibre Channel port.
details.internalDescription: A software error caused the Fibre Channel port (id [iid] port name [portname]) being initialized more than once.
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): Already attached.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A software error caused a Fibre Channel port not being able to initialize: the configured minimum virtual port is not reached while trying to start the port.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The system has software configuration issue.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: This system needs a newer software release.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Port configuration error, contact EMC support.

details.customerDescription: Wrong parameter to initialize a Fibre Channel port.
details.internalDescription: A software error caused the Fibre Channel port (id [iid] port name [portname]) not being initialized: configured [conf_num] virtual port(s) and require minimum [min_num] virtual port(s).
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): not enough port(s) %u of %u yet.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A system or configuration error caused a Fibre Channel port not being able to initialize: the port was configured to use MSI but the system didn't configure the PCI device in the same way.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The system has MSI configuration issue.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Take following steps until the issue was solved: 1. remove the flash environment variable "tachconfig" and restart the firmware; 2. reboot the director; 3. upgrade the director BIOS and extended post firmware. 4. Install a newer software release.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC customer support.

details.customerDescription: Wrong MSI config for a Fibre Channel port.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: IO failed due to exchanges timed out. There might be faulty hardware on the IO path.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: IO failed due to exchanges timed out. There might be faulty hardware on the IO path.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check for faulty hardwares with following steps: 1. identify the IO path specified by the event; 2. Clean and re-seat the cables on the path; 3. If applicable, check switch stats to see if any switch is over-subscribed, if so, try to re-route some IO; 4. Replace SFPs on the IO path; 5. Check the target storage device see if it is over-subscribed, if so, add more target ports to serve IO.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact the EMC customer support in any step need help: Check for faulty hardwares with following steps: 1. identify the IO path specified by the event; 2. Clean and re-seat the cables on the path; 3. If applicable, check switch stats to see if any switch is over-subscribed, if so, try to re-route some IO; 4. Replace SFPs on the IO path; 5. Check the target storage device see if it is over-subscribed, if so, add more target ports to serve IO.

details.arguments: iid portname percent I T nportid
details.customerDescription: IO exchange timeout threshold exceeded.
details.internalDescription: Fibre Channel port (id [iid] port name [portname]) observed high IO timeout failure ([percent] percent) on the IO path from initiator [I]to target [T] (nport id [nportid]). Common cause is faulty hardware (dirty cable, faulty SFP, etc).
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): In the past minute, %f percent IO failed on I 0x%"FS64x" T 0x%"FS64x" (nportid 0x%06x) due to IO timeout, there might be faulty hardware in the IO path.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Some amount of IO failure on a login due to dropped frames.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Some amount of IO failure on a login due to dropped frames.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the target storage device specified by the event, try to add more target ports to serve IO. This is usually caused by the target device port cannot handle the amount of IO generated by the initiator ports. Or an over-subscribed switch in the IO path could also cause the symptom. Check switch log for any sign of over-subscription.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the target storage device specified by the event, try to add more target ports to serve IO. Contact EMC customer support for more information.

details.arguments: iid portname percent I T nportid
details.customerDescription: IO frame drop threshold exceeded.
details.internalDescription: Fibre Channel port (id [iid] port name [portname]) observed high IO failure rate ([percent] percent) due to dropped frames on the IO path from initiator [I] to target [T] (nport id [nportid]). Common cause is that the target device is not designed to handle the IO load we are generating, adding more target port to spread IO across could help. Also check the switch, make sure they has enough switching capacity.
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): In the past minute, %f percent IO failed on I 0x%"FS64x" T 0x%"FS64x" (nportid 0x%06x) due to lost frame error, the target might not function well.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Some amount of IO failure on a login due to frames timed out. There might be faulty hardware close to the backend port.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Some amount of IO failed because frames timed out.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Take following steps (take in order until the issue is solved): 1. Identify the physical port specified in the event, follow the cable and find the switch port it connected to (or target device); 2. Clean and re-seat the cable; 3. Replace the SFP on both ends; 4. try to use a different switch port if available; 5. Contact EMC for FRU to replace the IO SLIC.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC customer support.

details.arguments: iid portname percent I T nportid
details.customerDescription: IO failed due to frames timed out, the amount exceeds the threshold.
details.internalDescription: Fibre Channel port (id [iid] port name [portname]) observed high IO failure rate ([percent] percent) due to frames timed out on the IO path from initiator [I] to target [T] (nport id [nportid]). Common cause is that a faulty SFP or dirty cable on this Fibre Channel port or the switch port connecting to this Fibre Channel port.
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): In the past minute, %f percent IO failed on I 0x%"FS64x" T 0x%"FS64x" (nportid 0x%06x) due to frame timed out, there might be faulty hardware close to the local port.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Fibre Channel driver received an FCP frame with invalid task attribute.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Fibre Channel driver received an FCP frame with invalid task attribute.

details.customerDescription: Received FCP frame with wrong format.
details.internalDescription: Fibre Channel port (id [iid] port name [portname]) received an FCP frame with invalid task attribute ([attribute]). We observed this behavior with some QLogic HBAs at pre-booting phase: When the host equipped with these QLogic HBAs was stopped at early boot sequence to get into the HBA firmware configuration menu (similar to get into the host BIOS menu), and issue device scan from the HBA firmware configuration menu, the FCP frame generated by the HBA would contain uninitialized task attribute field. These task would be treated as SIMPLE task, no action is required.
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): unknown task attribute 0x%02x

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Fibre Channel port is connected to a switch, and the switch hasn't put the port in any zone yet.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Fibre Channel port is connected to a switch, and the switch hasn't put the port in any zone yet.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The port specified by the event was connected to a switch, however, there was indication that this port is not placed in any software zone. Please verify: 1. if a wrong cable was attached to this port? 2. if the switch zoning is not complete or not correct? 3. some switch need to enable the zoning configuration one more time to make the just-changed zoning configuration applied.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC customer support.

details.customerDescription: A Fibre Channel port came online, but is unzoned.
details.internalDescription: Fibre Channel port (id [iid] port name [portname]) is connected to a switch and link is up. However, the Fibre Channel port is not in any configured switch zone. This might be an oversight of switch configuration, or as planned.
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): Possible unzoned port

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A Fibre Channel port is continuously toggling between linkup and linkdown. There might be faulty hardware at the port.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A Fibre Channel port is continuously toggling between linkup and linkdown. There might be faulty hardware at the port.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Take following steps (take in order until the issue is solved): 1. Identify the physical port specified in the event, follow the cable and find the switch port it connected to (or target device); 2. Clean and re-seat the cable; 3. Re-seat the SFP on both ends; 4. Replace the SFP on both ends; 5. try to use a different switch port if available; 6. Contact EMC for FRU to replace the IO SLIC.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC customer support.

details.customerDescription: Repeated transitions detected on an FC port.
details.internalDescription: Fibre Channel port(id [iid] port name [portname]) is continuously toggling between linkup and linkdown.
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): In the past %u seconds, the port has toggled (linkup/linkdown) %d times.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A Fibre Channel port that was previously toggling between linkup and linkdown has been fixed and is no longer toggling.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A Fibre Channel port that was previously toggling between linkup and linkdown has been fixed and is no longer toggling.

details.customerDescription: A Fibre Channel port that was previously toggling between linkup and linkdown has been fixed.
details.internalDescription: Fibre Channel port (id [iid] port name [portname]) is no longer toggling.
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): Port toggling for this port has been cleared.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The RX Power level on a Fibre Channel port is below the low limit. This can cause a possible DU. The port has been disabled and will be restored once the RX Power level is higher than the low limit.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The RX Power level on a Fibre Channel port is below the low limit. The port has been disabled.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Take following steps (take in order until the issue is solved): 1. Identify the physical port specified in the event, follow the cable and find the switch port it connected to (or target device); 2. Clean and re-seat the cable; 3. Re-seat the SFP on both ends; 4. Replace the SFP on both ends; 5. Contact EMC for FRU to replace the IO SLIC.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC customer support.

details.customerDescription: Disabled an FC port because the receive power is too low.
details.internalDescription: The RX Power level (rx power level [rx_power]) on Fibre Channel port(id [iid] port name [portname]) is below the low limit. This indicates either a bad SFP or bad/dirty cable.
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): RxPower Low: %d, turning OFF port.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The RX Power level on a Fibre Channel port has been restored to a good level. The port has been enabled.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The RX Power level on a Fibre Channel port has been restored to a good level. The port has been enabled.

details.customerDescription: The RX Power level on a Fibre Channel port has been restored to a good level. The port has been enabled.
details.internalDescription: The RX Power level (rx power level [rx_power]) on Fibre Channel port (id [iid] port name [portname]) is now at a good level. The port has been enabled.
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): RxPower Restored: %d, turning ON port.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The EMC part number of the SFP was not recognized. It is required to use EMC approved SPFs with the EMC products.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The EMC part number of the SFP was not recognized. It is required to use EMC approved SPFs with the EMC products.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Replace the SFP with an EMC approved SFP for the product.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC customer support.

details.customerDescription: The port is equipped with an SFP which is not approved by EMC.
details.internalDescription: The port [portname] id [iid] is equipped with an SFP which is not approved by EMC, details: [reason]
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): is equipped with an SFP which is not approved by EMC for this product: %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The port is equipped with an SFP with approved EMC part number for this product, but the vendor part number is not on the recognized list.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The port is equipped with an SFP with approved EMC part number for this product, but the vendor part number is not on the recognized list.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Make sure the vendor product number had been added to the approved list of this product. If not, replace the SFP.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC customer support.

details.customerDescription: Unrecognized vendor part no. for SFP with approved EMC part no.
details.internalDescription: The port [portname] id [iid] is equipped with an SFP with approved EMC part number for this product, but the vendor part number is not on the recognized list, details: [reason]
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): is equipped with an SFP with approved EMC part number for this product , but: %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Name Server request has timed out, port discovery has failed.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Name Server request has timed out, port discovery has failed.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Take following steps (take in order until the issue is solved): 1. Indentify the port specified in the event, disable it and re-enable it; 2. Identify the physical port specified in the event, follow the cable and find the switch port it is connected to. On the Fibre Channel switch, check the status of Name Server (this varies depending on the type of switch). If the Name Server is down, take the necessary steps to restart it (in most cases, the switch will need a reboot); 3. If the problem persists, contact EMC Technical Support.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC customer support.

details.customerDescription: The Name Server on the FC switch connected to the port is not responding.
details.internalDescription: The Name Server on the FC switch connected to the port [portname] id [iid] is not responding to requests.
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): Name Server request timed out.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An SFP is missing, inserted incorrectly, or faulty.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An SFP is missing, inserted incorrectly, or faulty.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Take following steps (take in order until the issue is solved): 1. Identify the physical port specified in the event; 2. If the SFP is missing, insert a new SFP and attach the appropriate cable; 3. Re-seat the SFP; 4. Replace the SFP; 5. Contact EMC for FRU to replace the IO SLIC.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC customer support.

details.customerDescription: An SFP is not responding to requests.
details.internalDescription: The SFP in Fibre Channel port(id [iid] port name [portname]) is not responding to requests. The SFP is either missing, inserted incorrectly, or faulty
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): SFP not detected: 0x%X

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An SFP that had previously been missing has now been detected.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An SFP that had previously been missing has now been detected.

details.customerDescription: An SFP that was previously not responding to requests has been detected and is now servicing requests.
details.internalDescription: The SFP in Fibre Channel port (id [iid] port name [portname]) is now servicing requests.
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): SFP has been detected: 0x%X

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The RX Power level on a Fibre Channel port is below the low limit. The port will be turned off if an IO timeout occurs on the port.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The RX Power level on a Fibre Channel port is below the low limit.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Take following steps (take in order until the issue is solved): 1. Identify the physical port specified in the event, follow the cable and find the switch port it connected to (or target device); 2. Clean and re-seat the cable; 3. Re-seat the SFP on both ends; 4. Replace the SFP on both ends; 5. Contact EMC for FRU to replace the IO SLIC.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC customer support.

details.customerDescription: The RX Power level on a Fibre Channel port is below the low limit.
details.internalDescription: The RX Power level (rx power level [rx_power]) on Fibre Channel port(id [iid] port name [portname]) is below the low limit. This could indicate either a bad SFP or bad/dirty cable.
details.formatString: tach%d (%s): RxPower Low: %d, port will be turned OFF if an IO timeout occurs.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The filesystem monitor failed to retrieve the status of one of the filesystems that it was monitoring.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The filesystem monitor failed to retrieve the status of one of the filesystems that it was monitoring.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The affected filesystem may need to be repaired, or the director may need to be rebooted or re-imaged. If normal operation cannot be restored, contact EMC Technical Support.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Unable to retrieve filesystem status.
details.internalDescription: Unable to retrieve filesystem status.
details.formatString: Failed to check filesystem mounted at '%s': %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A filesystem has exceeded its usage threshold and is getting low on free space.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A filesystem has exceeded its usage threshold and is getting low on free space.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The affected filesystem may need to be cleaned up and/or repaired, or the director may need to be rebooted. If normal operation cannot be restored, contact EMC Technical Support.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: A filesystem is getting full.
details.internalDescription: A filesystem is getting full.
details.formatString: The filesystem mounted at '%s' is %s full.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The temperature of the I/O Annex is nearing the error threshold. This may be due to environment conditions.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The temperate of the I/O Annex is nearing the error threshold levels due to some environmental conditions.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the ambient conditions of the server room. If the problem persists, replace the I/O Annex immediately.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the ambient temperature of the server room and power on the director. If the problem still persists contact EMC Technical support.

details.customerDescription: I/O Annex temperature is approaching the error threshold.
details.internalDescription: The temperature of the I/O Annex is approaching the error threshold limits.
details.formatString: %s : PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : I/O Annex temperature warning detected.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: One or more of the fans in the I/O Annex is running above or below its speed threshold.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: One or more of the fans in the I/O Annex is running at the wrong speed.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: While the I/O Annex can operate in this state, a fan that is outside its threshold could fail soon. The I/O Annex should be replaced.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC Technical support.

details.customerDescription: One or more fans in the I/O Annex is running at the wrong speed.
details.internalDescription: One or more of the fans in the I/O Annex is running above or below its speed threshold.
details.formatString: %s : PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : A fan is outside its speed threshold

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The I/O Annex cannot be detected over the I2C bus.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The I/O Annex cannot be detected over the hardware bus.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: There is a hardware failure involving either the director or the chassis or there is a software error in the I2C access logic. Use /var/log/ztrace.log messages to identify faulty hardware or software problem.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The director hardware detection logic is not functioning. Contact EMC technical support.

details.customerDescription: Cannot determine operational state of I/O Annex.
details.internalDescription: The director hardware detection logic is not functioning.
details.formatString: %s : PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /Rev No %s : The I/O Annex is not detected

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The I/O Annex is not present in the specified slot.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The I/O Annex is not present in the specified slot.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Insert the I/O Annex in the specified slot. If the I/O Annex is already present, it needs to be reseated.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check if the correct FRU has been inserted in the slot. If the problem persists, contact EMC technical support.

details.customerDescription: The I/O Annex is no longer detected by the engine.
details.internalDescription: The I/O Annex is no longer detected by the engine.
details.formatString: %s : PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : The I/O Annex is not present in the specified slot

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An I/O Annex fuse has faulted.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An I/O Annex fuse has faulted.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The I/O Annex must be replaced.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC technical support.

details.customerDescription: An I/O Annex fuse has faulted.
details.internalDescription: An I/O Annex fuse has faulted.
details.formatString: %s : PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : I/O Annex fuse fault detected

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A fan in the I/O Annex has faulted.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A fan in the I/O Annex has faulted.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Although the I/O Annex can operate on a single fan, the I/O Annex should be replaced.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC technical support.

details.customerDescription: A fan in the I/O Annex has faulted.
details.internalDescription: A fan in the I/O Annex has faulted.
details.formatString: %s : PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : One of the fans in the I/O Annex has faulted

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A resume PROM cannot be accessed or has failed.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The system experienced a problem accessing an internal PROM.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Although the system can normally function without the PROM information, the FRU containing the PROM should be replaced.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC technical support.

details.customerDescription: An internal PROM read or write failed.
details.internalDescription: A resume PROM read or write failed.
details.formatString: %s: resume PROM %s failed

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A resume PROM checksum doesn't match its contents.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An internal PROM has become corrupted.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Although the system can normally function without the PROM information, the FRU containing the PROM should be replaced.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC technical support.

details.customerDescription: An internal PROM has become corrupted.
details.internalDescription: A resume PROM checksum check failed.
details.formatString: %s : PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : Resume PROM checksum error

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Low level hardware, BIOS, or POST has detected an internal error.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An internal hardware error has been detected.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The message should identify the faulty hardware and the appropriate actions to take.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC technical support.

details.customerDescription: An internal hardware error has been detected.
details.internalDescription: An internal hardware error has been detected.
details.formatString: %s : PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : Hardware error - %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The state of the I2C bus is faulted. This could be due to a hardware or software error in the I2C subsystem.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The state of the I2C bus is faulted.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The location of the fault should be isolated using any other logged I2C events and the zi2cdiags and zdt tools.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC technical support.

details.customerDescription: The state of the I2C bus is faulted.
details.internalDescription: The state of the I2C bus is faulted.
details.formatString: %s: The operational state of the i2c bus has changed to %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Unable to arbitrate for the top-level I2C mux. This is probably due to a software error where communication with the zlpc.ko kernel module is compromised.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Unable to arbitrate for the top-level I2C mux.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Reload the zlpc.ko kernel module and run the zi2cdiags diagnostic tool to verify that the fault has been corrected.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC technical support.

details.customerDescription: Unable to arbitrate for the top-level I2C mux.
details.internalDescription: Unable to arbitrate for the top-level I2C mux.
details.formatString: %s : The mux arbitration process failed.\n

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Unable to arbitrate for the I2C bus. This is probably due to a software error where communication with the zlpc.ko kernel module is compromised.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Unable to arbitrate for the I2C bus.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Reload the zlpc.ko kernel module and run the zi2cdiags diagnostic tool to verify that the fault has been corrected.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC technical support.

details.customerDescription: Unable to arbitrate for the I2C bus.
details.internalDescription: Unable to arbitrate for the I2C bus.
details.formatString: %s : The bus arbitration process failed.\n

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Unable to configure the top-level I2C mux. This is probably due to a software error where communication with the zlpc.ko kernel module is compromised.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Unable to configure the top-level I2C mux.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Reload the zlpc.ko kernel module and run the zi2cdiags diagnostic tool to verify that the fault has been corrected.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC technical support.

details.customerDescription: Unable to configure the top-level I2C mux.
details.internalDescription: Unable to configure the top-level I2C mux.
details.formatString: %s : The mux configuration process failed.\n

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Configuration of the switches on the I2C bus failed. This is probably due to a hardware error preventing proper I2C communication with the switches.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Configuration of the switches on the I2C bus failed.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Along with any other logged I2C events, run the zi2cdiags tool to pinpoint the location of the fault and replace the faulty hardware.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC technical support.

details.customerDescription: Configuration of the switches on the I2C bus failed.
details.internalDescription: Configuration of the switches on the I2C bus failed.
details.formatString: %s : The switch configuration process failed.\n

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Unable to sample the SCL or SDA signals. This is probably due to a software error where communication with the zi2c.ko kernel module is compromised.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Unable to sample the SCL or SDA signals.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Reload the zlpc.ko and zi2c.ko kernel modules and run the zi2cdiags diagnostic tool to verify that any faults have been corrected.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC technical support.

details.customerDescription: The I2C bus was unable to sample the SCL or SDA signals.
details.internalDescription: The I2C bus was unable to sample the SCL or SDA signals.
details.formatString: %s : The SCL/SDA GPIOs could not be read.\n

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The SCL signal on the specified I2C bus is shorted to ground. This is a hardware error.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The SCL signal on the specified I2C bus is shorted to ground.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Pinpoint the location of the fault using any other logged I2C-related events and the zi2cdiags tool. Replace the faulted hardware.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC technical support.

details.customerDescription: The SCL signal is shorted to ground.
details.internalDescription: The SCL signal is shorted to ground.
details.formatString: %s : The SCL line is stuck low.\n

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The SDA signal on the specified I2C bus is shorted to ground. This is a hardware error.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The SDA signal on the specified I2C bus is shorted to ground.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Pinpoint the location of the fault using any other logged I2C-related events and the zi2cdiags tool. Replace the faulted hardware.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC technical support.

details.customerDescription: The SDA signal is shorted to ground.
details.internalDescription: The SDA signal is shorted to ground.
details.formatString: %s : The SDA line is stuck low.\n

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The temperature of the I/O Annex has exceeded the threshold levels and the I/O Annex is shutting down.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The temperature of the I/O Annex has exceeded the threshold and a result of which the I/O Annex is shutting down.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the ambient temperature of the server room. Verify if the fans are working sufficiently to provide effective cooling.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the ambient temperature of the server room. If the problem still persists contact EMC Technical support.

details.customerDescription: Temperature threshold exceeded; I/O Annex shutdown in progress.
details.internalDescription: The temperature of the I/O Annex has reached the threshold levels.
details.formatString: %s : PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : I/O Annex over temperature condition detected

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Both fans in the I/O Annex have faulted. The I/O Annex will shut down.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Both fans in the I/O Annex have faulted. The I/O Annex will shut down.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The reported I/O Annex must be replaced.

details.customerDescription: I/O Annex dual-fan fault; I/O Annex shutdown in progess.

details.formatString: %s : PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : "Both fans in the I/O Annex have faulted"

details.formatString: %s: PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : The system type information for the midPlane has changed : old %d/new %d.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The operating state of the specified FRU has changed. A previously reported condition has cleared.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The operating state of the specified FRU has changed. A previously reported condition has cleared.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: No action required.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: No action required.

details.internalDescription: The operating state of the specified FRU has changed.
details.formatString: %s : PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : The operational state of the specified FRU has changed to %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The specified UPS is not connected to this director.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The specified UPS is not connected to this director.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The specified UPS is not connected to this director. If the UPS is already present, check the connections to the UPS.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The specified UPS is not connected to this director. If the UPS is already present, check the connections to the UPS.

details.customerDescription: The specified UPS is not connected to this director.
details.internalDescription: The specified UPS is not connected to this director.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The specified FRU cannot be accessed.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The specified FRU cannot be accessed.

eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The director hardware detection logic is not functioning. Contact EMC technical support.

details.customerDescription: Cannot determine operational state of the specified FRU.
details.internalDescription: The director hardware detection logic is not functioning.
details.formatString: %s : PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /Rev No %s : The specified FRU cannot be accessed

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The specified FRU is not present.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The specified FRU is not present.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Insert the correct FRU in the specified slot. If the FRU is already present, it needs to be reseated.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check if the correct FRU has been inserted in the slot. If the problem persists, contact EMC technical support.

details.customerDescription: The specified FRU is no longer detected by the engine.
details.internalDescription: The specified FRU is no longer detected by the engine.
details.formatString: %s : PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : The specified FRU is not present

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The state of the specified FRU is faulted. This could be due to a hardware error.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The state of the specified FRU is faulted
