details.customerDescription: The operational state of the specified FRU is faulted.
details.internalDescription: The operational state of the specified FRU is faulted.
details.formatString: %s : PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : The operational state of the specified FRU is Faulted.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Low level hardware, BIOS, or POST has detected an internal error on one of the DIMMs.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An internal hardware error has been detected.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The message should identify the DIMM that has an error. Check if the DIMM is inserted in its slot correctly. If the problem still persists, then the FRU must be replaced immediately.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC technical support.

details.customerDescription: An internal hardware error has been detected on one of the DIMMs.
details.internalDescription: An internal hardware error has been detected on one of the DIMMs.
details.formatString: %s : PartNo %s /SerialNo %s /RevNo %s : Hardware error - %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: An error occurred accessing an NVRAM log.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: An error occurred accessing an NVRAM log.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The director may need to be replaced.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Contact EMC technical support.

details.customerDescription: An error occurred accessing an NVRAM log.
details.internalDescription: An error occurred accessing an NVRAM log.
details.formatString: Error %d trying to fetch dmi log from NVRAM.

details.customerDescription: A vaulting request was issued due to [reason].
details.internalDescription: A vaulting request was issued due to [reason]. Vaulting will start, and all the directors in the cluster will be shutdown.
details.formatString: A vaulting request was issued due to %s.

details.customerDescription: The director has started vaulting.
details.internalDescription: The director has started vaulting.
details.formatString: The director has started vaulting.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: To prevent data loss, the director has stopped and drained all IOs during the vaulting process.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: To prevent data loss, outstanding IOs have been stopped, future host IOs will not be serviced.

details.customerDescription: Outstanding IOs have been stopped.
details.internalDescription: Outstanding IOs have been stopped.
details.formatString: The director has stopped and drained all IOs.

details.customerDescription: The director has completed vaulting [byteCount] bytes, and will shutdown.
details.internalDescription: The director has completed vaulting [byteCount] bytes, and will shutdown.
details.formatString: The director has completed vaulting %u bytes.

details.customerDescription: The director has started unvaulting.
details.internalDescription: The director has started unvaulting, and will read the vaulted data into its local memory.
details.formatString: The director has started unvaulting.

details.customerDescription: The director has completed unvaulting [byteCount] bytes.
details.internalDescription: The director has completed unvaulting [byteCount] bytes.
details.formatString: The director has completed unvaulting %u bytes.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The recovery of all the vaulted data has started. This process initiates the recovery of all the vaulted data from the local director's memory to VPLEX global cache to establish global cache coherency across all clusters.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The recovery of all the vaulted data has started. Loading vaulted data from the local director's memory to VPLEX global cache.

details.customerDescription: The recovery of all the vaulted data has started.
details.internalDescription: The recovery of all the vaulted data has started.
details.formatString: The director has started vault recovery.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The recovery of all the vaulted data has completed. This cluster will start servicing IOs.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The recovery of all the vaulted data has completed. This cluster will start servicing IOs.

details.customerDescription: The recovery of all the vaulted data has completed.
details.internalDescription: The recovery of all the vaulted data has completed.
details.formatString: The director has completed vault recovery.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Manual vault failed because consistency checks detected that vaulted data is missing or incorrect.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Manual vault failed due to invalid vaulted data.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Re-issue manual vault command.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Re-issue manual vault command. If issue persists, contact EMC Technical Support.

details.customerDescription: Manual vault failed due to invalid vaulted data.
details.internalDescription: Manual vault failed because consistency checks detected that vaulted data is missing or incorrect.
details.formatString: Manual vault failed due to invalid vaulted data.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The director has discarded all vaulted data.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The director has discarded all vaulted data.

details.customerDescription: The director has discarded its vault data. Reason: [DiscardReason]
details.internalDescription: The director has discarded its vault data. Reason: [DiscardReason]
details.formatString: The director has discarded its vault data. Reason: %s

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The cluster has detected a power problem affecting both power zones and is preparing to vault if the problem persists.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The cluster has detected a power problem affecting both power zones and is preparing to vault if the problem persists.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Please verify the status of both power zones in the cluster.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Please verify the status of both power zones in the cluster.

details.customerDescription: The cluster has detected a power problem and is preparing to vault if the problem persists.
details.internalDescription: The cluster has detected a power problem affecting both power zones and is preparing to vault if the problem persists.
details.formatString: Cluster-wide power problem has been detected. Cluster will vault and shutdown if the problem persists.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Sufficient power has been restored and the cluster is no longer preparing to vault.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Sufficient power has been restored and the cluster is no longer preparing to vault.

details.customerDescription: Sufficient power has been restored.
details.internalDescription: Sufficient power has been restored and the cluster is no longer preparing to vault.
details.formatString: Sufficient power restored to cluster before vault and shutdown were necessary. Normal operation resumes.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Vault recovery on the cluster cannot proceed because all director(s) required to complete recovery are either not operational or communicating. This requires manual intervention from the user before IOs will be allowed to resume on any distributed volumes.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: Vault recovery on the cluster cannot proceed because all director(s) required to complete recovery are either not operational or communicating. This requires manual intervention from the user before IOs will be allowed to resume on any distributed volumes.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Customer needs to follow the vault manual intervention procedure in the VPlex troubleshooting guide to proceed.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Customer needs to follow the vault manual intervention procedure in the VPlex troubleshooting guide to proceed.

details.customerDescription: The wait time for missing director(s) to be present before vault recovery has been exceeded.
details.internalDescription: The director waited for [quorum_wait_min] minutes for [missing_director_count] missing director(s) to be present before the cluster can proceed with vault recovery.
details.formatString: The director waited for %d minutes for %d missing directors to be present before the cluster can proceed with vault recovery.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: User issued the command to override the unvault recovery quorum. Cluster will not wait for all the directors required to be present before proceeding with the recovery of the vault.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: User issued the command to override the unvault recovery quorum. Cluster will not wait for all the directors required to be present before proceeding with the recovery of the vault.

details.customerDescription: The command to override unvault recovery quorum has been received.
details.internalDescription: The command to override unvault recovery quorum has been received.
details.formatString: The command to bypass unvault recovery quorum has been received. The director will not wait for all the required directors before proceeding with vault recovery.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The cluster has successfully completed recovering all valid director vaults without data loss.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The cluster has successfully completed recovering all valid director vaults without data loss.

details.customerDescription: The cluster has successfully completed recovering all valid director vaults without data loss.
details.internalDescription: The cluster has successfully completed recovering all valid director vaults without data loss.
details.formatString: The cluster has successfully completed recovering all vaults with no data loss.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The cluster has detected at least two director vaults that could not be recovered. All director vaults in the cluster are being discarded which may cause data loss.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The cluster has detected at least two director vaults that could not be recovered. All director vaults in the cluster are being discarded which may cause data loss.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Data may have been lost on volumes in asynchronous consistency groups. I/O may automatically suspend on all volumes in these consistency groups at all of the participating clusters. Verify the state of all consistency groups and follow the procedures in the VPLEX CLI document for rolling back and resuming these volumes if necessary. The behavior of the cluster when this occurs is similar to a complete cluster failure.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Data may have been lost on volumes in asynchronous consistency groups. I/O may automatically suspend on all volumes in these consistency groups at all of the participating clusters. Verify the state of all consistency groups and follow the procedures in the VPLEX CLI document for rolling back and resuming these volumes if necessary.

details.customerDescription: The cluster could not recover the vaulted data due to an insufficent number of recoverable vaults causing possible data loss.
details.internalDescription: The cluster could not recover the vaulted data due to an insufficent number of recoverable vaults causing possible data loss.
details.formatString: The cluster could not recover the vaulted data due to an insufficent number of recoverable vaults causing possible data loss.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: A director failure has terminated the recovery of all vaults because there is no longer enough recoverable director vaults. All unrecovered vaults in the cluster are being discarded which may cause data loss.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: A director failure has terminated the recovery of all vaults because there is no longer enough recoverable director vaults. All unrecovered vaults in the cluster are being discarded which may cause data loss.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Data may have been lost on volumes in asynchronous consistency groups. I/O will automatically suspend on all volumes in these consistency groups at all of the participating clusters. Verify the state of all consistency groups and follow the procedures in the VPLEX CLI document for resuming these volumes. The behavior of the cluster when this occurs is similar to multiple simultaneous director failures.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Data may have been lost on volumes in asynchronous consistency groups. I/O will automatically suspend on all volumes in these consistency groups at all of the participating clusters. Verify the state of all consistency groups and follow the procedures in the VPLEX CLI document for resuming these volumes.

details.customerDescription: A director failure during the recovery of its vault has resulted in an insufficient number of recovered vaults causing possible data loss.
details.internalDescription: A director failure during recovery of director vaults has resulted in an insufficient number of recovered vaults causing possible data loss.
details.formatString: A director failure during the recovery of its vault has resulted in an insufficient number of recovered vaults causing possible data loss.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: GeoSynchrony has failed three times with not more than 3 minutes of time interval between consecutive failures.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: Broadcast messages are sent by APFO between the directors for co-ordinating path states and failovers. When a directors joins or leaves a cluster, all outstanding broadcast messages are discarded. This ensures only the most upto-date decisions are being processed. A decision for which a broadcast message was discarded is restarted with the new groupId.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: This event is for internal information. This event occurs whenever a director joins or leaves the cluster.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: While this event doesn't indicate failure, check the health of the system.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: While this event doesn't indicate failure, check the health of the system. Contact EMC Technical Support for more information.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The automated backup of metadata cannot identify the devices to be used. This is because existing backups cannot be located. The backups are rotated through being destroyed in order to be re-used.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRCA: The automated backup of metadata cannot identify the devices to be used. This is because existing backups cannot be located. The backups are rotated through being destroyed in order to be re-used.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: Check the health of the backup devices and ensure they are still exposed to VPLEX. If you wish to expose new devices issue the configuration metadata-backup command to reconfigure meta-volume backup.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Check the health of the backup devices and ensure they are still exposed to VPLEX. If you wish to expose new devices issue the configuration metadata-backup command to reconfigure meta-volume backup.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: The previously configured volume may have become unhealthy. A user may have destroyed the backup on the device and consumed it for some other use. If the volume is in an unhealthy state correct the problem and re expose the volume If a volume has been destroyed, re-run configuration metadata-backup.
eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: The previously configured volume may have become unhealthy. A user may have destroyed the backup on the device and consumed it for some other use. eventRCAandRemedy.customerRemedy: Confirm that the volumes configured to be used for the backup are in a healthy state. If the volumes are unhealthy, reconfigure the backups using configuration metadata-backup.

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Cluster Witness Server has changed its state based on its observations.

details.customerDescription: The Cluster Witness Server changed its state.
details.internalDescription: Cluster Witness Server changed its internal state based on its current observation of the clusters.
details.formatString: Cluster Witness Server changed state from %s to %s: (enabled %c, clusterCount %u).

eventRCAandRemedy.internalRCA: The Cluster Witness Server has received a message with unsupported protocol version from one of the clusters. This event may potentially be reported after incorrectly performed upgrade. While this condition persists, connectivity between the Cluster Witness Server and the cluster that reported this event may be severed.
eventRCAandRemedy.internalRemedy: If this condition persists, ensure that software on all directors as well as Cluster Witness Server software is upgraded to a release where Cluster Witness Server and Client use compatible protocol versions.

details.customerDescription: A message with unsupported protocol version has been received from a cluster.
details.internalDescription: The Cluster Witness Server received a message with unsupported protocol version from a cluster.
details.formatString: Cluster Witness Server dropped %u received message(s) with unexpected protocol version (received version in the last message: %u, expected version: %u).
